FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF REDUCTION OF TUITION. THE FELLOW PROGRAM SPANS OVER 2 YEARS AND THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES INSTRUCTIONAL MODULES THROUGHOUT THE DURATION OF THE PROGRAM.
USE OF GRANTS IS MONITORED THROUGH OBSERVATION OF THE ONSITE WORK OF THE RESEARCHERS

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The financial aid office notifies students when our comprehensive endowment scholarship application goes live (first week of february). Once notified, students fill out an application to apply for the respective scholarship. If the scholarship is for a specific program, the dean or other faculty member for that program will review the applications and make recommendations to the financial aid office and who should receive the award. Financial aid verifies again if the student is still eligible for the award and issues the funds to the recommended students. The financial aid office monitors the use of the funds to ensure that they are used for their intended purpose.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO U.S. MANAGEMENT DETERMINES THE ANNUAL GUIDELINE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA AND TRACKED WITH BOARD APPROVED BUDGET. MONTHLY GENERATED REPORTS ARE USED TO MONITOR AWARDS PROGRAM. INDEPENDENT AUDITORS REVIEW ACCURACY OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS AND RECIPIENTS' RECORDS. FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. STUDENT AID IS HANDLED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). THE AWARD IS BASED ON THE INFORMATION IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENTS CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

PRESBYTERIAN COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, AND LOANS TO ITS STUDENTS. THE PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF THE FUNDS ARE PART OF THE FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES AND THEY ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF THE RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN THE PRESBYTERIAN COLLEGE ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE SC DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE ALSO COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A VARIETY OF REQUIREMENTS THAT ARE RELATIVE ONLY TO THE PARTICULAR TYPE OF AWARD TO BE GRANTED. VARIOUS SCHOLARSHIPS AND SIMILAR ALLOCATIONS CAN BE AWARDED BASED ON THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT, THE STUDENT'S YEAR IN SCHOOL, OR ANY OTHER REQUIREMENT THAT MAY BE SPECIFICALLY NOTED IN AN ENDOWMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The Foundation only makes grants to its closely-affiliated organizations. The close connection between all three organizations ensures appropriate and intended use of grant funds.

THE UNIVERSITY UTILIZES THE POWERFAIDS FINANCIAL AID MANAGEMENT SYSTEM WHICH REQUIRES THE END USER TO TIE HIGHLY SPECIFIC ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA TO INDIVIDUAL AID PROGRAMS. DURING EXECUTION OF THE AUTOMATED AWARDING MODULE WITHIN POWERFAIDS AID IS ALLOCATED BASED ON THE PRE-ESTABLISHED CRITERIA ENSURING THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE ONLY DISTRIBUTED TO APPROPRIATE, QUALIFIED RECIPIENTS. POST AUTO-AWARDING A SERIES OF MIS INFORMATION REPORTS PERFORM A STUDENT-BY-STUDENT TEST OF AWARD EFFICACY MONITORING THAT STUDENT GRANT AID HAS BEEN APPROPRIATELY DISTRIBUTED. WITHIN THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS SYSTEM AND GENERAL LEDGER STUDENT GRANT PROGRAMS EXPENDITURES ARE ASSIGNED SUB-CODES THAT UNIQUELY IDENTIFY THEM AS SUCH THUS PROHIBITING ANY INADVERTANT OR INAPPROPRIATE DISTRIBUTION. THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED APPROPRIATE CONTROLS THROUGH SEPARATION OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND INTERNAL AUDIT PROCEDURES THAT PRECLUDE ANY ENTITY WITHIN THE ADMINISTRATIVE STRUCTURE FROM DIVERTING STUDENT GRANT AID TO NONQUALIFIED USES.

ExplntnTxt: THE ADMISSION DEPARTMENT AND OTHER DEPARTMENTS WILL FORWARD REPORTS TO THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT INDICATING WHICH STUDENTS QUALIFIED FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS.

The Office of Financial Aid administers the following policies to assure that institutional grants and scholarships are used for proper purposes: The aggregate of institutional funds that an individual student receives is restricted to an amount equivalent to tuition and fees; Enrollment is confirmed each semester prior to disbursement of institutional funds; Eligibility for academic scholarships is limited to a maximum of eight (8) semesters. Renewal grade point average requirements are checked at the end of each academic year; Eligibility for institutional general grants requires a demonstration of need based on submission of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FASFA); Endowed scholarships have selection criteria specific to each fund and the Director of Financial Aid oversees the selection of eligible students; when a student withdraws from school, the percentage adjustments made to institutional aid are the same as the percentage adjustments made to tuition as specified in the catalog.

BETHANY LUTHERAN COLLEGE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

TLU FOLLOWS THE RULES AND REGULATIONS IN TERMS OF PROCEDURES PROVIDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. PRIVATE GRANTS ARE HANDLED BY THE DEVELOPMENT OFFICE AND ALL REQUIRED REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE TEXAS HIGHER EDUCATION COORDINATING BOARD. ADDITIONALLY, TLU UNDERGOES AN AUDIT AS SET FORTH IN THE SINGLE AUDIT ACT AND OMB CIRCULAR A-133.
FELLOWSHIP PAYMENTS ARE MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCE PERSONNEL THROUGH THE UTILIZATION OF ENROLLMENT DOCUMENTATION AND DETAILED ATTENDANCE RECORDS PROVIDED BY PROGRAM OFFICERS.

Grants are made to students currently attending the seminary to enable them to live and study near the Puritan Reformed Theological Seminary. The Seminary is aware of the needs of the students and is able to monitor the use of the funds provided.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS ARE PAID BASED ON A COMPREHENSIVE APPLICATION PROCESS.
D.R.E.A.M. PARTNERSHIP MAINTAINS ALL NECESSARY GRANT DOCUMENTATION. ALSO, GRANTS ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE PROCESSES FINANCIAL AID REQUESTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICERS FIRST DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF FEDERAL AND STATE STUDENT AID THAT THE STUDENT WILL RECEIVE. STUDENTS ARE THEN AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON THEIR AVAILABLE RESOURCES AND OUTSTANDING CHARGES.

ACADEMIC AWARDS ARE MONITORED AT THE TIME OF ADMISSION. ALL STUDENTS ARE REVIEWED FOR ACADEMIC AWARD ELIGIBILITY. THE SAME CRITERIA IS USED FOR ALL STUDENTS, INTERNATIONAL OR NOT. IF STUDENTS ARE ELIGIBLE THEY ARE NOTIFIED ALONG WITH THEIR OFFER OF ADMISSION. RENEWAL IS BASED, AMONG OTHER THINGS, ON CUMULATIVE GPA, RESIDENTIAL STATUS, ETC. FRANCISCAN INSTITUTE (FI) AWARDS ARE REVIEWED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND AMOUNTS ARE DETERMINED BY FI. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE IN ADDITION TO ACADEMIC AWARDS AND ARE DETERMINED BASED ON THE SPORT, NCAA STANDARDS, INTERNAL FUNDS AVAILABILITY, AND NEGOTIATIONS BETWEEN THE COACH AND ATHLETE.

OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS. ALL FUNDS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SERVICE TO COMMUNITY, LEADERSHIP AND INVOLVEMENT IN SCHOOL ACTIVITIES. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS ARE OFFERED FOR FOUR YEARS OF STUDY FOR FRESHMEN AND UNTIL THE COMPLETION OF DEGREE REQUIREMENTS FOR TRANSFER STUDENTS. ALL STUDENTS MUST MEET THE STATED CRITERIA TO MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY. GRANTS EARNED BY THE STUDENT FROM EXTERNAL FUNDING SOURCES ARE FULLY CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT WITHOUT REDUCING ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS AND AWARDS OFFERED BY OTTAWA UNIVERSITY. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO STUDENTS PARTICIPATING IN SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES BASED ON A COMPETITIVE REVIEW BY THE GRANTING DEPARTMENT. ACTIVITY AWARDS ARE AVAILABLE IN MUSIC, ART, THEATRE, FORENSICS, AND DEBATE. ATHLETIC AWARDS ARE OFFERED ON THE BASIS OF AN EVALUATION BY THE COACH OF EACH SPORT. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY OFFERS NEED BASED GRANTS TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE AN EXCEPTIONAL LEVEL OF NEED AND THE POTENTIAL TO SUCCEED. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO BEING A RESIDENTIAL CAMPUS. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE OFFERED TO ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO LIVE ON-CAMPUS. OTTAWA UNIVERSITY IS ABLE TO HELP STUDENTS MEET A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF THE DIRECT COST OF EDUCATION THROUGH A COMBINATION OF RESOURCES. STUDENTS ARE HIGHLY ENCOURAGED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR ADDITIONAL GRANTS, WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND LOW-INTEREST LOANS. THE ADMINISTRATIVE SOFTWARE MONITORS FINANCIAL AID ON AN ONGOING BASIS FOR GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER AID THAT MAY BE PENDING, AWARDED, ETC. THIS INFORMATION IS THEN POSTED TO THE GENERAL LEDGER AS WELL FOR BALANCING/REPORTING PURPOSES.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BY REVIEWING STUDENT NEED BASED ON THE FAFSA REPORT, AWARDING BASED ON PRE-DETERMINED AID CRITERIA, AND MONITORING THE STUDENT STATUS EACH TERM.

The process for monitoring the use of tuition discount or grants/scholarship funds at Mars Hill College includes the use of a matrix that limits and determines the amount of academic scholarship awarded with a maximum of $7000. The Dean of Admissions and Financial Aid and the Director of Financial Aid meet monthly to review the current amount of tuition discount or grants/scholarships being awarded to ensure that the college stays within budget. Tuition discount, grant and scholarship reports are submitted to the President on a regular basis. the budget for these grants is approved by the Board of Trustees on an annual basis. The Dean of Admissions and Financial Aid and the Director of Financial Aid monitor all tuition discount financial aid awards prior to the award letter being mailed. Athletic grants are monitored by coaches and the Athletic Director with strict guidelines established by NCAA. The Athletic Director reports regularly to the President of the college the amount of tuition discount athletic grants awarded by each team per year.

BENEDICTINE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTERS FEDERAL TITLE IV, STATE, PRIVATE AND INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS IN THE FORM OF STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, WAIVERS AND AWARDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID FOLLOWS SPECIFIC GRANT PROGRAM CRITERIA TO: DETERMINE STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION; MONITOR APPROPRIATE HANDLING OF FUNDS, AND; MEET REPORTING AND RECORD RETENTION REQUIREMENTS. DOCUMENTATION OF ALL STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FUNDING IS MAINTAINED IN THE STUDENTS AID FILE AND UNIVERSITY COMPUTER SYSTEM.

SCHOLARSHIPS & FINANCIAL AID ARE AVAILABLE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. A FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION IS REQUIRED TO BE COMPLETED AND SUBMITTED. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE MADE UP OF THE FACULTY AND THE DIRECTOR OF ADMISSIONS.

INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED BASED ON BOTH A FINANCIAL NEED AND MERIT BASIS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS AND THE USE OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA AND THE INSTITUTIONAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA. MERIT AID IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET CERTAIN ACADEMIC CRITERIA WHO MAY OR MAY NOT ALSO HAVE FINANCIAL NEED FOR ASSISTANCE. CAMPUS BASED FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM FEDERAL AND STATE SOURCES IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AS STIPULATED BY FEDERAL OR STATE GUIDELINES. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED BY THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS AND THE USE OF THE FEDERAL METHODOLOGY NEED ANALYSIS FORMULA.
Scholarships are awarded based on established criteria, including donor restrictions. Global prizes are awarded to organizations for transformative social justice leadership projects.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 1 MAINTAINING RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE GRANTEE'S ELIGIBILITY
ExplntnTxt: MAINTAINING RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE GRANTEE'S ELIGIBILITY, AMOUNT OF AWARD, AND SELECTION CRITERIA THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES MAINTAINS RECORDS AS TO STUDENTS FINANCIAL AND ACADEMIC STANDING AND THE Eligibility REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT. THE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES AN AUDIT UNDER OMB's Uniform Guidance as a review of COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE RULES AND REGULATIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE STUDENTS FINANCIAL AND ACADEMIC STANDING IS MONITORED BY THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES TO ENSURE THAT THE STUDENTS REMAIN IN GOOD STANDING AND CONTINUE TO MEET ANY SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP OR GRANT. THE UNIVERSITY UNDERGOES AN AUDIT (REQUIRED BY OMB'S UNIFORM GUIDANCE) TO AUDIT COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE RULES AND REGULATIONS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College campus. The campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GENERALLY APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S BURSAR'S OFFICE.

GENEVA COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS BASED UPON THE FOLLOWING: THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS BASED ON MERIT AND FINANCIAL NEED. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND BUSINESS OFFICE MAINTAIN RECORDS ON WHAT STUDENTS ARE AWARDED, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS SPECIFIC CRITERIA THAT MUST BE FOLLOWED IN AWARDING AID TO STUDENTS. THE CRITERIA FOR AWARDING AID IS DOCUMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College campus. The campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: To ensure proper use of the grants awarded, USAC credits the grant amount directly to the program fee on the students account limiting its diversion to unintended uses.

SAINT PETER'S UNIVERSITY ("UNIVERSITY") PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY FOR VARIOUS REASONS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, STUDENT INSTITUTIONAL AID AND ATHLETICS. THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Gannon awards scholarships to freshmen and transfer students who meet eligibility standards for merit based aid such as academic and leadership awards. In addition, need based aid is considered for students who demonstrate financial need by filing the required applications and adhering to deadlines. Award packages are renewed each year to students that remain in academically good standing and continue to meet the required eligibility standards for both types of merit and need based aid. Students need not apply for specific scholarships since they will automatically receive consideration for all funds for which they may be eligible when they submit the FAFSA.

All students who are applying for Federal financial aid are required to complete the FAFSA and the Gordon-Conwell financial aid application. The information obtained from these documents is used by the Financial Aid Office to determine eligibility of Federal and institutional aid. To assist with determining their eligibility, each student is assigned an institutional budget for the cost of attendance. This budget includes tuition, books and fees, room and board, health insurance, transportation, and a miscellaneous category. In general, Gordon-Conwell scholarships are either need-based or merit-based and any Gordon-Conwell aid that is awarded is factored into the eligibility for Federal aid.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS TO ENABLE THEM TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY. ALL FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BASED ON THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

GRANT APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE APPROPRIATE FINANCIAL AID PROFESSIONALS. UPON APPROVAL, FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AS AN OFFSET AGAINST CHARGES SUCH AS TUITION AND FEES. GRANTS CANNOT EXCEED THE STUDENT'S COST OF ATTENDANCE (COA). IN THE EVENT THAT THE COA IS REDUCED DUE TO A DECREASE IN THE STUDENT'S COURSE LOAD OR OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES IMPACTING SCHOOL CHARGES, THE RELATED GRANT IS ACCORDINGLY REDUCED.
the monies are credited directly to the student accounts and never exceed the costs charged.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College Campus. The Campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

Disbursements in furtherance of the institution's exempt programs are made in accordance with procedures or subject to conditions established by the institution's governing board designed to insure that individuals and organizations receiving disbursements from this organization in furtherance of its exempt programs are adequately investigated to insure that they are qualifying recipients as to academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards.
The Office of Financial Aid determines eligibility for institutional financial aid based on financial need and/or academic performance.

THESE FUNDS REPRESENT FINANCIAL AID ISSUED TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF FEDERAL AND STATE GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, TUITION DISCOUNTS, AND INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FROM FRANCISCAN UNIVERSITY ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE THEY MEET THE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS OR OTHER CRITERIA ASSOCIATED WITH THE RESPECTIVE AWARD. ALL AID IS PROCESSED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND IS POSTED TO THE STUDENTS' RECEIVABLE ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING A FAFSA FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE REGULATIONS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM AID MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL GRANT FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AUTHORIZED AMOUNTS FROM THE FUNDING AGENCY. THE COLLEGE ALSO IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT AN ANNUAL INDEPENDENT A-133 AUDIT TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR GRANT ASSISTANCE. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING ALL INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE. CONTINUING STUDENTS APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIP AID BY COMPLETING A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION FORM WHICH CAPTURES THE DATA REQUIRED TO DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY BASED ON INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. ENTERING STUDENTS ARE AUTOMATICALLY CONSIDERED FOR SCHOLARSHIP BASED ON THE COLLEGE'S AUDITION AND INTERVIEW PROCESS. DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT ELIGIBILITY IS KEPT FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ON FILE IN THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE. WHEN FUNDS ARE AWARDED, STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MONITORED THROUGH THE COLLEGE'S OPERATIONAL SYSTEM SCHOLARSHIP MODULE TO ENSURE THERE ARE NO CHANGES IN STATUS THAT MIGHT AFFECT THEIR ONGOING ELIGIBILITY. TOTAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AWARDED ARE TRACKED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH BUDGETED AMOUNTS. THE SCHOLARSHIP OFFICE REVIEWS ALL AWARDS EACH SEMESTER TO DETERMINE THAT THE STUDENT IS STILL ELIGIBLE FOR THE SCHOLARSHIP.

FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR TUITION AND FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, BOOKS AND OTHER SCHOOL RELATED SUPPLIES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE BURSAR TO ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO THE PROPER ACCOUNT AND PROPERLY UTILIZED TO STAY IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE GRANT'S RESTRICTIONS.

The financial aid planning office requires students to complete the free application for federal student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based on certain academic credentials or performance in a university sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the university catalog and the university website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitred by the university.
GRANT PROCESS SCHOLARSHIPS TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE COLLEGE OR TRUST INSTRUMENT WHO ESTABLISHED THE SCHOLARSHIP FUND.

The University consistently strives to place an outstanding higher education within the financial reach of all qualified applicants. The University awards millions of dollars in federal and state financial aid funds each year based upon a student's financial need. Additionally, the University provides financial aid via University grants-in-aid , scholarships, and tuition remission. Grants-in-Aid are awarded on the basis of demonstrated financial need assessed by the use of a standard financial aid application, currently the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA), which analyzes the family income data provided on the FAFSA through the mandated Federal Methodology. All need-based financial aid must be awarded according to a student's calculated financial need. Scholarship awards are primarily provided on scholastic achievement. University scholarships are highly competitive and available to students through a combination of academic achievement and personal commitment, display of values, compassion, and pursuit of excellence which embody the spirit and mission of the University. The University has many scholarships funded through special endowments and donations. In most instances, academic merit and financial need are considered along with the particular requirements of the scholarship selection process. Also, various associations, corporations, foundations, and unions provide scholarships for recipients whom they select.
MONITORING OF GRANT USE ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Potential grant recipients complete application forms specific to particular grant funding sources. The Financial Aid office reviews applications to assure that eligibility requirements such as GPA, credit hours, residency and enrollment status are met. Student applicants receive an award letter identifying the funding programs and award amounts are applied as non-cash credit to student accounts receivable to further assure that proceeds are utilized for the intended purposes. The Registrar's office provides information such as withdrawal notices to facilitate the Financial Aid office in periodically monitoring eligibility criteria and assuring that funds not utilized for the intended purpose are returned to the original funding program.
THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA ON AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT BASIS.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, FINANCIAL AID HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO STUDENT TUITION BILLS.

The grantee, Auburn University Foundation, is a section 501(c)(3) entity that is the sole member of the Real Estate Foundation. Within its financial system, the Auburn University Foundation has funds specifically established for receipting and administering the grants to it from the Real Estate Foundation whose sole purpose is to benefit and support the Auburn University Foundation. The administration/management of the Auburn University Foundation and the Real Estate Foundation are performed by the same personnel who have access to both financial systems for monitoring compliance. Part I, Line 2: The grantee, Auburn University, is a section 115 entity. As a land-grant institution of higher education, its major source of funds are federal and state appropriations and therefore, its disbursements are governed by federal and Alabama state laws. Its transactions are subject to public disclosure. The Auburn University Real Estate Foundation, Inc. has access to the financial records. Grants designated for a specific purpose are credited to a fund established for that purpose. The University's procurement and payment services office ensures compliance with the fund's restrictions subject to any applicable laws.

PROCEDURES FOR APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID: whenever possible, catawba college will supplement the financial resources of a student through merit performance-based and need-based scholarships and grants. A potential student applies and is accepted to Catawba College. At the time of their acceptance, merit aid is determined by the Admissions counselor accepting the application based on a Matrix Chart that has been set up with regard to GPA and SAT scores, living on or off campus, and a separate transfer student matrix. scholarships are applied directly to the students' account and, thus, must be used for educational purposes. With regards to athletics at Catawba College, the Financial Aid Office monitors all athletes to make sure they do not go over conference regulations regarding books and supplies. Catawba College refers to the NCAA Division II Manual for policies regarding student athletes. The Financial Aid Director signs off on the Squad Lists and checks for eligibility with the Compliance Director. The Associate Director of Financial Aid is responsible for entering the athletic information into the CAI system. The CAI system is also used to determine equivalency computations.

VIRTUALLY ALL UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE TIED TO THE STUDENTS' GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA) OR BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ANNUALLY, THE GPA AND NEED ARE REVIEWED TO DETERMINE COMPLIANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY STANDARD. IF A STUDENT'S GPA FALLS BELOW THE MINIMUM REQUIREMENT, THE SCHOLARSHIP IS EITHER REMOVED OR REDUCED BY HALF. STUDENTS CAN APPEAL TO HAVE THE SCHOLARSHIP RESTORED IF THEIR GPA RETURNS TO THE REQUIRED LEVEL. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CARRIED FORWARD EACH YEAR ONCE THE STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FAFSA. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO CERTAIN LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL AND NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURAL SUPPORT TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE ASSISTANCE IS CONSIDERED A DONATION AND THE UNIVERSITY DOES NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE USE OF THE FUNDS.

GRANTS (FEDERAL/STATE) PASSED THROUGH TO STUDENTS ARE MONITORED USING OUR INTERNAL APPLICATION (POWERFAIDS), THE STATE (PHEAA) AND FEDERAL (COD-COMMON ORIGINATION AND DISBURSEMENT) ELECTRONIC SYSTEMS. A VALIDATION OF RECORDS AMONG ALL THREE SYSTEMS IS CONDUCTED PERIODICALLY THROUGHOUT THE ACADEMIC YEAR AND FOR SEMESTER END RECONCILIATIONS. THOSE SYSTEMS VERIFY THE CRITERIA FOR THE GRANTS HAVE BEEN MET AND THE DOLLAR AMOUNTS RECEIVED HAVE BEEN DISTRIBUTED APPROPRIATELY.

THE COLLEGE OFFERS SEVERAL SCHOLARSHIP OPPORTUNITIES FOR STUDENTS. THE PRIMARY SCHOLARSHIPS AND THE GUIDELINES FOR QUALIFYING ARE: FOUNDERS SCHOLARSHIPS - THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS UPON ACCEPTANCE TO A BACHELOR OF SCIENCE DEGREE PROGRAM AT VAUGHN. TO BE CONSIDERED, APPLICANTS MUST ATTAIN A CUMULATIVE HIGH SCHOOL AVERAGE OF AT LEAST A "B AND A COMBINED SAT1 SCORE OF AT LEAST 1000. STUDENTS WHO MEET THESE MINIMUM CRITERIAS WILL BE CONSIDERED FOR AWARDS, BASED ON THEIR GRADES AND EXAM SCORES, BY VAUGHN COLLEGE'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. THE AWARDS MAY BE RENEWABLE FOR UP TO FOUR YEARS OF CONSECUTIVE STUDY, PROVIDING THE RECIPIENT MAINTAINS A 3.0 CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE (GPA). BOARD OF TRUSTEES, #14 AND #36 GRANTS - THESE GRANTS ALLOCATE FUNDS TO BE USED IN AWARDING GRANT-IN-AID ASSISTANCE TO NEW AND CONTINUING STUDENTS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO ARE MATRICULATING ON A FULL OR PART-TIME BASIS IN BACHELOR AND ASSOCIATE DEGREE PROGRAMS. RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON THE BASIS OF THEIR ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND FINANCIAL AID STATUS. AWARDS ARE DESIGNATED FOR A SPECIFIC ACADEMIC YEAR AND ARE RENEWABLE EACH SEMESTER BASED ON SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. TRANSFER STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP - STUDENTS WHO TRANSFER TO THE COLLEGE HAVING COMPLETED 24 OR MORE CREDITS AT AN ACCREDITED COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY, AND WHO HAVE ACHIEVED A CUMULATIVE GRADE POINT AVERAGE OF AT LEAST 3.0 (INCLUDING ALL COURSES AT EVERY INSTITUTION ATTENDED) MAY BE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS TO TRANSFER. THE AWARDS MAY BE RENEWABLE FOR UP TO THREE YEARS OF CONSECUTIVE STUDY, PROVIDING THE RECIPIENT MAINTAINS A 3.0 CUMULATIVE GPA. ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE SCHOLARSHIPS - ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED EACH YEAR TO CONTINUING STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF OUTSTANDING ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND SELECTION FOR ACADEMIC HONORS. THE CRITERIA APPLIED IN DECIDING ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS INCLUDE CUMULATIVE GPA AND SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF AT LEAST TWO SEMESTERS (29 CREDITS/UNITS OR MORE) AS A MATRICULATED STUDENT.

PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A COMPUTERIZED SYSTEM WITH INTEGRATED CONTROLS TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED CRITERIA AS APPROVED BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND FEDERAL AND STATE AUTHORITIES, AS APPROPRIATE. A SERIES OF REPORTS HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED AND ARE USED BY MANAGEMENT TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS ANY EXCEPTIONS. ANNUALLY, THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID AWARDING PROCESS IS AUDITED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE COLLEGE ISSUES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WHO ARE REQUIRED TO MATRICULATE AT THE COLLEGE. THE STUDENT DOES NOT HAVE ANY DISCRETION ON HOW FUNDS ARE USED; ALL FUNDS ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COSTS OF PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROGRAM, THEREFORE, THE COLLEGE IS NOT REQUIRED TO FURTHER MONITOR THE USE OF THE FUNDS. PROCESS FOR MONITORING GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO GOVERNMENTS AND ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT AND CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. IN EACH CASE, THE COLLEGE IS AWARE OF THE CHARITABLE USE OF THE FUNDS, WHICH IS TYPICALLY FOR THE GENERAL PURSUIT OF THE RECEIVING ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSES AND NOT EARMARKED FOR A SPECIFIC USE. THE COLLEGE BELIEVES IN EACH INSTANCE THAT THESE FORMS OF ASSISTANCE ARE IN THE COLLEGE'S BEST INTEREST IN PROMOTING ITS IMAGE AND THE PURSUIT OF ITS EXEMPT PURPOSE.

PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE THE U.S. The College offers a wide variety of merit and need-based scholarships and awards to matriculating students. Merit awards are given in recognition of various achievements as specified in donors' correspondence and documents, or by College policy. Need-based awards are provided based on the income level, availability of awards offered elsewhere and similar standards. The College's Financial Aid Office uses various methods for the fair disbursement of grant funds within the requirements set by each grant source to monitor compliance. The College primarily makes scholarship grants that help offset tuition and other educational costs of the students, with most directly credited against the applicable student account, which assures proper use. The amount of the grant is adjusted by the Financial Aid Office, as necessary, based on any subsequent changes affecting the student's original eligibility.

There is a publication of available scholarships and the criteria to qualify for each one. Students complete an application indicating which scholarship(s) they are applying for. These applications are reviewed by the registrar's office during the registration process and qualifying students are determined. Of the $131,815 of financial assistance awarded during the FYE 5/31/16, $125,790 were scholarships which were applied as a credit against the students' tuition. The remaining $6,500 of financial assistance was distributed as cash to students who qualified for scholarships funded by outside sources.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDES PAYMENT OF THE GRANTS TO THE STUDENT AS A CREDIT TO THE STUDENTS' RECEIVABLE ACCOUNT; THE GRANTS ARE NOT DIRECTLY PAID TO THE STUDENTS. FOR THE GRANT TO BE AVAILABLE TO THE STUDENT, THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE STUDENTS ENROLLMENT AND THE STUDENT MUST BE ENROLLED AND ACTIVE FOR THE TIME PERIOD THE GRANT IS OFFERED. IF THE STUDENT LEAVES THE PROGRAM EARLY, THE GRANT IS NOT REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT AND THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IS RATABLY ADJUSTED TO REFLECT THE INCOMPLETE PERIOD.

Grants to individuals cover tuition for students attending the college. Transportation and medical expenses are generally paid directly on behalf of grantees. Students who meet eligibility requirements are provided grants for daily essentials. Grants to domestic organizations are made on a reimbursement basis after submission of receipts.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED UPON THE CRITERIA ESTABLISHED WITH EACH GRANT. FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL MONITOR EACH GRANT ALONG WITH THE TOTAL AID RECEIVED BY EACH STUDENT TO ENSURE THAT INDIVIDUALS AS WELL AS COLLECTIVE AWARDS ARE WITHIN THE GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY STATE AND FEDERAL GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES.

GRANTS ISSUED BY IMMACULATA UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANTS AWARDED AS PART OF FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED BY THE UNIVERSITY TO OFFSET BILLED AMOUNTS (I.E. TUITION) ON THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, THEREBY REDUCING THE NET BALANCE DUE TO THE UNIVERSITY. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ASSESSED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENTS, FINANCIAL NEEDS, AND SIMILAR STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College campus. The campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A FAFSA. ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED BY THE APPLICABLE FEDERAL AND STATE GUIDELINES, BY THEIR ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS, AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS ARE APPROPRIATELY AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE AWARDS ARE TRANSFERRED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE. ALL SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT FUNDS ARE RECONCILED EACH SEMESTER AND REPORTED TO THE APPROPRIATE AUTHORITIES OR AGENCIES. FUNDS ARE ALSO AUDITED ANNUALLY.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WHICH IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF APPLYING SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS, DONOR RESTRICTIONS ON ENDOWMENT INCOME TO BE USED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND INTERNAL POLICIES FOR INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS IN RELATION TO ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS.

REGULAR REPORTING IS ONE OF THE OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS SPECIFIED IN THE GUIDELINES OF THE AWARD LETTER. THE AWARD LETTER SPECIFIES THE TERMS OF THE GRANT, INCLUDING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS AND THE REQUIRED REPORTING SCHEDULE. NARRATIVE REPORTS SHOULD DESCRIBE THE ACTIVITIES UNDERTAKEN AND EVALUATE THE PROGRESS TOWARD ACHIEVING THE PURPOSES OF THE GRANT DURING THE REPORTING PERIOD.
