FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE NETTED AGAINST STUDENT TUITION ACCOUNTS.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES AND PROCESSES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY. FUNDS ISSUED TO STUDENTS MAY NOT EXCEED THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AND ARE POSTED TO THE SAME STUDENT ACCOUNT WHERE TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD ARE POSTED.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER TYPES OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE MONITORED BY PROCEDURES THAT INSURE INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISBURSEMENTS ARE QUALIFIED TO RECEIVE THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE BASED ON THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT OF FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND OTHER SIMILAR NEEDS.

ELIGIBILITY FOR THE SCHOOLS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS DETERMINED USING THE FEDERAL NEEDS ANALYSIS METHODOLOGY AS SET FORTH BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. THE MONIES USED TO GRANT ASSISTANCE TO THE STUDENTS COMES OUT OF THE GENERAL OPERATING FUND FROM UNRESTRICTED DONATIONS.

GRANTS ARE SCHOLARSHIPS GIVEN TO UNIVERSITY AND COLLEGES FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING STUDY ABROAD PROGRAMS HELD AT THE AMERICAN UNIVERSITY OF ROME IN ROME, ITALY. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY SCHOLAR MERIT AND OR FINANCIAL NEED.
THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS TO OFFSET THE COST OF TUITION, FEES, AND ROOM AND BOARD.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AS DEMONSTRATED BY THE RESULTS FROM FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONORS.

The college's financial aid office awards scholarships to students based on eligibility criteria predetermined by donors and college policies. All awards are applied to tuition and related education expenses only.

AUGUSTANA HAS A POLICY AND PROCEDURE MANUAL THAT IS FOLLOWED WHEN DETERMINING NEED AND THE ORDER IN WHICH GRANTS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS. GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED THROUGH ELECTRONIC COMPLIANCE CHECKS IN OUR STUDENT DATA SOFTWARE. CHECKS AND BALANCES ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE PROPER AUTHORIZATION AND DISBURSEMENT OF FEDERAL FUNDS. INDIVIDUALS THAT HAVE RESPONSIBILITY FOR THESE FUNCTIONS ARE ORGANIZED INDEPENDENTLY FROM ONE ANOTHER.
Grant funds are recorded in a project account so that all associated revenues and expenses are accounted for related to a specific grant.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PART I, LINE 2 - Procedures for Monitoring the use of grant funds
ExplntnTxt: SCHOLARSHIP/DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT MAINTAINED WITH OLLU.

THE COLLEGE'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE IS COMPRISED OF INDIVIDUALS FROM THE DIFFERENT DIVISIONS OF THE COLLEGE. THIS COMMITTEE DEVELOPS SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP AVAILABLE FROM THE COLLEGE. COMMITTEE-DEVELOPED APPLICATIONS ARE REQUIRED FROM ALL APPLICANTS. THE COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL APPLICATIONS RECEIVED BY DEADLINE, AND SCORES EACH APPLICATION BASED ON A RUBRIC DEVELOPED FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP. BASED ON THE RUBRIC SCORES, IT SELECTS INDIVIDUALS FOR THE INTERVIEW PROCESS. THOSE APPLICANTS ARE INTERVIEWED AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED. PELL GRANT AMOUNTS ARE DETERMINED USING THE CHARTS PROVIDED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. CODES ARE ENTERED INTO THE COLLEAGUE SOFTWARE BASED ON THOSE CALCULATIONS AND THE SOFTWARE ASSIGNS AMOUNTS BASED ON THOSE CODES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 The awarding of student financial aid grants under the U.S. Department of Education's Student Financial Assistance Program is monitored by the College's Financial Aid Office, which ensures that the College meets the compliance requirements of OMB Circular A-133. The College's Financial Aid Office is responsible for establishing and maintaining effective internal control over compliance with the requirements of laws, regulations, contracts, and grants applicable to federal programs. Monitoring of federal and foundation grants supporting College operating activities is coordinated between the Financial Aid Office, the Chancellor's office, the Controller's office and the VP of Institutional Advancement. These offices and individuals ensure that appropriate controls are established and that grant requirements for documentation, tracking, expenditure of funds and reporting are met. All students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, athletic ability and other similar standards.

THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOLLOWS ALL REGULATIONS WHEN AWARDING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS. STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY IS REVIEWED EACH TERM TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH AWARDING INSTITUTIONAL, FEDERAL AND STATE AID WITH POLICY AND PROCEDURES. THE COLLEGE ALSO FILES ANNUAL STATE GRANT YEAR END REPORTING, FISAP AND IPEDS DATA. STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON THEIR PER TERM STANDING AND AID IS EVALUATED BASED ON THEIR ENROLLMENT.

Shorter Univerity participates in the student financial assistance programs through the U.S. Department of Education. Funds are awarded and applied to student accounts based on the Department of Education guidelines set forth by the Title IV programs.

Procedures for monitoring of scholarships - The Business Office notifies the Financial Aid Office of amounts available to award to students each academic year. The Financial Aid Office selects recipients based upon criteria established for each type of funding. The Financial Aid Office notifies the Business Office of expenditures for each term during the academic year. At year-end, the Financial Aid Office and Business Office reconcile accounts for all funds. The Development Office provides annual reports to the donors regarding the use of donor-contributed scholarship funds (endowed or annually funded). Procedures for monitoring research grants - There are several different departments that offer research grants at Willamette. Each department has different monitoring procedures for the use of grant funds. However, the monitoring procedures typically involve the following: a written and/or verbal report on the research project must be submitted during and/or at the conclusion of the project; receipts must be submitted for reimbursement of project expenditures. Final payment of grant funds is often contingent on the aforementioned items. The Department that awards the grants handles the related monitoring of those grant funds. Procedures for monitoring other awards and prizes - Award/prize recipients are determined by criteria established by the respective departments. Departments work with the Accounting Office to make sure that the award funds are disbursed to the correct student or faculty member.

The financial aid planning office at Anderson University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the University does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University to ensure students remain eligible for funds awarded.

Procedures for Monitoring the Use of Grant Funds THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS BASED ON SUPERIOR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING AWARDS FROM JOHN CARROLL UNIVERSITY ARE CHOSEN BASED UPON OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY.

A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE INSTITUTION AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED TO PERSONS HAVING AN INTEREST IN THE INSTITUTION, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND MUSIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

WHEN DETERMINING THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL AID A STUDENT WILL RECEIVE, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FIRST CALCULATES HOW MUCH THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD. THIS CALCULATION RELIES ON TWO PRIMARY SOURCES OF INFORMATION: 1) A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA); AND 2) A FINANCIAL AID PROFILE; BOTH OF WHICH ARE COMPLETED BY THE FAMILY. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS A FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE THAT FILLS THE GAP BETWEEN THE CALCULATED AMOUNT THE STUDENT'S FAMILY CAN REASONABLY AFFORD AND THE COST OF ATTENDING MACALESTER COLLEGE. SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE COLLEGE'S AWARDS SMALL GRANTS TO NEIGHBORHOOD ORGANIZATIONS WORKING TO MAKE OUR NEIGHBORHOOD A VIBRANT PLACE TO LIVE, AND TO LOCAL NEIGHBORHOOD COUNCILS COMMITTED TO AREA LIVABILITY ISSUES. GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A REPORT DESCRIBING USE OF GRANT FUNDS AT LEAST ANNUALLY OR AT THE CLOSE OF A SPECIFIC PROJECT. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES SUBAWARDS FROM GRANT FUNDS OT ORGANIZATIONS THAT AID IN THE RESEARCH BEING CONDUCTED. SUBRECIPIENTS MUST SUBMIT DETAILED REPORTS OF EXPENDITURES BEFORE MACALESTER WILL REIMBURSE THEM.
ALL STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR TUITION AND RELATED EXPENSES AT THE COLLEGE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO ENROLLED STUDENTS. GRANTS ARE CREDITED TO THE RECIPIENTS' ACCOUNTS FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY REGISTRAR AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR GPA REQUIREMENTS, ENROLLMENT REQUIREMENTS AND OTHER ISSUES. REVIEWS ARE DONE REGULARLY.

All University spending must be approved by a manager or higher level, depending on the amount of the expenditure. Any expenditure of $1,000 or above would have to be approved by a Dean or other budget center manager. An expenditure in excess of $10,000 must be approved by a Vice President (or that person's designee) or the President. Grants or assistance to outside organizations are segregated in the University's financial accounting system through the use of a separate account code, which allows for review by University's central finance department. Scholarships are provided to students who are required to matriculate in the University, thereby ensuring that the funds are expended for the intended purposes.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Part II,Line 1, (h) Purpose of grant assistance:
ExplntnTxt: Village of South Orange - Construction of South Orange Performing Arts Center.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, BRANDMAN UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.BRANDMAN.EDU.
The Organization tracks the use of the funds awarded. Amounts used and unused are tracked annually and justified at fiscal year end.
Assistance is given to individuals in the form of credits toward the cost of tuition, and a record of the assistance provided is recorded in separate accounts maintained for each student/recipient.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Procedure for Monitoring Use of Grant Funds Inside U.S.
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 A report is run at the end of each semester to review each student's cumulative GPA and progress toward their degree. Students receiving merit awards who fail to achieve good academic standing are reviewed for alternative institutional funding. Every effort is made to find alternative funding for students not meeting good academic standing.

IONA COLLEGE GIVES AID TO STUDENTS IN TWO FORMS: MERIT AID AND NEEDS BASED AID. THE AMOUNT OF MERIT AID A STUDENT RECEIVES IS BASED ON A CALCULATED ACADEMIC INDEX THAT IS DERIVED FROM THEIR GPA & SAT SCORES. NEED BASED AID IS DETERMINED FROM THE STUDENT EFC. STUDENTS ARE GIVEN THESE AWARDS UPON ACCEPTANCE TO THE COLLEGE AND THE AWARDS ARE RENEWED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS ASSUMING THE STUDENT MEETS THE REQUIRED CUMULATIVE GPA AND THEIR NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE FAFSA HAS NOT CHANGED. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED BY THE COLLEGE ARE INTENDED TO BE USED TO DEFRAY TUITION COSTS AND ENABLE STUDENTS TO MATRICULATE AT IONA COLLEGE, THE STUDENT HAS NO DISCRETION ON HOW TO EXPEND THOSE FUNDS. ACCORDINGLY, THE COLLEGE DOES NOT FORMALLY MONITOR THE USE OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS SINCE IT IS REQUIRED THAT SUCH FUNDS BE USED TO OFFSET TUITION COSTS.

EACH FISCAL YEAR THE AMOUNT OF UNIVERSITY FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS FOR THE YEAR IS DETERMINED IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S BUDGET-SETTING PROCESS. ACTUAL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE BASED ON DIFFERENT CRITERIA AND ARE TRACKED WITHIN THE APPROVED BUDGET. THE ADMINISTRATION OF FINANCIAL AID IS HANDLED BY THE STUDENT FINANCE OFFICE AND SUCH AID AWARDED IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. EACH STUDENT APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID BY FILLING OUT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS. THE AWARD IS BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED IN THIS APPLICATION. STUDENT CAN ALSO APPLY FOR GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP BASED ON ELIGIBILITY.

GRANTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS ARE MADE UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND THE ACADEMIC PROMISE OF STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL AID. ALL RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED TO SUBSTANTIATE THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR ASSISTANCE MADE TO STUDENTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: TEXAS WESLEYAN UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTERS MULTIPLE FEDERAL, STATE, PRIVATE, AND UNIVERSITY GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, LOAN AND WORK STUDY AWARDS. FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE U.S. LAW AND REGULATIONS PROMULGATED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE U.S. DEPARTMENT HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES AS WELL AS THE REGULATIONS OF THE STATE OF TEXAS. UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE POLICIES OF THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IN SUPPORT OF THE UNIVERSITY'S STRATEGIC PLAN. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USES THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND A NUMBER OF SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS OF VERIFICATION TO DETERMINE A STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY FOR ALL NEED BASED PROGRAMS. ADDITIONALLY, STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED BASED UPON ACADEMIC QUALIFICATIONS, SPECIAL TALENTS, AND DONOR STIPULATED REQUIREMENTS. POLICIES AND PROCEDURES ENSURE THAT THE DETERMINATION OF AID ELIGIBILITY AND THE SUBSEQUENT DELIVERY OF AID IS DELIVERED IN A FAIR AND EQUITABLE MANNER.

The Seminary provides financial aid to students by directly crediting their tuition invoice with the amount of the scholarship. financial aid committee maintains copies of the need-based applications, FAFSA's and award letters. the letters are signed by the Chief Business Officer and forwarded to his assistant. Aid is then awarded and applied to the student accounts. The Chief Business Officer then compares the information posted to the award letters for accuracy.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Students receiving scholarships and grants from Bethany College are monitored to ensure that they meet the academic requirements or other criteria associated with the respective designation of the award.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College campus. The campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED A GRANTS ADMINISTRATOR WHO MONITORS ALL EXPENDITURES TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE USED IN ACCORDANCE WITH GRANTOR POLICIES AND REGULATIONS. IN ADDITION, AN ACCOUNTANT IS ASSIGNED TO RECORD AND REPORT ALL GRANT REVENUES AND EXPENDITURES TO THE GRANT ADMINISTRATOR AND GRANTOR ON A REGULAR BASIS.

DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED WHICH SUBSTANTIATES ELIGIBILITY AND THE AMOUNT OF ASSISTANCE GIVEN TO STUDENTS. NEED BASED ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS IS DETERMINED USING INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA. MERIT BASED STUDENT AID IS DETERMINED USING VARIOUS FACTORS TO ASSESS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE OF THE STUDENT.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE COLLEGE'S POLICY.
The GTU awards scholarships in the form of tuition discounts to its students. Scholarships are based on both demonstrated financial need and merit.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III, Column (b) Estimated Number Of Recipients
ExplntnTxt: INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP : THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES DETERMINES A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, AN INTERNAL COMMITTEE ANALYZES THE NEEDS OF ALL STUDENTS, AND BASED ON THE COMMITTEE'S ANALYSIS AID IS AWARDED AS NEEDED AND POSTED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III, Column (b) Estimated Number Of Recipients
ExplntnTxt: TUITION WAIVERS : THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES DETERMINES A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, AN INTERNAL COMMITTEE ANALYZES THE NEEDS OF ALL STUDENTS, AND BASED ON THE COMMITTEE'S ANALYSIS AID IS AWARDED AS NEEDED AND POSTED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES DETERMINES A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, AN INTERNAL COMMITTEE ANALYZES THE NEEDS OF ALL STUDENTS, AND BASED ON THE COMMITTEE'S ANALYSIS AID IS AWARDED AS NEEDED AND POSTED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

Birmingham-Southern College has written criteria for scholarships and grants which require formal application or nomination. This paper trail is used for internal reports, audits and donor reports. Funds are tracked in our database software and individual files are maintained of grant/scholarship recipients. All material is subject to audit. Grant/Scholarship criteria is reviewed prior to disbursement.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

Disbursements to students receiving financial aid are made in accordance with institutional procedures to ensure that those receiving aid are qualifying recipients. Federal financial aid and/or assistance from governmental agencies is distributed and monitored in accordance with federally approved need analysis criteria or other agency provided criteria.

INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S. ARE DEFINED AS THOSE LIVING IN THE U.S. AT THE TIME THE AID WAS AWARDED. THE ABOVE IS A BEST ESTIMATE BASED ON CERTAIN ASSUMPTIONS REGARDING WHERE PERSONS WERE LIVING WHEN THE AID WAS AWARDED AND DOES NOT REPRESENT THE DEGREE TO WHICH AID IS AWARDED TO INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS.

Subrecipient grants - Lehigh University maintains a policy defining its procedures for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients who are performing a portion of a sponsored project externally awarded to Lehigh. The policy provides guidance to ensure that subrecipients conduct their portions of sponsored projects in compliance with laws, regulations, terms and conditions of awards and subawards, and that reimbursed costs incurred by subrecipients are allowed. Other Assistance - Assistance offered from instititional funds by Lehigh to our students is awarded on the basis of merit and/or financial need. The selection criteria is based on the calculated expected family contribution, which is derived by using complex formulas involving families' income, assets, and household sizes. The student financial aid office administers and monitors these grants using system-generated reviews, along with cross checks on an ad hoc basis. Results from these reviews are regularly evaluated. Subsequently, follow-up corrective actions are taken when appropriate, and potentially include award revisions or cancellations. These provisions are designed to help ensure that student assistance funds are awarded to eligible recipients, in accordance with applicable federal, state, institutional, and other program legislation, as well as relevant internal university policies and operational guidelines.

The College provides scholarship assistance to students to help defray the cost of attendance. Such assistance is credited directly to the students billing account in accordance with Federal regulations and donor stipulations.

HOBART AND WILLIAM SMITH COLLEGES OFFER GRANTS TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES SUBMIT STANDARDIZED APPLICATION MATERIALS TO THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, WHICH OVERSEES THE PROCESS OF AWARDING SUCH GRANTS. ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA FOR THE VARIOUS GRANTS IS ESTABLISHED BY THE COLLEGES. THE COLLEGES CREDIT THE TUITION ACCOUNTS OF THE STUDENTS WHO ARE AWARDED FINANCIAL AID GRANTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The financial aid office determines if a student is eligible to receive a scholarship from the University and, if eligible, will apply the approved scholarship payment to the respective students tuition account. No checks are issued to the students directly. The financial aid office monitors the use of the funds to ensure they are used for their intended purpose.

Haverford College scholarships are based solely on need. The College does not award any grant aid based on merit. Applicants can be asked to file the College Board Profile and the FAFSA. If eligible for federal aid, parent and student personal and business tax returns must be provided. Supplements for businesses and forms for non-custodial parents may also be required based on circumstances. students may appeal award decisions to the Financial Aid committee made up of the Vice President and Dean of Admission and Financial Aid, the Dean of the College and the Senior Vice President for Administration and Finance. Haverford scholarships are credited directly to the student's account for tuition, room, board, fees and other billed charges. Supplemental Education Opportunity Grants (SEOG) are awarded based on family contribution. Eligibility is determined by the FAFSA and regulations determined by the U.S. Department of Education. Per the Department of Education regulations, students who receive Pell grants must be provided FSEOG funds first. If the student is selected to receive these awards other verfication forms may be required including the Verification Statement, parent and student tax returns, and non-tax filer statements. FSEOG awards are credited directly to the student's account for tuition, room, board and other billed charges. FSEOG awards are audited annually by the College's outside auditors in conjunction with the A-133 federal funds audit. Student internships are awarded through an application and committee review process. The internship awards are paid directly to the student for travel, room, board and other fees. This assistance enables the students to engage in unpaid internships in a variety of domestic and international locations. Some of the areas of study include Humanities, Sciences, Global Citizenship and Entrepreneurship.

FINANCIAL AID OF $5,994,083 CONSISTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS PROVIDED BY THE INSTITUTE OF $4,949,404 FOR 336 STUDENTS AND $1,044,679 FOR TUITION REDUCTIONS RELATED TO VOUCHERS TO CLINICAL SITES AND REDEEMED BY STUDENTS TO OFFSET TUITION CHARGES. TOTAL FINANCIAL AID OF $5,994,083 OFFSETS TUITION AND FEES ONLY.
Senior management recommends to the Executive Committee grants to other organizations for approval.
Scholarship assistance is approved and monitored for individuals through campus scholarship committees.
All accepted students currently received a half Olin tuition scholarship which is credited directly to their student accounts. It is used only to offset tuition charges.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS MADE BY THE SEMINARY ARE TO ITS STUDENTS TO COVER COSTS OF TUITION AND RELATED EXPENSES. ALL STUDENTS WHO APPLY FOLLOW ESTABLISHED FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIP POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. STUDENTS ALSO COMPLETE THE FAFSA AS PART OF THIS PROCESS.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S GRINNELL COLLEGE ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON FUND AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY GRINNELL COLLEGE. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH GRINNELL COLLEGE POLICY. STUDENTS AWARDED OTHER FUNDS MAKE VARIOUS REPORTS AND PRESENTATIONS ON THEIR RESEARCH OR STUDY AS REQUIRED BASED ON INDIVIDUAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE FUNDING. THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS TO LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS WHICH ARE ADMINISTERED THROUGH THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ENHANCEMENT AND ENGAGEMENT. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE OF FACULTY, STAFF AND GRINNELL COLLEGE STUDENTS FROM THE LOCAL AREA. ALL FINANCIAL CONTRIBUTIONS FOCUS ON THE STRATEGIC PRIORITIES OF STRENGTHENING CULTURAL, RECREATIONAL, AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES IN THE LOCAL AREA AS WELL AS INITIATIVES THAT ENHANCE THE SAFETY, BEAUTY, AND ECONOMIC VITALITY OF OUR SURROUNDINGS. GRINNELL COLLEGE HAS ASSEMBLED A DIVERSE SELECTION COMMITTEE TO EVALUATE NOMINEES FOR THE GRINNELL COLLEGE YOUNG INNOVATOR FOR SOCIAL JUSTICE PRIZE. APPOINTED BY THE COLLEGE'S PRESIDENT, THE SELECTION COMMITTEE MEMBERS ARE ALL RECOGNIZED INDIVIDUALS WHO WORK FOR SOCIAL CHANGE IN VARIOUS CAPACITIES. THEIR BACKGROUNDS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS, AND EXPERIENCES REFLECT THE DIVERSITY IN BOTH GRINNELL AND THE STATE. THESE MEMBERS INCLUDE ONE REPRESENTATIVE EACH FROM THE COLLEGE'S FACULTY, STUDENT BODY, ALUMNI, STAFF AND TRUSTEES, PLUS PROMINENT INDIVIDUALS NOT FORMALLY AFFILIATED WITH GRINNELL.

The Campus Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Grant funds are monitored through an institutional administrative database in accordance with federal, state, local and institutional regulations and policies.

The College reviews the fund balances for the endowed scholarships annually and the Board approves proposed amounts to award from the endowment scholarship funds each year. Other institutional scholarships and grants are included in the College's budget that is approved by the Board. Each scholarship or grant awarded has written criteria used to determine how the funds are awarded. College scholarships and grants awarded must first be applied to tuition, fees and housing charges (if applicable) before it can be disbursed to the student.

Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. The campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.
THE FOUNDATION REQUIRES THAT THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAIN AND TRACK THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY PROJECT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS INSIDE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 All financial aid grants are used for the intended purpose which is to provide aid to students with financial need to cover the students cost of attendance. These grants include federal pell grants, federal SEOG grants, and state PHEAA grants. The College also awards donor restricted grants that are provided from foundations, alumni scholarship donations, and other donors. Additionally, the College provides internal institutional grants to eligible students. These grants are awarded by the Financial Aid Office and posted to the eligible students accounts by the Business Office. These accounts are reconciled by the Business Office and Financial Aid Office on a monthly basis. The Financial Aid Office complies with the U.S. Department of Education guidelines as well as any donor restricted grant guidelines. The Financial Aid Office reports student grant awards to the U.S. Department of Education and PHEAA throughout the year and also submits the required annual FISAP report to the U.S. Department of Education. An annual A-133 audit (financial statements and report of independent certified public accounts in accordance with OMB Circular A-133) is conducted by the Colleges external independent auditors.

Federal funds are monitored as follows: The Director of Financial Aid determines student eligibility for Pell, SEOG, FWS, and Federal loans. The Director of Financial Aid posts student awards into the integrated student record system. The Bursar prints and distributes the billing statement which lists Federal awards. The Bursar draws down funding from the Federal website. The Director of Financial Aid and Bursar post the Federal funds to the student account in the student record system. The Senior Accountant reviews and posts the journal entry to record the cash receipt in the general ledger. The Director of Finance reviews and reconciles the student accounts receivable and all student related revenue from the general ledger to the billing system.

ALL STUDENTS APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID ("FAFSA"). THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA, WHICH DICTATES WHAT AND HOW MUCH FEDERAL FUNDING THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR. IF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED TO BE IN COMPLIANCE WITH ALL FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AS DETERMINED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS THE STUDENT THE APPROPRIATE FUNDING. STUDENT FILES REGARDING ELIGIBILITY ARE MAINTAINED BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

Every student who receives financial aid from the University must complete an annual Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form and make satisfactory academic progress in order to retain their aid. Reviews are also conducted on each student to ensure that their grades, academic standing, and major continue to qualify them for the financial aid. These review processes are conducted annually at the end of the University's spring term, prior to the renewal of financial aid packages for the students.

MONITORING ACTIVITIES OF GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS VARY BASED ON THE NATURE OF THE AGREEMENT WITH THE GRANTEE. ORGANIZATIONS OPERATING OUT OF THE MULLER CHAPEL (HILLEL, PROTESTANT COMMUNITY, AND NEWMAN FOUNDATION) ARE SUBJECT TO DIRECT OVERSIGHT BY COLLEGE EMPLOYEES. FOR GRANTS TO THE NATIONAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIP CORPORATION, TOMPKINS COUNTY AREA DEVELOPMENT, AND CORNELL UNIVERSITY, THE COLLEGE RELEGATES RESPONSIBILITY FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THOSE ORGANIZATIONS. THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS THE OMB UNIFORM GUIDANCE WITH RESPECT TO MONITORING THE USE OF FUNDS OF SUBRECIPIENTS OF FEDERAL AWARDS (PLANETARY SCIENCE INSTITUTE). STUDENTS MUST MEET THE CRITERIA SPECIFIED IN THE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IN ORDER TO RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIP. FOR ONGOING SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENTS MUST CONTINUE TO MEET THE CRITERIA IN ORDER TO BE AWARDED A SCHOLARSHIP IN SUBSEQUENT YEARS.
GRANTS AWARDED ARE PART OF AN OVERALL SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IN WHICH CRITERIA AND AMOUNTS AWARDED ARE RECORDED BY GRANTEE.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE THEN MONITORED BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND ACADEMIA ARE MONITORED BY THE REGISTRAR.

All grants are awarded to enrolled students based on either financial need or merit. Grants are applied directly to the student's account. Scholarships for financial need are determined by the Financial Aid Office. Scholarships for merit are determined by the Admissions Office.

Scholarships issued to University students are applied to the student's account. A list of scholarship, fellowship and grant assistance awarded is on file at the University. Although there may be recipients who are related to persons having interest in the University, such persons are selected on an equal and objective basis as with other recipients. All students receiving assistance are selected on the University's criteria for academic and financial need, and other similar criteria. The University does not discriminate on the basis of age, gender, ethnic or racial origin, physical or mental disability, marital or veteran status in administration of scholarships or loans. Also, note that the University provides remitted tuition to qualified faculty, staff and certain dependents as a benefit of employment. The University monitors the student accounts and eligibility.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES ARE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE THE QUALIFICATIONS OF EACH RECIPIENT. THE GUIDELINES ARE PUBLISHED IN CONVERSE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CATALOG AND COMPLY WITH ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS PUBLISHED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE SOUTH CAROLINA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE. ANNUAL COMPLIANCE AUDITS ARE COMPLETED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM. THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY ENSURES THAT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE USED FOR THEIR PROPER PURPOSE BY APPLYING THE AWARDED AMOUNT DIRECTLY AGAINST THE APPLICABLE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College Campus. The Campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS, STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES HAS ESTABLISHED SPECIFIC CRITERIA IN REGARDS TO ELIGIBILITY AND SELECTION. THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE STUDENTS ARE DOCUMENTED AND MONITORED FOR COMPLIANCE. THE ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S TUITION BILLS. NO SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS ARE AWARDED DIRECTLY TO THE RECIPIENTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO INDIVIDUALS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT TO AID WITH TUITION AND FEES. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE A REDUCTION OF TUITION AND FEES AND PROVIDED DIRECTLY BY THE UNIVERSITY. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR ELIGIBILITY AND THE SELECTION CRITERIA.

The College has a professionally staffed financial aid office charged with the responsibility of ensuring that all recipients meet all eligibility criteria ensuring that the College is in compliance with all government regulations pertaining to financial aid.

Arcadia University awards both need-based and merit-based financial aid to students in good academic standing. The University maintains records to quantify the dollar amount of the financial assistance awarded, the number of recipients per grant/scholarship, and the selection criteria. All grants and scholarships awarded to students are credited directly to the student's billing account.

THE RESEARCH FOUNDATiON AWARDS GRANTS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA IN SUPPORT OF THE RESEARCH AND SCHOLARLY ACTIVITIES AT THE UNIVERSITY. UNIVERSITY FACULTY MEMBERS ARE ENCOURAGED TO SUBMIT PROPOSALs DETAILING THEIR RESEARCH OBJECTIVES. PROPOSALS MEETING THE PREDETERMINED CRITERIA ARE APPROVED FOR FUNDING BY A SELECTION COMMITTEE. INDIVIDUAL GRANT ACCOUNTS ARE ESTABLISHED FOR EACH PROPOSAL AWARDED WHICH ARE USED TO ACCUMULATE AND TRACK GRANT EXPENDITURES. GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED BY FOUNDATION STAFF MONTHLY. PAYMENTS TO THE UNIVERSITY ARE ON A MONTHLY COST-REIMBURSEABLE BASIS, AND ONLY COVER ACTUAL COSTS INCURRED. UPON COMPLETION OF THE RESEARCH, PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO FOUNDATION MANAGEMENT DETAILING RESEARCH HIGHLIGHTS, ACCOMPLISHMENTS AND ACHIEVEMENTS.

THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS AWARDS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL GRADES AND ACT/SAT SCORES. A FRESHMAN WITH A 3.0 CORE GPA AND A 25 ACT, OR ABOUT 1700 ACT, WILL QUALIFY FOR AN ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP. TRANSFER STUDENTS WITH LESS THAN 30 COLLEGE CREDIT HOURS WILL HAVE BOTH HIGH SCHOOL GRADES AND COLLEGE GRADES CONSIDERED FOR ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIP. A TRANSFER STUDENT WITH MORE THAN 30 COLLEGE HOURS WILL NOT NEED TO SUBMIT HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS AND ONLY COLLEGE TRANSCRIPTS WILL BE EVALUUATED. TRANSFER STUDENTS MUST HAVE A 3.0 CORE GPA TO QUALIFY. THE RANGE IS FOR 2,000 UP TO HALF-TUITION PER YEAR: THE HIGHER THE SCORES, THE HIGHER THE SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNT. THE OFFICE OF ADMISSIONS COORDINATES THE AWARDING OF DEPARTMENTAL SCHOLARSHIPS. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE TO NEW STUDENTS WHO SUBMIT REQUIRED PROJECTS TO DEPARTMENT CHAIRS FOR JUDGING. DEPARTMENT SCHOLARSHIPS RANGE FROM 1,000-5,000 PER YEAR. FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENTS ARE NOTIFIED BY PHONE AND BY MAIL WITH AN OFFICIAL LETTER. THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE SENDS AN AWARD LETTER TO NOTIFY THE STUDENT OF ALL AID OFFERED TO THEM. MOST SCHOLARSHIPS (THE MERIT SCHOLARSHIP FOR CURRENT STUDENTS IS AN EXCEPTION) ARE RENEWABLE FOR FOUR YEARS AS ALONG AS SPECIFIC ACADEMIC MINIMUMS ARE MAINTAINED. O'MORE WORK STUDY AND THE O'MORE GRANT ARE THE ONLY INSTITUTIONAL NEED-BASED FUNDS OFFERED BY THE COLLEGE. O'MORE WORK STUDY IS CREDITED TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS LIKE A GRANT. THE SCHOOL DETERMINES RECEIPIENTS BY A FORMULA THAT IDENTIFIES NET NEED AFTER CALCUALTING GROSS NEED (DIRECT COST-EFC) AND THEN CREDITING FEDERAL/STATE GRANTS, INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS, AND STUDENT LOANS. THIS INFORMATION IS MAILED TO THE STUDENT IN A LETTER AND A COPY IS KEPT IN THEIR FINANCIAL AID FOLDER.
MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: ALL GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AFTER VERIFYING ENROLLMENT STATUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS.

SCHOLARSHIP CANDIDATES MUST MEET BASIC MINIMUM GPA REQUIREMENTS, ATTEND IN FULL-TIME STATUS, AND MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN THEIR DEGREE PROGRAM. NEW STUDENTS COMPLETE AN APPLICATION ALONG WITH AN ESSAY. ALL ELIGIBLE CANDIDATES ARE INTERVIEWED BY AT LEAST TWO MEMBERS OF THE ADMISSIONS AND STUDENT AID COMMITTEE. AT THE END OF MARCH, THE COMMITTEE MEETS TO SELECT THE AWARD WINNERS. RETURNING STUDENTS WHO WERE NOT AWARDED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO APPLY FOR SCHOLARSHIP IF THEY MEET THE MINIMUM GPA REQUIREMENT IN THEIR STUDIES AT MTSO. THEY MUST PROVIDE THE ASAC SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WITH AN ESSAY AND TWO COURSE EVALUATIONS. THESE REVIEWS ALSO TAKE PLACE AT THE MARCH SCHOLARSHIP SELECTION MEETING. WE MONITOR THE ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND GPA OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. IF CRITERIA IS NOT MET, ONE SEMESTER OF SCHOLARSHIP PROBATION IS ENFORCED GIVING THE STUDENT AN ATTEMPT AT IMPROVEMENT BEFORE THE AWARD IS REVOKED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WISCONSIN SCHOOL OF PROFESSIONAL PSYCHOLOGY OFFERS A MINORITY SCHOLARSHIP AND VARIOUS ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFIED INCOMING MINORITY STUDENTS. ELIGIBILITY FOR THE MINORITY SCHOLARSHIP IS BASED UPON MINORITY STATUS, PROVEN ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE, AS WELL AS FINANCIAL NEED. ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVMENTS.

POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR DISBURSEMENTS ARE SET BY THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING BOARD. INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANIZATIONS ARE ADEQUATELY INVESTIGATED TO INSURE THAT THEY ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.
Financial aid assistance are awarded based on US, State, and private guidelines as required by the type or source of assistance.
Scholarships are monitored through the financial aid office, to ensure that all scholarship monies are used for housing, tuition, meals and books.

GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON ESTABLISHED CRITERIA FOR EACH GRANT. THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS, THE NEED PER FAFSA, AND THE DATE OF THE APPLICATION ARE ALSO CONSIDERED. THE FUNDS ARE AWARDED AND DISBURSED AFTER ALL ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA HAVE BEEN CONFIRMED. TUITION WAIVERS MUST FOLLOW THE APPROVAL PROCESS OUTLINED IN THE HUMAN RESOURCES HANDBOOK. WAIVERS ARE AWARDED AND DISBURSED BASED ON THE SCHOOL YEAR AND SEMESTER REGISTRATION.
THE COLLEGE'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID AWARDED TO STUDENTS ARE BASED UPON THE GUIDELINES PROVIDED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.

GRANTS AND CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA AND RELATED ENTITIES ARE MADE AFTER COLLABORATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY. MANY CONTRIBUTIONS ARE BASED ON COMMITMENTS MADE COLLEGIALLY BETWEEN THE UNITS. OTHERS ARE RECURRING PROJECTS, EQUIPMENT PURCHASES OR EXPENSE ITEMS. THERE IS NO FORMAL GRANT WRITING IN THIS PROCESS.

DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANTS: Individuals requesting any form of financial aid must complete personal financial statements and if they are dependents, they must also provide parental or guardian financial information. Only individuals who are enrolled in the school at the time of disbursements are considered for financial aid.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES GRANTS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, AND STUDENT LOANS USING GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY THE ORGANIZATION'S BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO ENSURE THEY ARE MADE BASED ON NEED AND OR MERIT. SCU makes financial aid grants to student account to offset amounts that students owe the University for tuition and fees.

The financial aid office awards grants to students based on the students financial aid application. Once classes begin, grants are disbursed to the student's account where they offset tuition charges.
NICHOLS COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN TITLE IV FUNDING. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FAFSA FORM TO APPLY FOR AID.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The University enters into their computer system (POISE), as budgeted amounts, the amounts that the Department of Education has allocated to be awarded to eligible students. The Financial Aid Department prints out a fund report from POISE that shows the budget amount, how much has been awarded, and how much is available to be awarded. Then the Financial Aid Department awards to each student who has applied for financial aid and meets the University's qualifications, State, and federal guidelines for financial aid the amount that the student is eligible to receive. The amounts that the student receives are credited to their account at the University, then the University automatically deducts tuition, books, and University fees. If there is a balance remaining, it is then refunded to the student. The Financial Aid Department is audited each year by independent certified public accountants.

A LIST OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS IS ON FILE AT THE INSTITUTION AND IS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. ALL RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS ACCORDING TO THE REQUIREMENTS FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP AND/OR AID FOR WHICH THE RECIPIENT IS APPLYING. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID HAVE ACADEMIC REQUIREMENTS WHICH THE RECIPIENTS NEED TO MAINTAIN TO CONTINUE RECEIVING AID. STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE CASH GRANTS. RATHER, ALL FINANCIAL AID IS TREATED AS A REDUCTION TO TUITION.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Adler University offers a variety of scholarships to help support the educational goals of its students. Unlike student loans, scholarships do not need to be repaid and are awarded based on a variety of criteria including, but not limited to, academic excellence, mission relevance, and community involvement and service. In addition, the university grants scholarships to employees pursuing degrees at Adler University in the form of tuition remission. To qualify, employees must obtain prior management approval and they can receive up to 6 credit hours of scholarship each semester.

THE UNIVERSITY MAKES CONTRIBUTIONS TO NORTHWESTERN FOUNDATION, A RELATED ORGANIZATION UNDER COMMON MANAGEMENT. FOR THE GRANTS TO UNRELATED ORGANIZATIONS, SENIOR MANAGEMENT GENERALLY MONITORS RECIPIENT SPENDING VIA COMMUNICATION WITH THE ORGANIZATIONS TO SEE HOW OPERATIONS ARE RUNNING. A SITE VISIT BY SENIOR MANAGEMENT MAY ALSO BE CONDUCTED TO CHECK THE STATUS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND/OR MONITOR THE PROGRESS OF THE INTENDED PROJECT. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS FOR STUDENTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT'S UNIVERSITY ACCOUNT AND APPLIED TO TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS SUBJECT TO REVISION BASED ON AVAILABILITY, CHANGES IN FAMILY CONTRIBUTION AND/OR CREDIT LOAD. SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS MUST BE MAINTAINED ACCORDING TO STANDARDS PRESCRIBED BY THE UNIVERSITY. ANNUAL RENEWAL OF FINANCIAL AID IS CONTINUOUS IF INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL NEED REMAINS, ALL REQUIRED DOCUMENTS ARE COMPLETED BY THE PUBLISHED DEADLINE AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS MAINTAINED CONSISTENT WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES. THE NC BUDGET OFFICE REQUIRES PERIODIC REPORTING FOR ALL GRANTS. THE REPORTING IS COMPLETED BY THE RESPONSIBLE DEPARTMENT AND THEN ENTERED INTO THE STATE WEBSITE BY THE CONTROLLER ANNUALLY.

Marshall University Research Corporation submits proposals to funding agencies and awards scholarships, stipends, and sub-grants in a pass through capacity. The recipients are in accordance with grant award documents.

THE UNIVERSITY PAYS GRANTS/ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON CRITERIA STIPULATED BY THE DONOR. INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, SERVICE AND FAMILY SITUATION. THE PROCESS IS MONITORED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP REVIEW COMMITTEE. FOR FEDERAL AND STATE AID, THE PROCESS IS GOVERNED BY A MULTI-STEP REVIEW PROCESS INVOLVING SEVERAL STAFF FROM THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES DEPARTMENT.

THE COLLEGE ONLY GIVES SCHOLARSHIPS FOR STUDENTS ATTENDING ITS CLASSES. SCHEDULE I, PART III, (B) - THIS NUMBER REPRESENTS ALL SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED. SOME STUDENTS MAY HAVE RECEIVED MULTIPLE SCHOLARSHIPS.

part I, line 2 THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A WIDE VARIETY OF MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. MERIT AWARDS ARE GIVEN IN RECOGNITION OF VARIOUS ACHIEVEMENTS AS SPECIFIED IN DONORS' CORRESPONDENCE AND DOCUMENTS. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE PROVIDED BASED ON THE INCOME LEVEL AVAILABILITY OF AWARDS OFFERED ELSEWHERE AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY ONLY MAKES SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS THAT HELP OFFSET THE TUITION OF THE STUDENTS. THE GRANTS ARE DIRECTLY CREDITED AGAINST THE APPLICABLE STUDENT ACCOUNT WHICH ASSURES PROPER USE OF THE GRANT. THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANT IS ADJUSTED, AS NECESSARY, BASED ON ANY SUBSEQUENT CHANGES AFFECTING THE STUDENT'S ORIGINAL ELIGIBILITY.
THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, WHICH DIRECTLY OFFSETS TUITION, FEES, ROOM AND BOARD.
PART I QUESTION 2 GRANTS TO RECIPIENTS IN THE U.S. INCLUDED TUITION ASSISTANCE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL AWARDS TO STUDENTS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY S FINANCIAL AID SO FTWARE. DOCUMENTATION REGARDING ELIGIBILITY IS MAINTAINED IN EACH STUDENT S FILE. CRITERIA FOR INSTITUTIONAL AID IS DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT AND VARIOUS COMMITTEES. ALSO, MANY INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS A RE DONOR-FUNDED AND CONTAIN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA SPECIFIED BY THE DONOR.
PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON NEED AND MONITORED ANNUALLY BASED ON STUDENTS' ACADEMIC PROFILES AND GUIDELINES AS PROVIDED TO STUDENTS.

NEUMANN UNIVERSITY'S PROCESS FOR MONITORING FINANCIAL AID AND MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IS A COMBINATION OF PROCEDURES INVOLVING THE FOLLOWING OFFICES; FINANCIAL AID, INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT, REGISTRAR, AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE. INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARD SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ACCORDING TO THE SPECIFICATIONS/REQUIREMENTS OF THE SPECIFIC AWARD. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, REGISTRAR, AND BUSINESS OFFICE COORDINATE THE AWARDING AND DOCUMENTATION OF FINANCIAL AID TO INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY OF FINANCIAL AID, NOTIFICATION OF STUDENTS, CHANGE OF STATUS, AND RECONCILEMENT OF STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

The Director of Financial Aid reviews each endowment scholarship award criteria and awards scholarships based on donor intent. Merit scholarships are awarded by the Director of Financial Aid based on a review of the ACT scores and incoming GPA.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS GRANTS AND LOANS BASED ON A SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM AND THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL PROGRAMS. THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) MUST BE FILLED OUT AND ELIGIBLITY IS DETERMINED BASED ON THE INFORMATION PROVIDED. THE GRANT AWARDED IS CREDITED TO THEIR TUITION ACCOUNT AT LYNN UNIVERSITY.
The University of the Incarnate Word determines whether an individual qualifies for scholarships or grants by an application process that does not discriminate.

Grants are given to Portland State University Foundation, which determines the eligibility of students to receive scholarships. The foundation provides the bookstore with a list of students who have been awarded scholarships.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS DEVELOPED A QUANTIFIED ANALYSIS OF OUR AWARDING PRACTICES AND POLICIES. THESE PRACTICES AND POLICIES ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY TO DETERMINE WHETHER CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO OUR PHILOSOPHY AND FINANCIAL AID PACKAGING PHILOSOPHY.

A LIST OF SCHOLARSHIP AND FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENTS IS ON FILE AT ST. JOHN COLLEGE AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE COLLEGE RUNS AN ACADEMIC PROGRESS REPORT EVERY YEAR TO DETERMINE EACH STUDENT'S AID ELIGIBILITY. ALTHOUGH THERE MAY BE RECIPIENTS WHO ARE RELATED TO PERSONS HAVING INTEREST IN THE INSTITUTION, SUCH RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVELY DETERMINABLE BASIS WITH OTHER RECIPIENTS. THAT IS, ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

Grants and assistance in furtherance of the institutions exempt programs are made in accordance with procedures or are subject to conditions established by the institutions governing board designed to ensure that individuals receiving grants are adequately investigated to ensure that they are qualifying recipients. Students receiving scholarships and grants are judged worthy by the institutions assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need, and other similar standards.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part II, Line 1(h) Explanation of purpose of grant or assistance
ExplntnTxt: Payments related to work performed on research subcontract related to federal, state or private grant originally made to the University and other assistance in accordance with the University's exempt mission.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS MADE FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ARE INITIATED BY A FORMAL SUB-CONTRACT EXECUTED BY BOTH PARTIES. THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF EACH GRANT CONTAIN ALL THE GUIDELINES FOR INVOICING, BILLING, RECORD RETENTION, AUDITS, ETC. RESEARCH AND SPONSORED PROGRAMS ACCOUNTING ("RSPA") AND THE NOTRE DAME RESEARCH OFFICE WORK IN TANDEM TO ENSURE THE GUIDELINES ARE ADHERED TO. ALMOST ALL SUBCONTRACTS FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES ARE PAID ON A COST REIMBURSEMENT BASIS. ALL INVOICES PAID FOR COSTS ARE APPROVED BY THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR BASED ON COMPLETION OF WORK, DELIVERABLES MET, ETC. IN ADDITION, RSPA MONITORS THE PAYMENTS AGAINST THE TOTAL BUDGET TO ENSURE PAYMENT IS NOT MADE ABOVE THE STIPULATED CEILING. THE UNIVERSITY HAS A POLICY CONTAINING GUIDELINES SURROUNDING SUB-CONTRACTS, SOME OF WHICH WERE ADDRESSED ABOVE. THIS POLICY CAN BE FOUND AT: HTTP://CONTROLLER.ND.EDU/ASSETS/91679/SUBRECIPIENT_MONITORING.PDF. CHARITABLE ORGANIZATIONS THAT RECEIVE CONTRIBUTIONS FOR THE UNIVERSITY ARE CAREFULLY SELECTED AND REQUIRE DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITY'S INTEREST IN THE ORGANIZATION TO ENSURE CONSISTENCY WITH THE CORE VALUES OF THE UNIVERSITY. CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS ALSO REQUIRE THE APPROVAL OF THE EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT, EXCEPT FOR CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS MADE THROUGH THE DONOR ADVISED FUND PROGRAM. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FUNDING TO STUDENTS AND OTHER RELATED INDIVIDUALS FOR RESEARCH AND OTHER ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT THE FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATION. FUNDS PROVIDED ARE MONITORED THROUGH APPLICATIONS, BUDGETS AND A REQUIREMENT TO DOCUMENT THE USE OF FUNDS EITHER PRIOR TO THE DISTRIBUTION OF FUNDS OR UPON COMPLETION OF THE ACTIVITY.

The Student Financial Services Department maintains records to substantiate eligibility and election criteria for students receiving awards and scholarships. Departments maintain records of selection criteria and eligibility for recipients of stipend and other awards. All payments are uploaded to their respective categories. The business office reconciles accounts and prepares departmental and grantor reports.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES A STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY BASED ON THE FAMILY'S FINANCIAL STRENGTH, WHICH INCLUDES CONSIDERATION OF FAMILY INCOME AND ASSETS, NUMBER OF CHILDREN IN COLLEGE AND, IF APPROPRIATE, SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. FINANCIAL AID WILL BE REVOKED WITHOUT ADEQUATE PROGRESS.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. THE AWARDING OF FUNDS IS MONITORED BY THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, WHERE A COMPLETE LISTING OF RECIPIENTS IS ALSO MAINTAINED.

ALL GRANTS ARE MADE TO THE RELATED ORGANIZATION, NORTHERN VIRGINIA COMMUNITY COLLEGE EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION, FOR SUPPORT OF THE NORTHERN VIRGINIA COMMUNITY COLLEGE. ALL FUNDS ARE USED IN THE UNITED STATES.

The University provides funding to faculty and students for research and other projects. Expenses must be substantiated under the Accountability Plan to ensure proper use of funds. Students must meet the requirements specified in the respective award program in order to receive the award. The requirements include criteria such as financial need, obtaining/maintaining the required grade point average and studying in a certain academic discipline, etc. If the scholarship is ongoing, the student must continue to meet the scholarship requirements in order to be awarded a scholarship in subsequent years. Financial need, grade point averages and other scholarship criteria are continually monitored to determine whether the student meets the criteria.

ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS MADE MY ALLIANT EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION ARE TO STUDENTS OR FACULTY OF ALLIANT INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY WHO HAVE COMPLETED AN APPLICATION PROCESS. THE AWARD IS BASED ON A WRITTEN SELECTION CRITERIA. WORK STIPENDS ARE AWARDED TO GRADUATING STUDENTS OF ALLIANT INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY BASED ON QUALIFIED EMPLOYMENT PURSUANT TO GRANT CRITERIA. ONCE THE GRANTS ARE DISTRIBUTED, EACH GRANT IS MONITORED ON AN INDIVIDUAL STUDENT BASIS FOR CONTINUED COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT CRITERIA.

APPLICANTS FOR FINANCIAL AID MUST FILL OUT THE FEDERALLY MANDATED FAFSA FORM. THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION ESTABLISHES A LEVEL OF NEED FOR AID BASED ON THE FAMILY'S TOTAL FINANCIAL SITUATION. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AT COLORADO HEIGHTS UNIVERSITY DETERMINES A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL AID AWARD AFTER REVIEWING THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA APPLICATION. APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED AS THEY ARE COMPLETED AND FUNDS ARE AWARDED ON A FIRST-COME, FIRST-SERVED BASIS TO STUDENTS WITH THE GREATEST NEED. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS MAY INCLUDE A COMBINATION OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. FINANCIAL AID IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S BILL EACH TERM AFTER THE REGISTRAR CONFIRMS ENROLLMENT STATUS AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL ASSISTANCE IS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS USED FOR TUITION AND FEES.

GRANTS ARE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS. QUALIFICATIONS INCLUDE DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED PER THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S FAFSA, AND/OR MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. FAFSA INFORMATION IS ANNUALLY UPDATED. MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE MONITORED FOR GRADE-POINT AVERAGE, PROGRESS TOWARD THE DEGREE OBJECTIVE, AND OTHER SIGNALS OF ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH DONOR RESTRICTIONS WHERE THOSE EXIST. THE PROCESS IS MANAGED BY THE SCHOOL'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICER WHO DETERMINES AMOUNTS, AND A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHO ASSIGNS THE SCHOLARSHIPS.

THE UNIVERSITY'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES AWARDS ALL FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID GRANTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. DONOR RESTRICTED GRANTS ARE AWARDED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DONOR'S WISHES.

GRANTS ARE FOR TUITION AND FEES THAT ARE DISBURSED IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ENSURES THAT THE STUDENTS ARE WITHIN THEIR BUDGET ALLOWANCE. ADDITIONAL GRANTS ARE GIVEN TO PAY FOR BOOKS.

The aid provided is in the form of scholarships and discounts awarded to students. The University has a well developed system of internal controls for Admissions, Financial Aid, Registration, Student Accounts and Accounting. The system is monitored by experienced staff who ensure the use of aid is in compliance with all governing laws, regulations and policies.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED POLICIES, PROCEDURES, AND CONTROLS OVER THE AWARDING, DISBURSING, AND MONITORING OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE OF NEW JERSEY REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS. IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY HAS AN EXTERNAL AUDIT PERFORMED IN ACCORDANCE WITH TITLE 2 U.S. CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS PART 200 (UNIFORM GUIDANCE) AND NEW JERSEY OFFICE OF MANAGEMENT AND BUDGET CIRCULAR 15-08. THE UNIVERSITY HAS PROCEDURES AND CONTROLS IN PLACE OVER THE AWARDING, DISBURSING, AND MONITORING OF SUBAWARDS MADE TO ORGANIZATIONS. THESE INCLUDE REVIEWING THE ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENT AND SINGLE AUDIT REPORTS OF THE ORGANIZATION AND REVIEWING ALL SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION INCLUDING INVOICES RECEIVED BY THE ORGANIZATION.

ADMISSIONS IS GIVEN A PERCENTAGE OF GROSS TUITION TO AWARD AS INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS. THE CURRENT PERCENTAGE IS 23%. THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANT IS COMMUNICATED TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WHO MAKES IT PART OF THE TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE. ONCE THE STUDENT ACCEPTS ADMISSION, THE GRANT IS POSTED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT BY FINANCIAL AID. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS THE TOTAL AWARDED TO ENSURE THEY ARE WITHIN BUDGET.
STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE INSTITUTION'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE OF MONITORING USE OF GRANTS TO GOVERMENTAL AGENCIES & GOVERMENTS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS ITS GRANT FUNDS IN INDIVIDUAL GRANT ACCOUNTS AND IS REQUIRED TO BE AUDITED ANNUALLY (A-133). IN ADDITION, THE UNIVERSITY HAS ESTABLISHED RESEARCH POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS GUIDELINES TO PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS IN MANAGING THEIR GRANT AT BRANDEIS UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURE OF MONITORING USE OF GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS
ExplntnTxt: PART III THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AND APPLIES THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTLY CREDITING EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

ALL FEDERAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DURING THEIR AWARD PROCESS. FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN BY THE CONTROLLER IN THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND ARE RECONCILED TO THE AWARD. THE MONEY IS DISBURSED TO THOSE APPLICABLE STUDENTS BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE BURSAR.

The University's Office of Financial Aid monitors all recipients of scholarship awards to determine both initial and confirming eligibility based on the criteria for each type of award, which may include academic performance, financial need, and criteria established by donors of endowed scholarship funds, etc.

PACIFIC LUTHERAN UNIVERSITY OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS.

PIEDMONT COLLEGE PARTICIPATES IN THE STUDENT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS THROUGH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. FUNDS ARE AWARDED AND DISBURSED TO STUDENTS BASED ON THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES SET FORTH BY THE TITLE IV PROGRAMS.

Bryn Mawr College has several sub-recipients of government funds. The College complies with the provisions in Uniform Guidance and any statutes governing sub-awards made by and to not-for-profit entities.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY'S MONITORING PROCEDURES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING STEPS: 1, PERFORM A RISK ASSESSMENT ON SUB-RECIPIENT 2, PERFORM SITE VISITS TO REVIEW FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC RECORDS 3, ENSURE THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR HAS REGULAR CONTRACTS 4, ENSURE A CURRENT CERTIFICATION OR A-133 AUDIT IS PERFORMED AND THE RELATED REPORT RECEIVED AND REVIEWED.

VASSAR COLLEGE RAISES FUNDS FOR, AND MAKES CONTRIBUTIONS TO, A WIDE VARIETY OF 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATIONS IN THE GREATER POUGHKEEPSIE AREA. THESE ORGANIZATIONS ARE SELECTED ANNUALLY BY A COMMITTEE OF EMPLOYEES AND STUDENTS AFTER REVIEW OF THEIR ACTIVITIES AND MISSION. EMPLOYEES AND STUDENTS ALSO VOLUNTEER TIME AT EACH ORGANIZATION. FUNDS ARE COLLECTED ANNUALLY FROM THE GIFTS OF EMPLOYEES, STUDENTS, TRUSTEES, AND FRIENDS OF VASSAR AS PART OF THE "COMMUNITY WORKS" CAMPAIGN. VASSAR ALSO MAKES SMALL CONTRIBUTIONS TO OTHER LOCAL NON-PROFIT AND GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES WHO ARE NOT PART OF THE CAMPAIGN.

STUDENTS WHO ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS HAVE FUNDS CREDITED TO THEIR ACCOUNT AND THE USE IS RESTRICTED TO PURPOSES RELATED TO ENROLLMENT IN A PROGRAM OF STUDY. RECIPIENTS OF FELLOWSHIPS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT PERIODIC WRITTEN REPORTS OF THEIR ACTIVITIES TO THE COLLEGE.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depends on other factors such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

The University's Office of Financial Aid monitors all recipients of scholarship awards to determine both initial and continuing eligibility based on the criteria for each type of award, which may include academic performance, financial need, criteria established by donors of endowed scholarship funds, etc.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE INSTITUTE ENSURES THAT ITS GRANTS OF FINANCIAL AID ARE USED BY STUDENTS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES BY CREDITING THE AID DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS OR THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID COMPLIANCE PROCESS. THE INSTITUTE ALSO PROVIDES FUNDING FOR TRAVEL EXPENSES, WHICH HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN THE TOTAL ABOVE, FOR STUDENTS WHOSE PROJECT PROPOSALS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BY THE PRESIDENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A WRITTEN POLICY THAT GOVERNS THE MONITORING OF THE USE OF SPONSORED PROJECT GRANT FUNDING BY SUBRECIPIENTS. THE POLICY MANDATES MONITORING IN TWO AREAS: (A) SUBRECIPIENT INSTITUTION COMPLIANCE WITH THE AUDITING REQUIREMENTS OF OMB CIRCULAR A-133, AND (B) SUBRECIPIENT INSTITUTION'S APPROPRIATE MANAGEMENT OF SUBAWARD. THE UNIVERSITY'S SPONSORED PROJECTS FINANCE GROUP COLLECTS A-133 REPORTS FROM SUBRECIPIENT INSTITUTIONS, AND THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS CARRY OUT THE SECOND TYPE OF MONITORING, PRINCIPALLY BY: - ROUTINELY GATHERING AND REVIEWING TECHNICAL PERFORMANCE REPORTS; - ROUTINELY REVIEWING INVOICES AND EXPENSES RELATIVE TO BUDGET; - CONDUCTING PERIODIC ON-SITE VISITS, WHEN NECESSARY; AND - INITIATING AUDITS, WHEN NECESSARY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Wake Forest University carefully selects qualified exempt organizations for its contributions and provides support for worthy projects and events in which the University has an interest.Grants provided to students are monitored either through use -for University tuition and fees- or by requiring substantiation from the students for research projects or scholastic travel grants.Research subcontracts are awarded to qualifying research institutes able to complete research projects and monitored during such projects as well as by reviewing and collating the end results of the work.

SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED AND MONITORED BY THE UNIVERSITY. SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS FOR FYE 6/30/16 WERE APPLIED TO STUDENT BALANCES OWED TO THE UNIVERSITY IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ASSURANCE OF VOLUNTARY COMPLIANCE (AVC) AGREEMENT ENTERED INTO WITH THE KENTUCKY ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE.

Schedule I Part 1 Line 2 - Monitoring the use of grant funds The University's oversight and controls over grant funds is facilitated by processes and controls inherent in our University's ERP system. Disbursement of funds are controlled by donor and institutional criteria that is monitored by both the system and collaboration between various departments of the University. A monthly review of funding is produced to monitor spending and reports are produced by development to provide additional oversight of scholarship recipients when providing reports to donors on the status of their gifts.

Students receiving scholarships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. Scholarships are awarded on a non-discriminatory basis.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANTS FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 SMITH COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS AND LOANS TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ABLE TO DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED. EACH STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A PARENT'S CONFIDENTIAL QUESTIONNAIRE WHICH BECOMES THE BASIS OF DETERMINING NEED. GUIDELINES ISSUED BY THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE ARE USED IN ASCERTAINING THE FINANCIAL REQUIREMENT OF THE STUDENTS. THE FINANCIAL NEED IS GENERALLY MET THROUGH A COMBINATION OF LOANS AND GRANTS. BOTH ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S SEMESTER BILL THUS REDUCING THE PAYMENT DUE TO THE COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE ALSO AWARDS A RELATIVELY SMALL NUMBER OF MERIT-BASED GRANTS. THE COLLEGE FUNDS INTERNSHIPS THAT MEET RIGOROUS ACADEMIC CRITERIA. OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS PROVIDED TO MEET EMERGENCY TYPE AID ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS ALL GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS TO ENSURE THAT FUNDS ARE UTILIZED APPROPRIATELY. FOR GRANTS APPLIED TO COVER TUITION AND OTHER FEES, ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS REQUIRED TO ENSURE CONTINUED FUNDING. INTERNSHIPS REQUIRE PROOF OF PARTICIPATION AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC CONTENT. OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE REQUIRES DEMONSTRATED NEED. GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE ONLY MADE TO THOSE RECOGNIZED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE AS BEING DESCRIBED IN INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(3) AND 501(C)(6).

THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR HAVING RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE GRANT MONITORS SUBCONTRACTOR PERFORMANCE BASED ON THE PROGRAM'S TASKS AND GOALS. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE BEFORE AUTHORIZING THE SUBCONTRACTOR'S INVOICE FOR PAYMENT.

SPRING ARBOR UNIVERSITY IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING RESOURCES NECESSARY TO HELP STUDENTS COMPLETE THEIR EDUCATION. IN SELECTING THE STUDENTS TO RECEIVE THIS ASSISTANCE, THE UNIVERSITY PLACES PRIMARY EMPHASIS ON THE STUDENT'S ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED. AWARDS ARE DETERMINED BY THE UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. UPON ENROLLMENT VERIFICATION, THE AWARDS ARE USED TO OFFSET THE COST OF ATTENDANCE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Administration, monitoring and oversight of grants is conducted to oversee the progress and completion of the grants , ensuring compliance with all relevant terms and conditions.

Grants represent financial aid awarded to students from both institutional funds as well as amounts passed through from Federal and State aid programs. Students applying for financial aid must complete the Federal FAFSA form. Institutional aid is awarded according to institutional policy and is based on both academic ability and financial need. Federal and State aid is awarded consistent with applicable Federal and State rules and regulations.

Grant disbursements for the institution's exempt programs are made in accordance with the exempt purpose for which the institution was organized, and with procedures and conditions established by the institution's governing board. Student scholarships and grants are awarded based on the institution's assessment of recipient's academic achievement, financial need, and other standards similar to those held by other universities. The student's records are then monitored in order to ensure that the grant requirements are continuing to be met.

WILKES UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM OF FINANCIAL AID TO ASSIST STUDENTS IN THE FINANCING OF THEIR EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS. THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS BOTH MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED GRANTS TO UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. UNDERGRADUATE MERIT AWARDS ARE BASED ON HIGH SCHOOL ACHIEVEMENT INCLUDING SAT SCORES AND HIGH SCHOOL CLASS RANK. STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID TO HAVE THEIR ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED AID DETERMINED. GRADUATE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED PRIMARILY TO STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE DISTANCE EDUCATION PROGRAM.
THE ORGANIZATION AWARDS TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS OF THIS INSTITUTION AND ARE IMMEDIATELY APPLIED AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION CHARGES.

A FILE IS CREATED FOR EACH GRANTEE, WHICH CONTAINS THE OFFICIAL INSTITUTIONAL STUDENT INFORMATION RECORD FROM THE FEDERAL PROCESSOR FROM WHICH ELIGIBILITY IS DETERMINED ACCORDING TO FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES FOR THE AWARDING OF FINACIAL ASSISTANCE.

FOR FEDERAL AND PASS-THROUGH GRANTS FOR PROGRAMS, EACH GRANT HAS A GRANT MANAGER. ON A MONTHLY BASIS, THE BUSINESS OFFICE RECONCILES EXPENSES INCURRED FOR EACH GRANT AND VERIFIES WITH THE RESPECTIVE GRANT MANAGER. ONCE CONFIRMED, THE BUSINESS OFFICE REQUESTS REIMBURSEMENT FROM THE RESPECTIVE AWARDING AGENCY. FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, FINANCIAL AID REVIEWS THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR AWARDING TO STUDENTS. THE BUSINESS OFFICE DOES A RECONCILIATION OF EXPENSES (FINANCIAL AID AWARDED) BEFORE DRAWING DOWN ACTUAL DOLLARS FROM THE ENDOWMENT AND FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID. FOR PROGRAMS, THERE ARE TWO DIFFERENT METHODS USED. SOME PROGRAMS HAVE "BUDGET MANAGERS" WHO ARE AWARE OF THE FUNDS AVAILABLE VIA THE BUSINESS OFFICE AND SPEND ACCORDINGLY. FOR THOSE PROGRAMS WITHOUT "BUDGET MANAGERS AND FOR UNRESTRICTED ENDOWMENTS, THE BUSINESS OFFICE ENSURES THAT THERE ARE EXPENSES INCURRED IN THOSE SPECIFIC DEPARTMENTS BEFORE DRAWING DOWN ACTUAL DOLLARS. IN ALL CASES FOR THE ENDOWMENTS, THE BUSINESS OFFICE DOES A RECONCILIATION TO ENSURE THAT THE PROPER DOLLAR AMOUNT IS CALCULATED, AWARDED/EXPENSED, AND DRAWN DOWN.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ISSUED AND AMOUNTS ARE USED TO OFFSET STUDENT TUITION.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS THE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT, TALENT, LEADERSHIP ACTIVITIES AND RELATIONSHIPS BASED ON UNIVERSITY HERITAGE AND MISSION. THIS IS PRIMARILY FROM THE APPLICATION FOR ADMISSION, TRANSCRIPTS AND TEST SCORES, BUT MAY ALSO INCLUDE AUDITIONS AND TRY-OUTS. AWARDS WITH SPECIFIC RENEWAL CRITERIA ARE MONITORED EACH SEMESTER BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL SERVICES.

STUDENTS QUALIFY FOR FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP, GRANTS, AND LOANS BASED ON THEIR INDIVIDUAL FAFSA APPLICATIONS. GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BASED ON FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE COLLEGE ARE SUBJECT TO ANNUAL AUDITS BY INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.
THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED IS THE NUMBER OF GRANTS AWARDED FOR THE SCHOOL YEAR.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 Scholarships and fellowships are awarded by Queens University of Charlotte to students based on their academic achievement, talent in the fine arts, and participation in intercollegiate athletics. The awards are based on their performance levels. Students are also awarded need-based scholarships and grants based on their need as established by completing the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and, if applicable, by specific criteria and guidelines for other federal and state programs.

STUDENT ENROLLMENT IS MONITORED ON A REGULAR BASIS. AFTER VERIFICATION OF ENROLLMENT EACH TERM, FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS' EDUCATIONAL COSTS PER FEDERAL REGULATIONS. STUDENT WITHDRAWALS ARE ALSO MONITORED AND GRANT FUNDS ARE ADJUSTED AND RETURNED AS NECESSARY.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS ALL GRANTS AWARDED ARE BASED ON NEED AND CONFORM TO FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL REGULATIONS. ELIGIBILITY IS BASED ON A THOROUGH REVIEW AND VERIFICATION OF A FAMILY'S INCOME, ASSETS, SIZE AND NUMBER OF DEPENDENTS ENROLLED IN COLLEGE. ANNUAL EXPENDITURE REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO THE FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS FOR REVIEW. THE EXPENDITURES ARE REVIEWED FOR COMPLIANCE IN AN ANNUAL AUDIT CONDUCTED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO OFFERS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS, AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. FINANCIAL AID IS PROVIDED BY: THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO; FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; SOCIAL, FRATERNAL, PROFESSIONAL, AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS; EMPLOYERS, BOTH PRESENT AND PROSPECTIVE; AND FRIENDS AND GRADUATES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF SAN FRANCISCO. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS CAN BE USED TO PAY FOR TUITION AND FEES, ROOM AND BOARD, TRANSPORTATION AND PERSONAL EXPENSES; GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE ELIGIBILITY BY SUBMITTING A FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION, COMPETE IN INTERCOLLEGIATE ATHLETICS, ARE ACADEMICALLY ELIGIBLE, OR ARE READY TO COMMIT THEIR TIME AND SKILLS AFTER GRADUATION TO THE U.S. ARMED FORCES.

WITH RESPECT TO SPONSORED PROJECT ACTIVITY SUBCONTRACTED TO OTHER ENTITIES, THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICY AND PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING SUB RECIPIENT AWARDS ("SUBWARDS") ARE INTENDED TO ESTABLISH APPROPRIATE AND EFFECTIVE MECHANISMS TO PROMOTE COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND NON-FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS AND CONTRACTUAL ARRANGEMENTS, INCLUDING THE PROPER MONITORING AND STEWARDSHIP OF AWARDED FUNDS. PROPER MONITORING OF A SUBAWARD ENSURES THAT AWARDED FUNDS ARE USED FOR AUTHORIZED PURPOSES, PERFORMANCE GOALS ARE MET AND THE SUB RECIPIENT IS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE SUB RECIPIENT AGREEMENT.
