SUB RECIPIENT MONITORING PROCEDURES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: A FORMAL PRE-QUALIFICATION PROCESS FOR SUB RECIPIENTS, PRE-AWARD AND POST-AWARD MONITORING OF SUB RECIPIENTS TO REVIEW THE FINANCIAL STATUS AND MANAGEMENT CONTROLS, COMPLIANCE CERTIFICATIONS, REVIEW OF COMPLIANCE WITH REGULATIONS RELATIVE TO THE USE OF HUMAN SUBJECTS AND ANIMALS, IDENTIFICATION AND MANAGEMENT OF ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH A SUB RECIPIENT ENTITY, AND A REVIEW OF PERTINENT OTHER ORGANIZATION INFORMATION. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THESE PROCEDURES, THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS THE SUB RECIPIENT'S ADMINISTRATION, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, BILLINGS, SCIENTIFIC PROGRESS, TECHNICAL REPORTS, AND DELIVERABLES OF AN ACTIVE SUBAWARD REGULARLY AND CONDUCTS ON-GOING RISK ASSESSMENTS AS WELL AS QUARTERLY QUALITY ASSURANCE REVIEWS ON RANDOMLY SELECTED SUBAWARDS. IN ADDITION TO A MONTHLY DEPARTMENTAL REVIEW, THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS A SUB RECIPIENT'S COMPLIANCE WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE SUBAWARD ANNUALLY AND UPON CLOSEOUT OF THE SUB RECIPIENT AGREEMENT. IF ANY OF THESE MONITORING PROCEDURES RESULT IN FINDINGS, THE UNIVERSITY WILL TAKE CORRECTIVE ACTION AS NECESSARY. THE PROCEDURES SERVE TO ENSURE THAT THE SUBAWARDS ARE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES AND NOT DIVERTED FROM THEIR INTENDED USE.
A SUBAWARD IS AN AWARD OF FINANCIAL SUPPORT FROM THE UNIVERSITY TO A QUALIFIED THIRD PARTY PRIMARILY TO PERFORM RESEARCH AND OTHER RELATED PROGRAMMATIC EFFORTS UNDER A SPONSORED RESEARCH PROJECT.

THE AMOUNTS REPORTED IN PART III REPRESENT AN ESTIMATE OF TOTAL AWARDS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2016 BASED ON INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL SCHOOLS. SOME STUDENTS RECEIVED MORE THAN ONE AWARD DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2016.

Gustavus offers both merit-based and need-based scholarship assistance. Merit-based scholarships do not require a student to demonstrate financial eligibility and must be awarded during the Admission process. They also may be awarded as part of a need-based financial aid package. To be renewed, the student needs to maintain the established minimum standards. Need-based scholarships are offered to students who demonstrate financial eligibility by filing the FAFSA. The offered amounts can vary from year to year as determined by the family's Estimated Family Contribution (EFC) on the FAFSA and availability of funds. The Registrar's office monitors any changes to a student's enrollment status. Any changes are communicated to the Student Accounts office and the Financial Assistance office to ensure funds are being properly disbursed. Also see Schedule F, Part V with respect to monitoring of students taking J-Term or semester studies outside of the United States.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE UTILIZES SYSTEMS DESIGNED FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS AND MONITORS THE ACTIVITY AND USES OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GRANTS FUNDS WITH THE APPROPRIATE CRITERIA ON AN ONGOING BASIS.

ALL FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND THE BUSINESS OFFICE TO THE STUDENT'S OUTSTANDING BALANCE AT THE COLLEGE. USE IS INTERNALLY CONTROLLED BY THE COLLEGE. NECO SCHOLARSHIPS REQUIRE A MINIMUM 3.2 GRADE POINT AVERAGE.
Grant funds consist of institutional discounts for employees of APUC and APU.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHAPMAN UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS. FOR MORE INFORMATION, VISIT OUR WEBSITE AT WWW.CHAPMAN.EDU.

THE STUDENT GRANTS AND AWARDS ARE FINANCIAL AID FUNDS WHICH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE HAS DETERMINED EACH STUDENT WAS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE. THE BUSINESS OFFICE REVIEWS THEIR LIST, PRIOR TO ENTERING THE AWARDS DIRECTLY ON EACH STUDENT'S TUITION ACCOUNT, AS PAYMENT. FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS PROVIDED MONTHLY REPORTS AS THESE AWARDS ARE EXPENSED OUT OF THE FINANCIAL AID BUDGET. STUDENTS ARE AWARE OF THESE AWARDS THROUGH VARIOUS PUBLICATIONS. STUDENTS HAVE DIRECT ACCESS TO ALL DETAILS OF THEIR TUITION ACCOUNT.

The Chicago School of Professional Psychology gives need-based and merit-based scholarships. Need-based scholarships are monitored through the Department of Education FAFSA form. Students With $0 estimated family contribution (EFC), based on the Department of Education guidelines, will be automatically awarded a need-based scholarship. Merit-based scholarships are granted to students who submit all required admissions documentation by certain deadlines and apply with a 4.0 undergraduate GPA or GRE score of 1300 (test taken prior to August 1, 2011) or a combined GRE score of 314 (test taken on or after August 1, 2011). The Chicago School and its partners award fellowships to students who contribute to the academic community in and outside the classroom. Fellowship recipients dedicate 10 to 15 hours a week of work to the specific department through which the fellowship is offered. Applicants are judged on their ability to demonstrate a commitment to learning, developing, and participating in the programmatic, research, and administrative activities within the department office.
The grants and/or financial assistance provided to the students are applied directly to the student's account, ensuring that the funds are used as intended.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: NYACK COLLEGE GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS, AS WELL AS OTHER FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED TO SDTUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES AS DEFINED BY THE FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE STATE OF NEW YORK AND NYACK COLLEGE'S SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT PROGRAMS. NYACK COLLEGE GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND OTHER SPECIFIC CRITERIA AS OUTLINED IN NYACK'S SCHOLARSHIP AND GRANT PROGRAM.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on needs assessments and/or performance. Once the student has been approved to receive the grant, the amount is credited to the student's Baker College account. The College's Financial Aid office monitors the student to make sure the award stays in compliance. If the student does not continue to meet the grant requirements, the student's account may be reduced. Grants and other assistance to organizations in the United States are budgeted each year by the Baker College campus. The campus President determines which organization benefits from a grant based on the community's needs. If the grant exceeds the budget, the Board of Regents must approve the funding. These grants and assistance are awarded to other tax-exempt organizations to be used in any way the recipients see fit to further their mission and tax exempt purpose; the use of these funds is not monitored by the Baker College campus.

The University does not provide grants or assistance to organizations other than assistance to individuals in the form of student scholarships. Should the University consider future grants awards to organizations, monitoring will be done in accordance with OMB Uniform Guidance, sub-recipient monitoring procedures.

IN ORDER TO BE AWARDED INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS, STUDENTS MUST BE ENROLLED FULL-TIME AND MAKING SATISFACTORY PROGRESS. UNDERGRADUATE ON-CAMPUS STUDENTS COMPLETE A CROWN FINANCIAL AID APPLICATION TO HELP DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND DISCOUNTS. SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS AND DISCOUNTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT AND SPECIFIC CRITERIA. THE CROWN GRANT IS NEED-BASED USING PERCENTAGES AND MINIMUM AWARD ADAPTED FROM NOEL-LEVITZ.

THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS ITS GRANTS TO ENSURE THAT SUCH GRANTS ARE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES AND ARE NOT OTHERWISE DIVERTED FROM THE INTENDED USE BY HAVING THE ENROLLMENT SERVICES OFFICE PROVIDE THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WITH A WEEKLY REPORT IDENTIFYING ANY FINANCIAL AID REFUNDS TO STUDENTS. THIS PROCESS ENSURES THAT ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BEING APPLIED AND USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE. ALL FINANCIAL AID IS ELECTRONICALLY POSTED DIRECTLY TO EACH STUDENTS ACCOUNT BY THE BURSAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Federal and state programs are administered according to the laws, rules, statutes, and regulations as issued by the State of California and the U.S. Department of Education as well as the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services. University scholarships and grants are administered according to the policies and procedures developed and implemented by the Financial Aid Office in support of the University's strategic enrollment plan. The Financial Aid Office uses the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) as well as a number of supporting documents of verification to determine a student's eligibility for all need based programs. In addition, students are reviewed based on academic qualifications and special talents for merit based programs such as music, athletics, regents scholarships and similar programs. Policies and Procedures ensure that the determination of aid eligibility and the subsequent delivery of aid from any and all programs are done in a fair and equitable manner and in accordance with the rules and regulations that govern the individual programs.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED ARE FOR USE TO REDUCE TUITION AND FEES AT WINEBRENNER AND CANNOT BE RECEIVED AS CASH OR USED ELSEWHERE.

SCHOLARSHIPS ALL GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IT IS A CONTINUAL PROCESS IN WHICH WE AWARD STUDENT AID WITHIN FEDERAL GUIDELINES AT THE INITIAL AWARDING TIME PERIOD. IF ANY CHANGES TO A STUDENT'S STATUS OCCUR, WE REVIEW THE STUDENT'S AID PACKAGE COMPONENTS TO ENSURE THAT ANY/ALL ADJUSTMENTS MADE MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV FUND RULES. WE ALSO PERFORM SPOT CHECKS THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER TO DOUBLE CHECK THAT AID ELIGIBILITY CALCULATIONS ARE MET. DOMESTIC ORGANIZATIONS GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE GIVEN TO ORANIZATIONS THAT FURTHER THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION. FOCUS IS A FOR PROFIT ENTITY THAT SENDS MISSIONARIES TO COLLEGE CAMPUSES. THE DONATIONS SPONSORED TWO OF THEIR EVENTS.

SAINT MARY'S DISTRIBUTES SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE RESULTS OF THE FAFSA (FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID). MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE USING THE INFORMATION FROM THE STUDENT'S OFFICIAL HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS AND THE RESULTS OF THE STANDARDIZED TEST (ACT, SAT, ETC.). FOR STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS WITH RENEWAL CONDITIONS, FULFILLMENT OF THOSE CONDITIONS ARE VERIFIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTRATOR PRIOR TO THE AWARD BEING RENEWED (GPA, YEAR OF ATTENDANCE, ETC.)

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS MONITORED THROUGH A GRANT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.

ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IS DETERMINED ANNUALLY BASED UPON THE RESULTS OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED UPON ENROLLMENT AND ELIGIBILITY IS FOR THE EIGHT SEMESTERS. AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER, THE FINANCIAL PLANNING DEPARTMENT VERIFIES SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS HAS BEEN MAINTAINED IN ORDER TO DETERMINE CONTINUATION OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS.
To be considered for need based aid, a student is required to complete a Free Application for Federal Student Aid. Financial aid awards are not automatically renewed each year.

A student's eligibility for need-based financial aid is determined on the basis of their annual cost of attendance, which is calculated in accordance with Federal regulations, minus Expected Family Contribution, which is determined in accordance with Federal regulations and University standards. In the event that total aid awarded exceeds direct costs (i.e., costs that are billed by the University), the excess funds are provided to the student and are applicable to educationally-related expenses. The University does not require the student to provide proof (e.g., receipts, cancelled checks, etc.) as to how the funds were used.

GGU DISBURSES FUNDS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES WITHIN THE MEANING OF IRC SECTION 170(C)(2). DISBURSEMENTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE AWARDS OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS IN FURTHERANCE OF THEIR EDUCATIONAL PURSUITS. SEE GGU'S SCHOLARSHIP POLICY: HTTP://WWW.GGU.EDU/ENROLLMENT/FINANCIAL-AID/SCHOLARSHIPS-AND-GRANTS

Funds are directly applied to eligible students accounts who are registered for sufficient tuition credits, according to Federal Guidelines. Credit balances on students accounts are refunded automatically to either the student or to the original source of the funds.

THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID ONLY TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS ENROLLED AT THE UNIVERSITY. THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MANAGING THE FELLOWSHIP AND SCHOLARSHIP ALLOCATION FOR NEW STUDENTS. THE FACULTY AND THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT WORK TOGETHER TO AWARD FELLOWSHIPS OR SCHOLARSHIPS TO NEW STUDENTS.

FOR INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENTS OF GRANTS, ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE AND DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED ARE USED TO DETERMINE EACH STUDENT'S FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID CONSISTS OF ANY COMBINATION OF GRANTS AND LOANS AND ARE REVIEWED EACH YEAR BASED ON A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC RECORD AND/OR DEMONSTRATED NEED. THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID, WHICH HELPS TO ESTABLISH A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, SERVES AS THE APPLICATION FOR TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS.
GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE REPRESENTS STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. WHEN AWARDING AID, CHARLES R. DREW UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL LAWS AND REGULATIONS OF FEDERAL AND STATE OF CALIFORNIA AID PROGRAMS

THE UNIVERSITY'S SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE IS CHARGED WITH THE RESPONSIBILITY OF ADVERTISING AVAILABILITY OF SPECIFIC SCHOLARSHIPS, REVIEWING APPLICATIONS AND AWARDING SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON NEED, MERIT OR OTHER SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS PUT IN PLACE BY DONORS OF THE FUNDS OR THE UNIVERSITY'S POLICIES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS RECEIVE THEIR SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS SIX WEEKS AFTER THE BEGINNING OF THE SEMESTER TO ENSURE THAT THEY HAVE EARNED THE AWARD. TUITION AND FEES ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE COLLEGE, THE REMAINDER IS GIVEN TO THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES.

THE AMOUNT OF FUNDS DISTRIBUTED IS COMPARED WITH INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS TO INSURE A BALANCE OF FUNDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED IS EVALUATED TO INSURE STUDENTS DO NOT RECEIVE AN OVER AWARD ACCORDING TO THE GUIDELINES OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT. STUDENTS RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED FOR ACADEMIC PROGRESS CONCERNING GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND COMPLETED NUMBER OF COURSES ONCE A YEAR.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The College awards scholarships using established policies on the basis of both need and scholarship merit. Awards to students with need are based on the students' financial information contained in the financial aid profile filed with the college scholarship services and the free application for financial aid filed with the federal processor. All aid is objectively determined and awarded on an equal basis to recipients with similar attributes.

GRANT FUNDING IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS BY STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES WITHIN ESTABLISHED BUDGET LEVELS BASED ON UNIVERSITY POLICIES. GRANT FUNDS ARE CREDITED TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS ELECTRONICALLY. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES WORKS WITH ADVANCEMENT STAFF TO ENSURE THAT RESTRICTED FUNDS ARE AWARDED WITHIN ESTABLISHED CRITERIA, AND WITH FINANCE STAFF TO DETERMINE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES MAINTAINS INTERNAL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR THE CORRECT AWARDING AND ADJUSTING OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS. ANNUAL AUDITS ARE CONDUCTED TO ASSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ALL POLICIES AND PROCEDURES. NORTHEASTERN UNIVERSITY (NU) HAS A FULL TIME EMPLOYEE TO MONITOR SUBAWARDS. - NU FOLLOWS FEDERAL REGULATIONS AS PART OF THE SUBRECIPIENT MONITORING UNDER A-133 (now Uniform Guidance 2 CFR 200). - NU REVIEWS THE FEDERAL AUDIT CLEARINGHOUSE AND INSTITUTION'S A-133 REPORTS (now Uniform Guidance 2 CFR 200). - DESK REVIEWS ARE PERFORMED, AND PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS APPROVE ALL INVOICES.
THE COLLEGE VERIFIES THAT THE RECIPIENT MEETS THE GUIDELINES OF EACH SPECIFIC AWARD. THE COLLEGE APPLIES GRANT MONIES DIRECTLY TO STUDENT BALANCES.

SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 FOR THE PERIOD JULY 1, 2015 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2016, DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTED FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS AS WELL AS OTHER FINANCIAL AID. FINANCIAL AID IS GRANTED TO STUDENTS BASED ON ELIGIBILITY GUIDELINES AS DEFINED BY THE FEDERAL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION AS WELL AS THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY. IF A STUDENT IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FEDERAL OR STATE BASED FINANCIAL AID, THE AID WILL NOT BE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. IN ADDITION, DREW UNIVERSITY GRANTS FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF INSTITUTIONAL AID BASED ON MERIT AND NEED CRITERIA.

Grants are made and monitored in accordance with Federal and institutional financial aid policies. Amounts are applied to student accounts as credits to the bill at the Bursar's office to offset academic charges.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: All student scholarships, grants, or other assistance are monitored throughout the award, acceptance, and application processes. Appropriate records are maintained and documented.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. CHAMPLAIN OFFERS BOTH MERIT AID AND NEED-BASED AID. MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RENEWED ANNUALLY PROVIDED THE STUDENT IS ENROLLED FULL-TIME AND MEETS ALL ACADEMIC STANDARDS. NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE RENEWED ANNUALLY BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED; THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) FORM MUST BE COMPLETED IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THESE AWARDS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS STUDENTS TO ENSURE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY FOR THE TYPE OF AID THEY ARE RECEIVING. AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER (FALL, SPRING, SUMMER), EVERY FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS PROGRESS IS REVIEWED BY THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. STUDENTS ARE MEASURED USING BOTH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE STANDARDS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS REVIEW IS TO MEASURE WHETHER A STUDENT IS MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TOWARDS GRADUATION. THESE STANDARDS APPLY TO ALL TYPES OF FINANCIAL AID: FEDERAL, STATE AND INSTITUTIONAL AID. STUDENTS WHO FAIL TO MEET THE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS REQUIREMENTS MAY BECOME INELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID UNTIL THEY ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THESE REQUIREMENTS.
Financial Aid funds are awarded and monitored by the Financial Aid Department. Research awards are monitored by the Office of Sponsored Research.

THE COLLEGE PROVIDED FULL-TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO ALL STUDENTS THROUGH THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2014. IN APRIL 2013, THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF THE COOPER UNION VOTED TO REDUCE THE BASELINE SCHOLARSHIP TO A MINIMUM OF 50% FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS BEGINNING WITH THE CLASS ENTERING IN FALL 2014. THE COLLEGE DESIGNATED A TUITION RATE OF $40,800 and $39,600 FOR FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS FOR THE YEARS ENDED JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015. STUDENTS WHO CAN DEMONSTRATE NEED, AS CALCULATED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID, MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL AID. COOPER UNION AWARDS FEDERAL PELL GRANTS, AND FEDERAL SEOG GRANTS, AS WELL AS COOPER UNION GRANTS, TO STUDENTS WHO MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS.

UNIVERSITY OF PIKEVILLE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY ENTERING EACH STUDENT AND THEIR INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIP ON THE UNIVERSITY'S ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE, DATATEL. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTED BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH BY THE UNIVERSITY ADMINISTRATION AND FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.

Budgeted amounts are awarded to eligible students who apply for financial aid (selected by committee or using packaging rules). Awarded students are checked to ensure that they are still eligible to receive these funds during the course of the academic year. The scholarships are applied directly to each student's account.

ONCE THE SPECIFIC CRITERIA FOR EACH SCHOLARSHIP HAVE BEEN REVIEWED AND MET, GFU DISBURSES FINANCIAL AID FUNDS TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNT DIRECTLY, ENSURING THAT THE FUNDS ARE USED AS INTENDED FOR TUITION AND EDUCATIONAL COSTS.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING BROOKLYN LAW SCHOOL AND ARE A DIRECT OFFSET OF TUITION. FELLOWSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS UNDER STRICT SELECTION CRITERIA. LOAN FORGIVENESS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE LENDER OR REQUIRES PROOF OF DEBT REDUCTION FROM THE STUDENT.

THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TOTAL AMOUNTS REPORTED HERE AND ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 2 IS DUE TO THE ACCRUAL OF SCHOLARSHIP EXPENSES FOR LRAP II. LRAP II IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT PRINCE AND CARSWELL MERIT SCHOLARSHIP GRADUATES WHO MAY TAKE LONGER IN THEIR JOB SEARCH TO FIND MEANINGFUL EMPLOYMENT. UNDER THE PROGRAM, IF THESE GRADUATES HAVE NOT FOUND FULL-TIME PROFESSIONAL POSITIONS NINE MONTHS AFTER GRADUATION, THEY WILL RECEIVE A LUMP SUM PAYMENT OF THEIR TOTAL OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS PAID WHILE ATTENDING THE LAW SCHOOL. (NOTE: THIS PROGRAM WAS DISCONTINUED FOR THE ENTERING CLASS OF 2016 AND BEYOND). THERE WERE NO PAYMENTS MADE IN FY16.

YESHIVA UNIVERSITY CONDUCTS SITE VISITS AND FOLLOW-UP DISCUSSIONS WITH THE MANAGEMENT OF GRANTEES TO ASSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. THE ACTIVITIES OF FELLOWSHIP RECIPIENTS ARE MONITORED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH THE INTENTIONS AND GUIDELINES OF THE FELLOWSHIP GRANT.

THE $82,686,120 IN GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID, SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS, INCLUDING EMERGENCY STUDENT ASSISTANCE GRANTS. FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED UPON FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. NEED BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON ELIGIBILITY DETERMINED BY THE US DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION'S FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL AID (FAFSA). ACADEMIC BASED AID IS AWARDED BY THE DISTINGUISHED SCHOLARS COMMITTEE. BOTH FACULTY AND ENROLLMENT SERVICES ADMINISTRATORS COMPRISE THE COMMITTEE.
GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING THE COLLEGE AND ARE DIRECTLY APPLIED AGAINST THEIR TUITION COSTS.

SCHEDULE I, Part I, Line 2 SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. THE COLLEGE MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENT, ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF EXPENDED FUNDS IS PERFORMED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT AND COLLEGE GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THE DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: GEORGETOWN UNIVERSITY IS NOT A "GRANTMAKER" PER SE IN THAT ITS FUNDAMENTAL MISSION, AND PURPOSE FOR TAX-EXEMPTION, RELATES TO EDUCATION AND RESEARCH. HOWEVER, IN THE COURSE OF THESE MISSION-related ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY DOES MAKE PAYMENTS THAT MEET THE CRITERIA FOR "GRANTMAKING" AS DEFINED BY THE INSTRUCTIONS TO SCHEDULE I OF THE FORM 990. THESE PAYMENTS FALL INTO TWO CATEGORIES: (1) STUDENT FINANCIAL AID - THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED EITHER ON FINANCIAL NEED OR ACADEMIC MERIT; THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES (THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE) DETERMINES STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED AID. VARIOUS ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY FOR MERIT-BASED AID; and (2) CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS - CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICY.

MARYGROVE COLLEGE ASSISTS STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED, STUDENT ACCOMPLISHMENT AND ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. ALL STUDENTS REQUESTING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID. THIS INFORMATION IS REVIEWED MARYGROVE COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID STAFF. GRANT AWARDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Rocky Mountain College awards financial aid which comes from federal and state funds, endowment funds, donations, etc. The students are selected based on the individual fund requirements and is posted to their account as a reduction. If funds exceed tuition and fees, the student is given the extra funds for living expenses.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: STUDENTS ARE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON AN EVALUATION OF NEED AND ELIGIBILITY FOR SPECIFIC AWARDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ANY DONOR STIPULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS AND FOR MONITORING ONGOING ELIGIBILITY (E.G. MAINTENANCE OF SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.)

EVERY FULL-TIME TRADITIONAL UNDERGRADUATE STUDENT IS CONSIDERED FOR MERIT-BASED FINANCIAL AID. MERIT-BASED AID IS DETERMINED BY THE ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT'S ANALYSIS OF A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS, SUCH AS STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES AND HIGH SCHOOL TRANSCRIPTS. A STUDENT INTERESTED IN RECEIVING NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID IS REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) FOR EACH SCHOOL YEAR. ONCE ALL THE ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA ARE MET AND ALL NECESSARY DOCUMENTS ARE OBTAINED, EITHER THROUGH REVIEW OF THE ISIR OR BY EFFORTS OF THE FINANCIAL AID COUNSELOR, THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT IS DETERMINED BY THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE COST OF ATTENDANCE AT XAVIER AND THE EFC TOWARD THOSE COSTS. AFTER THE FINANCIAL NEED FOR THE STUDENT IS CALCULATED, THE FINANCIAL AID PACKAGE FOR EACH STUDENT IS DETERMINED BY THE BANNER SYSTEM BASED ON THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC MERIT, TALENT, ENROLLMENT STATUS, LEVEL IN SCHOOL, AND DEPENDENCY STATUS. AWARD LETTERS (VIA E-MAIL OR REGULAR MAIL) ARE THEN PREPARED AND SENT TO EACH STUDENT, NOTIFYING THEM OF WHAT TYPES OF AWARDS THEY ARE DEEMED ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE. THE STUDENT THEN HAS THE OPTION TO DECLINE ANY AID THAT IS OFFERED TO THEM. XAVIER USES PASSIVE ACCEPTANCE OF AID OFFERED.
FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MAINTAINS RECORDS TO SUBSTANTIATE ALL AMOUNTS GIVEN IN FINANCIAL AID.

THE COLLEGE AWARDS GRANTS ON A FISCAL YEAR BASED ACCORDING TO THE OVERALL YEARLY BUDGET. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE PACKAGED BASED ON AN OVERALL COLLEGE STRATEGY EMPLOYING NEED AND MERIT CRITERIA. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS TO PREPARE PACKAGES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WORKS WITH STUDENTS TO ACCEPT AND/OR ADJUST INDIVIDUAL GRANTS. THE COLLEGE ALSO PROVIDES CHARITABLE SUPPORT TO U.S. SECTION 501(C)(3) PUBLIC CHARITIES IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS MISSION.

Students' eligibility to receive financial assistance from Concordia University Chicago is determined by policy approved by the Board of Regents. On a basis of careful analysis of the financial statements, the Director of Financial Aid determines the amount of aid available from various sources. Next, the amount that the student and his or her family can reasonably be expected to provide is calculated. The difference is called "demonstrated need." Financial assistance is awarded based on the student's demonstrated need for that year. Concordia-Chicago provides scholarships. All recipients are unrelated expect for tuition benefits provided under Concordia-Chicago's tuition grant program to eligible employees, their spouses, and dependents. This tuition grant program is in accordance with IRC section 117(d). Concordia University Chicago also provides student assistance through work-study.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 EMERSON COLLEGE AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PRIMARILY ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED. COLLEGE MONITORING OF THE FUNDS INCLUDES DIRECTLY CREDITING AWARDS TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNTS WHICH ASSURES THAT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE EDUCATION PURPOSE INTENDED. ALL AID RECIPIENTS MUST MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AS OUTLINED IN THE EMERSON COLLEGE STUDENT HANDBOOK. STUDENTS RECEIVING FEDERAL AID MUST HAVE A MINIMUM OF A "C" (2.0) GRADE POINT AVERAGE BY THE END OF THEIR SECOND ACADEMIC YEAR. FINANCIAL AID RECIPIENTS MAY NOT BE IN DEFAULT ON ANY EDUCATION LOANS, OWE A REFUND ON ANY GRANT, OR DEMONSTRATE ANY UNWILLINGNESS TO REPAY AN EDUCATIONAL LOAN.

KFF OPERATES SOLELY FOR THE BENEFIT OF KCC. ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE MADE BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS/REQUESTS FROM THE COLLEGE. EACH GRANT WILL ACCOMPLISH THE EDUCATIONAL GOALS AND PURPOSES OF THE COLLEGE. THE ORGANIZATION MONITORS PROPER USE OF THE FUNDS BY MAINTAINING CONTINUAL CONTACT WITH RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS.

Schedule I, Part I Line 2 - and Schedule I Part III, Line 1 - Southwestern Law School offers a number of scholarships from income provided by gifts from donors as well as its own general funds. Qualifications for amounts of scholarships vary, but the determination of awards is generally based on financial need and scholastic achievement, as well as the amount of funds available. Schedule I Part III, Line 2 - Federal Work-study Grants are awarded to assist student in meeting their educational expenses through part-time employment, and to encourage them to participate in community service activities. Once funds have been approved by Financial Aid office, the student must secure a position through an eligible employer. Schedule I Part III, Line 3 - Faculty Research Grants are awarded for faculty research in accord with written policies, based on annual written applications from full-time members of the faculty. The applicant's record of compliance with the terms of previous stipend awards, assessment of the prior and proposed research and available funds are all considered. The Dean and the Dean of Research make recommendations to the Trustee Committee on Educational Policy, which makes its recommendation to the Board of Trustees. Schedule I Part III - Regarding professorships, the Dean makes recommendations to the Board of Trustees of those Professors of Law to be named to Professorships and Endowed Chairs, and the Board acts to bestow the honor of this status, generally for a term of years. Distinction in research and quality teaching are essential. Where donor restrictions on a particular professorship or Chair call for subject matter expertise or other qualifications, those restrictions are taken into account as well. There were no professorships awarded during the current year.

MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT, REGARDLESS OF FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT ALL REQUIRED INFORMATION (INCLUDING A STANDARD APPLICATION FORM, ESSAYS, RECOMMENDATIONS, AND STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES) TO APPLY FOR A MERIT SCHOLARSHIP. APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED BY A COMMITTEE. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF ALL APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS FOR MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS. NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS BASED SOLELY ON FAMILY FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST SUBMIT ALL REQUIRED INFORMATION (INCLUDING A STANDARD APPLICATION FORM AND FEDERAL TAX INFORMATION) TO APPLY FOR A NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP. APPLICATIONS ARE SCREENED BY A COLLEGE REPRESENTATIVE AND A STANDARD FINANCIAL AID CALCULATOR IS USED. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF ALL APPLICATIONS AND AWARDS FOR NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. CREDITS AGAINST ROOM AND BOARD CHARGES ARE ISSUED TO WYOMING CATHOLIC COLLEGE STUDENTS WHO ARE ASSIGNED TO RESIDENT ASSISTANT POSITIONS. CREDITS ARE GIVEN IN STANDARD AMOUNTS. DETAILED RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED OF CREDITS GIVEN.

THE PROCEDURES FOR NEED-BASED AWARDS INCLUDE REVIEW AND RESOLUTION OF ALL FEDERAL-PROCESSOR-IDENTIFIED ELIGIBILITY CONFLICTS, AND 100% VERIFICATION OF REPORTED PARENT AND STUDENT INCOMES. FOR ALL FUNDS, THERE IS A SEPARATION OF THE AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT FUNCTIONS (DIFFERENT INDIVIDUALS RESPONSIBLE FOR EACH), MONTHLY RECONCILIATIONS BETWEEN STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND THE COLLEGE'S GENERAL LEDGER, AND AN ANNUAL AUDIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133.
THE CASH GRANT IS REFLECTED ON STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 ALL FEDERAL TITLE IV FUNDS RECEIVED BY BRYANT UNIVERSITY ARE MANAGED IN STRICT COMPLIANCE WITH ALL REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH IN THE PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT, A FORMAL AGREEMENT BETWEEN BRYANT UNIVERSITY AND THE U.S DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. THE PROGRAM PARTICIPATION AGREEMENT IS PERSONALLY ENDORSED BY BOTH THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER OF BRYANT UNIVERSITY AND THE SECRETARY OF THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION. COMPLIANCE WITH ALL TITLE IV REQUIREMENTS IS MONITORED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF FOUR (EXEMPT) PROFESSIONAL FINANCIAL AID ADMINISTRATORS AND FOUR (NON-EXEMPT) SUPPORT STAFF MEMBERS. COMPLIANCE CAPABILITY IS GREATLY ENHANCED THROUGH THE USE OF THE BANNER INTEGRATED MANAGEMENT INFORMATION SYSTEM AND ITS EFFECTIVE INTERFACE WITH OTHER DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION SYSTEMS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE FOR COMMUNITY SUPPORT TO VARIOUS ORGANIZATIONS THROUGH THEIR FUNDRAISING EVENTS. IN THE CURRENT YEAR, NO ONE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED OVER $5,000 FROM THE UNIVERSITY IN THIS CAPACITY.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID & SCHOLARSHIPS. FULL FINANCIAL SUPPORT IS OFFERED TO ALL STUDENTS. ALL PHD STUDENTS AT TTIC MAY EXPECT TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL SUPPORT THAT COVERS TUITION AND A STIPEND TO ASSIST WITH LIVING EXPENSES.
THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON STUDENT FINANCIAL NEED AND ABILITY. BOTH ARE BASED ON SET CRITERIA.

THE STUDENTS MUST APPLY FOR THE GRANTS AND MEET THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE VARIOUS GRANTS. THE PROCESS BY WHICH EACH GRANT IS AWARDED AND MONITORED IS FORMALIZED IN A POLICY WHICH IS UPDATED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID.

THE COLLEGE UTILIZES VARIOUS DATABASES TO STORE AND MONITOR DATA PERTAINING TO THE AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT OF GRANTS RECEIVED IN THE US. ALL GRANTS RECEIVED ARE PROPERLY APPLIED AS PAYMENTS TOWARD STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS APPROPRIATELY. ALL PARTICIPATING GRANTING ORGANIZATIONS HAVE COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS THAT ARE ADHERED TO AND AUDITED ANNUALLY IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE OFFICE OF BUDGET AND MANAGEMENT (OMB) CIRCULAR A-133, AUDITS OF STATES, LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. AS SUCH, THE COLLEGE PRESENTS SCHEDULES OF EXPENDITURES OF FEDERAL AND STATE AWARDS SUMMARIZING ALL EXPENDITURES USING THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING.

Procedure for Monitoring Grants: Grants to organizations and individuals awarded for the purpose of conducting research are monitored as follows: Subcontracts are issued with a defined scope of work and a budget and include other terms and conditions such as frequency of required reporting. The faculty member at the University of Miami responsible for the grant monitors the scientific progress via site visits, correspondence, reports, etc. Invoices submitted for payments by the outside organization or by an individual are approved by the University of Miami Faculty member responsible for the grant.

Assistance to the University students in the form of scholarships are awarded for the purpose of aiding with the cost of attending the University (i.e., for tuition, housing and meals). Scholarships are based on need and academic achievement. Total scholarships, grants and loans cannot exceed the total cost of attendance. The University publishes criteria for the eligibility requirements needed to award a scholarship. The amount of aid awarded is based on a need analysis formula developed by the federal government and includes verification of the information submitted by the student.
THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS AND MAINTAINS RECORDS REGARDING ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS.

EACH YEAR APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF VERIFY THE INFORMATION REPORTED ON THE APPLICATION AND AWARD EACH SCHOLARSHIP TO A QUALIFIED CANDIDATE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE DOES NOT AWARD ANY AID TO A STUDENT WHO IS NOT ENROLLED. EACH SEMESTER A LIST OF ENROLLED STUDENTS IS COMPARED TO A LIST OF STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN AWARDED ANY TYPE OF FINANCIAL AID.
SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISCOUNTS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND FINANCIAL NEED AND ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE OFFICES OF ADMISSIONS AND STUDENT SERVICES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 - MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRADUATE STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE SEMINARY RECEIVE A FULL TUITION SCHOLARSHIP. STUDENTS ADMITTED TO THE KOLLEL LEARNING PROGRAMS MAY ALSO RECEIVE A STIPEND AND/OR HOUSING BENEFIT. SITE VISITS AND FOLLOW-UP DISCUSSIONS WITH THE MANAGEMENT OF GRANTEES ARE CONDUCTED TO ASSURE THAT GRANT FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED TAX-EXEMPT EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.
The Office of Student Financing is responsible for the monitoring of all student aid. All grant aid is applied directly to the student accounts.

A NUMBER OF COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE TO DEGREE STUDENTS. COMPLETION OF A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION FORM IS REQUIRED. FORMS ARE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. AN APPLICATION MUST BE SUBMITTED 30 DAYS PRIOR TO THE QUARTER FOR WHICH THE SCHOLARSHIP IS BEING REQUESTED.

The College's office of financial planning monitors all awards to ensure compliance with Federal and state regulations. Additionally, the college engages an independent audit in accordance with OMB A-133.

STUDENTS INTERESTED IN APPLYING FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE MUST SUBMIT A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND CONCORDIA'S APPLICATION FOR FINANCIAL AID. CHURCH-WORK STUDENTS MUST ALSO COMPLETE A DECLARATION OF INTENT FROM THEIR HOME CHURCH. WHEN ALL REQUIRED FORMS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED IN THE OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES (SFS), SFS COMPUTES THE STUDENT'S ESTIMATED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION (EFC) AND COMPILES AN AWARD PACKAGE OF SCHOLARSHIPS, GRANTS, LOANS AND WORK STUDY PROGRAMS. ELIGIBILITY FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE REQUIRES THAT A STUDENT BE ACCEPTED FOR ADMISSION OR ENROLLED AND MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS ACCORDING TO ESTABLISHED STANDARDS.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS - THE COLLEGE ENSURES THAT ITS GRANTS OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ARE USED FOR THE INTENDED EDUCATIONAL PURPOSE BY APPLYING THE AWARDS DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENTS' TUITION BALANCES INSTEAD OF ISSUING CHECKS. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES ENTREPRENEURIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL GRANTS THROUGH ITS LAUNCH U PROGRAM AND GREEN EDGE FUND. POTENTIAL GRANTEES SUBMIT APPLICATIONS FOR THE GRANTS, AND AFTER A RIGOROUS REVIEW PROCESS, GRANTS ARE AWARDED. GRANTEES ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT REPORTS WHICH INDICATE HOW THE GRANT FUNDS WERE SPENT.

THE COLLEGE FIRST INSPECTS CHARGES TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE APPROPRIATE AND ALLOWABLE. THIS INCLUDES CHECKING CLERICAL ACCURACY AND CHECKING COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE AGENCY AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. THE COLLEGE ALSO MAKES SURE THAT EXPENSE FALLS WITHIN THE REQUIRED CATEGORIES AND BUDGET AMOUNTS. THE COLLEGE SETS UP A SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNT FOR EACH GRANT THAT IS RECEIVED IN ORDER TO PROVIDE COMPLETE DOCUMENTATION AND TRACK EXPENSES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, LINE 2 AND PART III
ExplntnTxt: Student Financial Aid STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BY THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES. AWARDS ARE BASED ON A NUMBER OF FACTORS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, SCHOLARLY ACHIEVEMENT, DEMONSTRATED FINANCIAL NEED, AND ACADEMIC INTERESTS. FUNDS ARE PROVIDED BY SOURCES SUCH AS FEDERAL AND STATE GOVERNMENTS; PRIVATE DONORS SUCH AS CORPORATIONS, INDIVIDUALS AND FOUNDATIONS; THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED FINANCIAL AID FUNDS; AND THE COLLEGE'S OPERATING BUDGET. FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE MADE UP TO A LIMIT OF THE STUDENT'S FINANCIAL NEED. INDIVIDUAL AWARDS ARE MONITORED EXTENSIVELY IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT STUDENTS ARE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND THAT THEY DO NOT RECEIVE MORE THAN THEIR DEMONSTRATED NEED. ADJUSTMENTS ARE MADE WHEN APPROPRIATE.

PRESIDENT'S DIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIP THE PRESIDENT'S DIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIP IS A NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIP WHICH SUPPORTS CULTURAL AND ECONOMIC DIVERSITY AMONG THE SOFIA STUDENT COMMUNITY. THE SCHOLARSHIP HELPS NEW INCOMING STUDENTS AND CONTINUING FULL-TIME STUDENTS MEET THE COSTS OF EDUCATION. ELIGIBILITY: INCOMING STUDENTS WHO HAVE BEEN ACCEPTED INTO A UNIVERSITY PROGRAM OR CONTINUING FULL-TIME STUDENTS. THE AWARDS ARE NEED-BASED WITH AN EMPHASIS ON CULTURAL AND ECONOMIC DIVERSITY IN THE STUDENT BODY. AWARD DISBURSEMENT: EACH APPLICATION WILL BE CONSIDERED ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. AFRICAN AMERICAN - APPLICANTS MUST BE 3RD YEAR FULL TIME PHD AND MUST BE AFRICAN AMERICAN WITH GOOD ATTENDANCE, FINANCIAL NEEDS AND CONTRIBUTION TO SOFIA UNIVERSITY. APPLICANTS MUST ALSO FOLLOW THE APPLICATION INSTRUCTION AND MUST WRITE 2 PAGES COVER LETTER. LARISSA KEET MEMORIAL SCHOLARSHIP FUND THE LARISSA KEET MEMORIAL SCHOLARSHIP FUND HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED TO KEEP ALIVE THE MEMORY OF SOFIA UNIVERSITY ALUMNA, LARISSA KEET, AND TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO CURRENT SOFIA UNIVERSITY STUDENTS WHO DEMONSTRATE COMMITMENT TO THE CAUSES TO WHICH LARISSA DEDICATED HER LIFE. ELIGIBILITY: SCHOLARLY EXCELLENCE AND DEMONSTRATED PRESENT COMMITMENT TO SERVING ORGANIZATIONS DEDICATED TO SOCIAL JUSTICE, PEACE, WOMEN'S RIGHTS AND/OR ENVIRONMENTAL CAUSES. NOT NECESSARILY NEED BASED. GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING. AWARD DISBURSEMENT: EACH APPLICATION WILL BE CONSIDERED ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON THEIR COVER LETTER AND THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE REVIEWS EACH APPLICANTS APPLICATION.

FINANCIAL AID INFORMATION IS PUBLISHED IN THE COLLEGE FOR CREATIVE STUDIES ADMISSIONS MATERIAL, WHICH IS GIVEN TO EACH STUDENT CANDIDATE, AS WELL AS ON THE CCS WEBSITE, WWW.COLLEGEFORCREATIVESTUDIES.EDU. ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED BY AN ANALYSIS OF FAMILY RESOURCES FOR THE MOST RECENT CALENDAR YEAR TO ASSESS A FAMILY'S ABILITY TO CONTRIBUTE TO COLLEGE COSTS. ADJUSTMENTS TO AN APPLICATION CAN BE MADE BECAUSE OF A MAJOR CHANGE IN CIRCUMSTANCE, SUCH AS DEATH, DIVORCE, OR LOSS OF EMPLOYMENT/BENEFITS. TO RECEIVE FEDERAL OR STATE FINANCIAL AID FROM CCS, STUDENTS MUST DEMONSTRATE FINANCIAL NEED, BE ACCEPTED FOR ENROLLMENT IN A DEGREE-SEEKING PROGRAM, BE ENROLLED AT THE COLLEGE, MAINTAIN A SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, AND BE A U.S. CITIZEN OR PERMANENT RESIDENT. IN ADDITION, A STUDENT MUST BE REGISTERED WITH SELECTIVE SERVICE (OR BE EXEMPT) AND CANNOT OWE A REFUND ON PREVIOUS TITLE IV FUNDS RECEIVED OR BE IN DEFAULT ON ANY STUDENT LOAN. ALL STUDENTS MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) TO BE CONSIDERED FOR NEED-BASED AID. THIS FORM IS AVAILABLE ON-LINE AT FAFSA.ED.GOV OR HIGH SCHOOL GUIDANCE OFFICES, OR ANY COLLEGE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE RECOMMENDED FILING DEADLINE FOR HIGH SCHOOL SENIORS RESIDING IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN WHO ARE CONSIDERING STATE AID IS MARCH 1ST. TRANSFER AND CONTINUING STUDENTS SHOULD SUBMIT THEIR APPLICATION BY MARCH 1ST AS WELL. THE FINANCIAL AID CYCLE FAVORS THOSE STUDENTS WHO FILE IN A TIMELY FASHION AND COMPLETE THE REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION EARLY. CCS' TITLE IV CODE IS 006771. GRANT/SCHOLARSHIP AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT'S TUITION ACCOUNTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Procedure for Monitoring Use of Grant Funds Inside United States
ExplntnTxt: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Ripon College tracks all grants issued by grant, dollar amount, student, and term. Financial Aid awards grants based on the grantees eligibility for any grant. Eligibility may be based on need, grades, majors, etc. If need based, the FAFSA will be utilized. Each grant may have unique selection criteria which is documented by the Financial Aid Department.

FINANCIAL AID IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS TO COVER ANY OUTSTANDING INSTITUTIONAL CHARGES. ANY CREDIT BALANCE IS REFUNDED TO THE STUDENT TO BE USED FOR OTHER EDUCATIONAL-RELATED EXPENSES. STUDENTS RECEIVING FEDERAL AND/OR STATE AID MUST COMPLETE THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). BY SIGNING THE FAFSA, THE STUDENT AGREES THAT HE OR SHE "WILL USE FEDERAL AND/OR STATE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID ONLY TO PAY THE COST OF ATTENDING AN INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION."

PART I, LINE 2 USC NEIGHBORHOOD OUTREACH FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED THROUGH A COMPETITIVE GRANT MAKING PROCESS. A GRANT REVIEW COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF UNIVERSITY FACULTY, AND STAFF VOLUNTEERS REVIEWS ALL GRANTS, AND PROVIDES FUNDING RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON A SET OF CRITERIA. ALL FINAL GRANT AWARD DECISIONS ARE MADE BY CIVIC ENGAGEMENT. USC NEIGHBORHOOD OUTREACH monitors the grant awards through an interim report six months into the project, and a final cumulative report at the end of the project. We conduct ad hoc site visits to observe the program and review EDUCATION CONSORTIUM OF CENTRAL LA (ECCLA) accounting records. THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ADMINISTERS ONE OF THE NATION'S LARGEST FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS THROUGH ITS FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AWARDING $483 MILLION IN AID TO OVER TWO-THIRDS OF OUR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS. WE WILL MEET THE FULL USC-DETERMINED FINANCIAL NEED OF ALL ADMITTED UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS WHO MEET ALL FEDERAL, STATE, AND UNIVERSITY ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND DEADLINES. STUDENTS AND THEIR PARENTS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT ALL APPLICATIONS AND SUPPORT DOCUMENTS, MEETING ALL DEADLINES, IN ORDER TO MAKE THEIR CLAIM FOR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND TO BE CONSIDERED FOR FINANCIAL AID. PART II THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ALSO ADMINISTERS SUB-AWARDS FOR RESEARCH TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS IN CONNECTION WITH RESEARCH GRANTS AWARDED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA DOES NOT REPORT THESE SUB-AWARDS AS GRANTS ON FORM 990, SCHEDULE I SINCE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PERFORM RESEARCH SERVICES FOR THE UNIVERSITY. PART III, COLUMN(C) THE CASH GRANT IS REFLECTED ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANTS THE COLLEGE HAS A FINANCIAL AID OFFICE WHO HANDLES ALL FINANCIAL AID AWARDS. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN APPLICATION FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE SUMMARIZES ALL THE RELEVANT DATA FROM THE APPLICATIONS AND PRESENTS IT TO THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE CREATED FOR EACH DEPARTMENT/PROGRAM THAT HAS SCHOLARSHIP MONEY. THESE COMMITTEES CONSISTS OF FACULTY, STAFF AND ADMINISTRATION. EACH COMMITTEE REVIEWS ALL APPLICANTS AND SCHOLARSHIP REQUIREMENTS, THEN DECIDES WHO WILL RECEIVE THE AWARDS.

INSTITUTIONAL MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF DEMONSTRATED ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE AND PROMISE FOR FUTURE SUCCESS AT THE COLLEGE. WHILE A NUMBER OF FACTORS ARE CONSIDERED, THE COLLEGE RELIES HEAVILY ON THE EVALUATION OF HIGH SCHOOL COURSEWORK, HIGH SCHOOL GRADE POINT AVERAGES AND CLASS RANK, STANDARDIZED TEST SCORES, WRITTEN WORK AND LETTERS OF RECOMMENDATION. EXTRACURRICULAR INVOLVEMENT THAT DEMONSTRATES A PROMISE FOR SUCCESS AT THE COLLEGIATE LEVEL IS ALSO CONSIDERED. SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT FOR PAYMENT TOWARD TUITION, ROOM, BOARD AND FEES.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES A STUDENT'S ELIGIBILITY BASED ON THE FAMILY'S FINANCIAL STRENGTH, WHICH INCLUDES CONSIDERATION OF FAMILY INCOME AND ASSETS, NUMBER OF CHILDREN IN COLLEGE AND IF APPROPRIATE, SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. FINANCIAL AID WILL BE REVOKED WITHOUT ADEQUATE PROGRESS.

ELIGIBILITY FOR GRANT AID IS DETERMINED BY A FORMAL APPLICATION PROCESS (FAFSA) AND GUIDED BY FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS. COLLEGE PERSONNEL CONFIRM EACH RECIPIENT'S PAST AND CURRENT AID VIA FEDERAL (NSLDS) AND STATE PROVIDED SOFTWARE. COMPLIANCE AUDITS BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM ARE CONDUCTED ANNUALLY.

NSU Office of Sponsored Programs maintains a written, formal policy that outlines the procedures and guidelines for monitoring the use of sponsored funds by subrecipients. Prior to entering into a subaward agreement, NSU will assess subrecipient risk based on factors such as financial stability, experience with federal awards, quality of management systems and internal controls, and prior audit results. NSU will determine what type of monitoring activities are warranted based on risk, and develop a subrecipient monitoring plan. NSU will subsequently enter into a subaward agreement with each subrecipient which properly identifies prime award information, compliance requirements, and subrecipient monitoring documents required, as applicable. Throughout the period of performance, the Principal Investigator for the project monitors the programmatic activities of the subrecipient; determining that appropriate progress has been made; receiving, reviewing and retaining copies of required programmatic reports; and reviewing/approving subrecipient invoices prior to submitting to the NSU Office of Sponsored Programs for approval and processing. As part of the initial risk assessment and throughout the period of performance of the subaward, NSU will collaboratively review any deficiencies pertaining to the sponsored award that are identified through audits or other means, and issue a management decision. Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: Institutional grants awarded to students are recorded to individual student accounts and to each college departmental account using specific contra revenue account codes. The number of recipients and amount of awards varies by center and program. Funds set aside for scholarships are budgeted annually and included in the University's budget plan approved by the Board of Trustees.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Scholarship funds can be used for tuition, books and living expenses. In general they are applied first to tuition and balances sent to students. It is reviewed every school term and is monitored in compliance with student aid protocols. All payments are monitored and approved by Student Services and Finance before payment is applied or paid to the student. All students receiving scholarships have been selected on a non-discretionary basis. The student loan program is audited every year in compliance with federal single audit standards

SPARTANBURG ACADEMIC MOVEMENT MADE A SPECIFIC GRANT APPLICATION TO PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS ON BEHALF OF HELP ME GROW SOUTH CAROLINA. THE TOTAL AMOUNT OF THE GRANT RECEIVED WAS PASSED THROUGH SPARTANBURG ACADEMIC MOVEMENT TO HELP ME GROW SOUTH CAROLINA, WHICH IS A COMPREHENSIVE SYSTEM THAT PROMOTES THE HEALTHY DEVELOPMENT OF ALL CHILDREN PRENATAL THROUGH FIVE YEARS OLD WITH AN EMPHASIS ON EARLY IDENTIFICATION OF CHILDREN AT RISK FOR DEVELOPMENTAL-BEHAVIORAL PROBLEMS AND THEIR LINKAGE TO COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THE HELP ME GROW SOUTH CAROLINA AFFILIATE IS PART OF THE NATIONAL HELP ME GROW NETWORK AND IS HOUSED WITHIN THE BRADSHAW INSTITUTE FOR COMMUNITY CHILD HEALTH & ADVOCACY, WHICH IS PART OF GREENVILLE HEALTH SYSTEM'S CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL.

EACH ACADEMIC YEAR THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT PROVIDES THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID A DETAILED LIST OF THE COLLEGE'S ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS, ALONG WITH THE CURRENT MARKET VALUE OF EACH SCHOLARSHIP, AND STATED CRITERIA RESTRICTIONS, IF ANY, REQUIRED FOR RECIPIENTS OF THOSE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, FROM THAT LIST PROVIDED BY THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL AID, MATCHES STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE INSTITUTIONAL AID WITH THOSE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS TO WHICH THEY ARE ELIGIBLE. THE LIST OF MATCHES IS THEN RETURNED TO THE OFFICE OF INSTITUTIONAL ADVANCEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED AND MERIT. THE FUNDS ARE CREDITED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROLS OF OMB-A133 (IN WHICH THEY FOLLOW ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES).

In the interest of partnering with non profits within the US in cross-cultural service, WCIU enters into Memorandums of Understanding with many of them. One benefit is that scholarships are offered to their members. Applicants referred to WCIU by the director or leader of those non profits receive scholarships according to the amount agreed to in the Memorandum of Understanding. Credits are issued to student accounts for tuition discounts and therefore, no cash has changed hands.

SCHEDULE I, Part I, Line 2 SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MANAGEMENT REVIEWS REQUESTS FOR GRANTS. TOURO UNIVERSITY MONITORS ALL REQUESTS FOR USE OF GRANT FUNDS AGAINST THE SUBMITTED BUDGETS FOR THE RESPECTIVE GRANTS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF REQUESTS FOR REIMBURSEMENT, ADDITIONAL REVIEW OF EXPENDED FUNDS IS PERFORMED TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANT AND COLLEGE GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THE DISCOUNTS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS.

THE STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE DETERMINED BY THE COLLEGE ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER OBJECTIVE STANDARDS. ALL AWARDED FUNDS ARE TREATED AS REDUCTIONS TO TUITION. NO FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO INDIVIDUALS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE ORGANIZATION USES STUDENT FINANCIAL AID GUIDELINES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. WITTENBERG UNIVERSITY ONLY AWARDS INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATELY FUNDED FINANCIAL AID AWARD AS ASSISTANCE FOR STUDENTS BASED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS, BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. IN DOING SO, THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT ADHERES STRICTLY TO ALL FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL REQUIREMENTS OF OMB-A133, IN WHICH THEY FOLLOW ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS GRANTS AND OTHER FORMS OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS BASED ON REVIEW OF SELECT DATA AND ACCORDING TO A SPECIFIED METHODOLOGY. DATA USED IS MAINTAINED IN EITHER PHYSICAL OR ELECTRONIC FORMAT UNTIL NO LONGER REQUIRED BY USED RECORD RETENTION GUIDELINES. GENERALLY, ALL RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED FOR THE MOST RECENT FISAP REPORTING YEAR, PLUS THE THREE YEARS PRIOR.

GEISINGER COMMONWEALTH SCHOOL OF MEDICINE PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS INCLUDING SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. GCSM FORMED A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE TO REVIEW AND SELECT SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS ACCORDING TO CRITERIA SPECIFIED BY THE DONOR. THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE IDENTIFIES ALL STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA AND THOSE STUDENTS ARE THEN SUBMITTED FOR REVIEW BY THE COMMITTEE. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE DETERMINED AND AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AFTER A REVIEW OF QUALIFIED APPLICANTS. THERE IS AN EXTENSIVE REVIEW PROCESS CONDUCTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO DETERMINE THE RECIPIENTS OF SUCH AID. FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING SCHOLARSHIPS, IS SUPPORTED BY INTERNAL FUNDS, GIFTS FROM PRIVATE DONORS AND INCOME EARNED ON ENDOWMENT FUNDS, DONOR RESTRICTED SCHOLARSHIPS AND OTHER STUDENT AID. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED ONLY TO GCSM'S TUITION AND FEES. NO CASH PAYMENTS ARE MADE TO STUDENTS FOR THESE SCHOLARSHIPS.

STUDENTS REQUESTING FINANCIAL AID ARE REQUIRED TO FILL OUT A FINANCIAL AID FORM FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE USES THIS INFORMATION TO DETERMINE WHICH STUDENTS QUALIFY FOR CERTAIN PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS (FOR EXAMPLE - PELL, PERKINS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY, SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT, ETC.)

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: TJU monitors subrecipients by reviewing financial and performance reports submitted by the recipient and regular contact with the subrecipient and inquiries concerning programmatic activities, including quarterly certifications by principal investigators that work is progressing according to scope and that deliverables are being met.
THE SCHOOL PROVIDES GRANTS IN THE FORM OF CREDITS AGAINST TUITION INVOICES. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT ACTUALLY DISBURSED FROM THE SCHOOL.
ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED FOR APPROPRIATE USE BY MONITORING REGISTRATION AND SATISFACTORY COMPLETION OF COURSES AND PROGRAMS TOWARDS EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: For all scholarship funds, financial aid has established specific criteria for eligibility and selection. The eligibility requirements are documented and monitored for compliance. Scholarships are credited to student tuition bills.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: ALL GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS REPRESENT SCHOLARSHIP/FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO U.S. STUDENTS TO ATTEND THE COLLEGE IN THE UNITED STATES. BENNINGTON MONITORS THE USE OF FUNDS THROUGH THE ANALYSIS OF TRANSCRIPTS, GRADES, AND WRITTEN NARRATIVES BY BOTH FACULTY AND STUDENTS. PROGRESS TOWARD THE REQUIREMENTS TO COMPLETE A DEGREE IS CLOSELY MONITORED. GRANTS ARE ONLY PROVIDED TO CURRENTLY ENROLLED STUDENTS.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Universitys financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The University also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS - ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED OR ACADEMIC MERIT. INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING DISTRIBUTIONS FROM THE UNIVERSITY ARE CHOSEN BASED UPON OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY CRITERIA WHICH ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE OVERALL TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSE OF THE UNIVERSITY. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE EITHER APPLIED TO STUDENTS' INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS AT DENISON, OR SENT DIRECTLY TO THE OFF-CAMPUS PROGRAM WITHIN THE UNITED STATES AT WHICH THE STUDENT IS STUDYING.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS - PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT IS STUDYING.

TO ENSURE THAT THE GRANTS MADE TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES, OTHER THAN WORK STUDY GRANTS, ARE USED FOR PROPER PURPOSES AND ARE NOT OTHERWISE DIVERTED FROM THE INTENDED USE, THE FACULTY DEPARTMENT THAT HAS BUDGETARY CONTROL OF THE FUNDS SELECTS AND MONITORS THE RECIPIENTS OF THESE GRANTS. FOR WORK STUDY GRANTS, THE FACULTY OR ADMINISTRATIVE DEPARTMENT WHERE THE STUDENT'S WORK WAS PERFORMED APPROVES ALL STUDENT WORK HOURS AND SUBMITS PAPERWORK TO THE PAYROLL OFFICE FOR PAYMENT TO THE STUDENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2

The Organization awards grants to students to be used for educational purposes by debiting the students account directly. This system ensures that the funds are used appropriately.

THE COLLEGE HAS A LIMITED AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT IS AVAILABLE TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS THROUGH ITS SCHOLARSHIP FUND. AWARDS ARE MADE ANNUALLY AND ARE DIVIDED OVER THE FALL AND SPRING TERM ENROLLMENTS. GENERAL QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS OF SOME OF THE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BY THE COLLEGE ARE AS FOLLOWS: CHRISTIAN WORKERS GRANT - FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHOSE PARENTS ARE IN FULL-TIME CHRISTIAN MINISTRY ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS GRANT. TRINITY COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP - NEW FULL-TIME STUDENTS WHO HAVE A MINIMUM ACT COMPOSITE SCORE OF 19 OR A MINIMUM COMBINED SAT SCORE OF 950 ARE ELIGIBLE FOR THIS SCHOLARSHIP. TRINITY COLLEGE GRANT - THIS GRANT IS AWARDED TO NEW OR CONTINUING FULL-TIME STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED. PAST OR EXPECTED STUDENT LEADERSHIP IS CONSIDERED. ExplntnTxt: Scholarship Funds, both budgeted and investments, are monitored by the Board of Directors and appointed staff, with dividends being awarded as scholarships by decision of the Financial Aid Office and/or the Scholarship Committee, and distributed through the Business Office.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS HAWAI`I PACIFIC UNIVERSITYS OFFICES OF FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS OVERSEE FEDERAL AND UNIVERSITY GRANT, SCHOLARSHIP, LOAN AND WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS. FEDERAL PROGRAMS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE LAWS, RULES AND REGULATIONS ISSUED BY THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES, OR OTHER GRANTING AGENCY. UNIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE ADMINISTERED ACCORDING TO THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES IMPLEMENTED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO SUPPORT THE UNIVERSITYS ENROLLMENT PLAN. THE OFFICES AWARD AID BASED ON THE FEDERAL FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION TO VERIFY A STUDENTS ELIGIBILITY FOR NEED BASED PROGRAMS AND SCHOLARSHIPS WHERE NEED IS A CRITERIA. IN ADDITION, STUDENTS ARE REVIEWED BASED ON ACADEMIC AND TALENT QUALIFICATIONS FOR MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS IN AREAS SUCH AS DANCE, ATHLETICS, MUSIC, DEBATE AND OTHER AREAS. PRESIDENTS SCHOLARS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON MERIT, GRADE POINT AVERAGE AND RECOMMENDATIONS. FINANCIAL AID AND THE SCHOLARSHIPS OFFICES MONITOR THE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY OF STUDENTS FOR AWARDS. OCEANIC INSTITUTE FOLLOWS ITS SUBCONTRACTING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS. PROGRAM MANAGER, GRANT SPECIALIST AND CONTROLLER REVIEW ALL SUBCONTRACTOR INVOICES AND SUPPORTING RECEIPTS. GRANT SPECIALIST COMPARES ACTUAL EXPENSES WITH BUDGETED EXPENSES AND REVIEWS SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS TO DETERMINE IF COSTS CLAIMED ARE ALLOWED, REASONABLE AND CONSISTENT WITH TECHNICAL PROGRESS.

Part I, Line 2: The awarding of student financial aid grants under the U.S. Department of Education's Student Financial Assistance Program is monitored by NEC's Financial Aid Office, which ensures that NEC meets the compliance requirements of OMB Circular A-133. NEC's Financial Aid Office and Business Office are responsible for establishing and maintaining effective internal controls over compliance with the requirements of laws, regulations, contracts, and grants applicable to federal programs.Only current NEC students in good standing are provided scholarship grants or other financial assistance. Grants and assistance to NEC College students are in the form of institutional scholarships. All College scholarships are administered through NEC's financial aid system. Institutional scholarships are credited to the student's internal tuition account and represent an offset to tuition and other fees assessed by NEC.Preparatory program, continuing education program and summer session scholarships are tracked separately and administered through NEC's student billing system. Preparatory program, continuing education program and summer session scholarships are credited to the student's internal tuition account and represent an offset to tuition and other fees assessed by NEC.Grants and assistance to NEC staff and their eligible spouses and dependents are in the form of staff tuition waivers, pursuant to a written benefits plan. Staff tuition waivers are administered through the Conservatory's benefits system and, like institutional scholarships for students, are credited to the individual's internal account to offset tuition changes.All students receiving scholarships and fellowships are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards.
IPS monitors its students to ensure the funds are appropriately used.

The College of Idaho uses a combination of federal methodology and instructional policy to provide a uniform method to assess a family's financial strength and the students academic performance to estimate the expected family contribution toward the student's cost of education. The cost of education includes tuition, fees, books, supplies, room, board, personal expenses and transportation allowance.

Bay Path University receives grant money from federal and state government agencies for student financial aid. This grant money is disbursed to student accounts as it is received by the University. Student awards are based on the federal and state guidelines for each type of grant. Grants to charitable organizations are made in accordance with established financial policies and procedures.

ALL APPLICATIONS ARE PRESCREENED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE FOR ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS BEFORE BEING PASSED TO RESPECTIVE ACADEMIC PROGRAM CHAIRS/HEADS FOR REVIEW AND RECOMMENDATION. RECOMMENDED APPLICATIONS ARE THEN REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE OR RESPECTIVE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEES BEFORE BEING FORWARDED TO THE PRESIDENT'S OFFICE FOR APPROVAL. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE NOTIFIES EACH AWARDEE AND DISBURSES SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS INTO THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNT AFTER VERIFYING EACH AWARDEE'S ENROLLMENT STATUS AND ACADEMIC STANDING AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH SEMESTER.

AWARDING OF INSTITUTIONAL AID IS DRIVEN BY THE AWARD THE STUDENT RECEIVES UPON ENTRANCE TO DAVIS COLLEGE. COMING IN AS A NEW STUDENT, THE ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE FIRST DETERMINES IF THE STUDENT IS ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT BASED AWARDS. THESE AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC AND CO-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES. EACH STUDENT IS THEN COMPARED TO A FINANCIAL AID AWARDING MATRIX WHICH IS COMPRISED OF VARYING NEED LEVELS FOR GRANT FUNDING, CAMPUS BASED AID AND CAMPUS EMPLOYMENT. STUDENTS ARE PLACED ON THIS GRID BY USING THE ADMISSIONS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA TO DETERMINE THEIR RATING AND THEN THEIR FINANCIAL NEED FACTOR AS DETERMINED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) FOR THAT ACADEMIC YEAR.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS ATTENDING BROOKLYN LAW SCHOOL AND ARE A DIRECT OFFSET OF TUITION. FELLOWSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS UNDER STRICT SELECTION CRITERIA. LOAN FORGIVENESS ARE PAID DIRECTLY TO THE LENDER OR REQUIRES PROOF OF DEBT REDUCTION FROM THE STUDENT.

THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE TOTAL AMOUNTS REPORTED HERE AND ON FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 2 IS DUE TO THE ACCRUAL OF SCHOLARSHIP EXPENSES FOR LRAP II. LRAP II IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT PRINCE AND CARSWELL MERIT SCHOLARSHIP GRADUATES WHO MAY TAKE LONGER IN THEIR JOB SEARCH TO FIND MEANINGFUL EMPLOYMENT. UNDER THE PROGRAM, IF THESE GRADUATES HAVE NOT FOUND FULL-TIME PROFESSIONAL POSITIONS NINE MONTHS AFTER GRADUATION, THEY WILL RECEIVE A LUMP SUM PAYMENT OF THEIR TOTAL OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS PAID WHILE ATTENDING THE LAW SCHOOL. (NOTE: THIS PROGRAM WAS DISCONTINUED FOR THE ENTERING CLASS OF 2016 AND BEYOND). THERE WERE NO PAYMENTS MADE IN FY16.

THE UNIVERSITY MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS BY AWARDING THOSE FUNDS ONLY TO ENROLLED STUDENTS TO BE USED FOR STUDENTS' TUITION AND FEES. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO AN AUDIT BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR ON AN ANNUAL BASIS PURSUANT TO OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depend upon other factors, such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors the eligibility guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

The awarding of Financial Aid starts after a student is accepted into Bluffton University. Those students who need financial support have to file an application for Federal Student Aid. SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 1 AND 2 THE COLLEGE PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE. ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ISSUED ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY AGAINST THE STUDENT'S TUITION BALANCE; THEREFORE, THE STUDENT CAN EXERCISE NO DISCRETION IN THE USE OF THE FUNDS. SINCE ALL SCHOLARSHIPS DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION, NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS REQUIRED. SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 2 PROGRAM MANAGERS WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE GRANTEES RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS AND MONITOR THE FUNDS ACCORDING TO THE GRANT AGREEMENT. MONITORING INCLUDES CONDUCTING REGULAR CONTACT/WORKING SESSIONS WITH THE GRANTEE OR DIRECT ASSISTANCE WITH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE GRANT ACTIVITIES.
NEED-BASED GRANTS AWARDED BASED ON FINANCIAL AID NEEDS ANALYSIS. OTHER GRANTS/SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED BASED ON MEETING REQUIREMENTS SET FORTH BY THE DONOR.

LAFAYETTE COLLEGE MAINTAINS A POLICY DEFINING ITS PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF SPONSORED FUNDS BY SUB-RECIPIENTS WHO ARE PERFORMING A PORTION OF A SPONSORED PROJECT EXTERNALLY AWARDED TO LAFAYETTE. THIS POLICY PROVIDES GUIDANCE TO ENSURE THAT SUB-RECIPIENTS CONDUCT THEIR PORTION OF SPONSORED PROJECTS IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE LAWS, REGULATIONS, TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF AWARDS AND SUB AWARDS, AND THAT REIMBURSEMENT COSTS INCURRED BY SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE ALLOWED.

THE COLLEGE CONSIDERS THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL AID (PRIMARILY GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, LOANS, AND WORK-STUDY) TO ITS STUDENTS, INCLUDING NON-RESIDENT ALIEN STUDENTS, TO BE A U.S. BASED ACTIVITY AS STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE ARE DEEMED TO BE LIVING IN THE UNITED STATES THROUGHOUT THEIR COMPLETION OF THE COLLEGE'S ACADEMIC CURRICULUM AND SUPPORTING PROGRAMS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ON THE BASIS OF MERIT AND/OR FINANCIAL NEED. THE SELECTION CRITERIA ARE BASED ON THE CALCULATED EXPECTED FAMILY CONTRIBUTION, WHICH IS DERIVED BY USING COMPLEX FORMULAS INVOLVING FAMILIES' INCOME, ASSETS, AND HOUSEHOLD SIZES INCLUDING, AMONG OTHER FACTORS, DEPENDENTS IN COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ADMINISTERS AND MONITORS THESE AWARDS TO HELP ENSURE THAT THESE FUNDS ARE AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH APPLICABLE FEDERAL, STATE, AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS, AS WELL AS RELEVANT INTERNAL COLLEGE POLICIES AND OPERATIONAL GUIDELINES. ACADEMIC PRIZES, AWARDS, FELLOWSHIP, AND INTERNSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON A REVIEW BY THE APPLICABLE ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT. ALL AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT AT THE COLLEGE AND ARE APPLIED TO BILLED CHARGES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY HAS A FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT WHOSE STAFF IS TRAINED AND CONTINUOUSLY EDUCATED REGARDING FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE STAFF OF THE UNIVERSITY DETERMINES THE FINANCIAL NEED OF THE STUDENT AND DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE THAT CAN BE AWARDED TO THE STUDENT BASED ON FEDERAL RULES AND REGULATIONS. THE FINANCIAL AID STAFF ALSO AWARDS GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON ENDOWED GIFTS THAT COMPLY WITH THE TERMS OF THE ENDOWED GIFTS.

THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MAINTAINS THE RECORDS RELATED TO THE GRANTS APPLICATION. THE PROCEDURE IS AS FOLLOWS: THE STUDENTS APPLY ANNUALLY FOR GRANTS BASED ON THEIR FAMILIES' FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. EACH APPLICATION IS THEN REVIEWED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF GRANT THAT IS NEEDED. THE GRANTS ARE PROVIDED FROM APPROPRIATE SOURCES AND APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S BILL FOR TUITION, FEES, ROOM, BOARD AND OTHER CHARGES.

With respect to scholarships, interested students complete an application which is reviewed by the scholarship committee to determine if they meet established criteria. Funds are then awarded to the applicants who best meet the criteria. The amount of money available will determine how many scholarships are awarded. A portion of these scholarships are awarded to students based on financial need and nationality. Students who are awarded scholarships are monitored with respect to their scholastic achievement as students must maintain certain grades to retain their scholarships.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: WASHINGTON ADVENTIST UNIVERSITY USES THE SCHOLARSHIP AND STUDENT FINANCE COMMITTEE TO REVIEW AND AWARD ALUMNI DISCRETIONARY AND ALUMNI ENDOWMENT SCHOLARSHIPS BASED ON CRITERIA SET FORTH BY EACH ENDOWMENT FUND. FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT MONIES ARE AWARDED BASED ON FEDERAL AND STATE REGULATIONS AND ARE WRITTEN INTO THE BUSINESS RULES FOR DATATEL'S COLLEAGUE SYSTEM. THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICE'S AID PROCESSOR IS ALSO THE COMPLIANCE OFFICER AND MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL, STATE AND FEDERAL REGULATIONS FOR AWARDING AND DISBURSING OF AID MONEY.

MEDICAL AND GRADUATE SCHOOL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS AT MCW. MCW MAINTAINS RECORDS TO JUSTIFY THE AWARD DECISIONS, INCLUDING THE FINANCIAL AID ELIGIBILITY OF THE RECIPIENTS. In support of its research mission, MCW is the recipient of Federal and non-federal grant funds. Some of the grant awards are subawarded to qualified organizations (subrecipients) to carry out part of the project based on the requirements of the prime award. MCW's community engagement mission is complemented by its Advancing a Healthier Wisconsin (AHW) endowment under which funds are awarded to qualified organizations to support initiatives that improve the health of the residents of the State of Wisconsin. The AHW funds are awarded under the oversight of the MCW Consortium on Public and Community Health, Inc., a related organization. To monitor the use of research subawards and AHW awarded funds, MCW enters into signed subaward agreements which contain the terms and conditions of the subaward relationship. The subaward agreements require that prior to reimbursement of expenses, the subrecipient provides a certified invoice to MCW. Before approval of an invoice for payment, MCW verifies that the invoice and any supporting documentation submitted by the subrecipient are in line with the approved subaward budget and that the cost detail presented provides reasonable assurance that costs to be reimbursed are allowable, allocable, and reasonable. Progress reports submitted by the subrecipient are reviewed to determine that progress is being made toward the goals and objectives of the subaward. MCW obtains an annual Single Audit report, or a financial audit report or subrecipient questionnaire for organizations not subject to Single Audit requirements, to ensure that audit findings do not exist which would impact awarded funds. In cases where an audit is not required or if audit findings are noted, MCW assesses the risk of the organization and performs additional monitoring tasks as appropriate.

THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS THROUGH THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE APPROPRIATENESS OF THE AWARDS AND THESE AMOUNTS ARE APPLIED TO EACH STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.

DAVENPORT UNIVERSITY PROVIDES FUNDING FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND TUITION DISCOUNTS BASED ON MERIT, FINANCIAL NEED, SPECIAL CRITERIA BASED ON RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS, AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT ON THE SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION. ALLOCATIONS ARE DETERMINED FOR EACH ACCOUNT BY THE ACCOUNTING AND ALUMNI AND DEVELOPMENT OFFICES AND DISTRIBUTED TO THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICER RESPONSIBLE FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR COMMUNICATING AWARD GUIDELINES, PROCEDURES, AND REQUIREMENTS, AS WELL AS AWARD AMOUNTS, TO ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE AND OTHER DEPARTMENTS AS NECESSARY TO ENSURE THE ACCURACY OF THE AWARDS. IN ADDITION, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ENSURING THAT AWARDS ARE MADE IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA AND AWARDED IN THE AMOUNT APPROVED BY THE ALUMNI AND DEVELOPMENT OFFICE.

MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE UNITED STATES: THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES STUDENT ELIGIBILITY AND MAKES AWARDS FOR NEED BASED SCHOLARSHIPS. ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS DETERMINE ELIGIBILITY AND AWARDS ACADEMIC MERIT BASED SCHOLARSHIPS WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID. BOTH OFFICES PERFORM POST AWARD MONITORING TO DETERMINE CONTINUED ELIGIBILITY. THE RESEARCH AND ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES OFFICE (RAS) PERFORMS SUB-RECIPIENT MONITORING IN ACCORDANCE WITH UNIVERSITY POLICY. RAS AND PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATORS MONITOR STATEMENT OF WORK COMPLETION, PROGRESS REPORTS, DELIVERABLES, CHANGE TO SCOPE AND BUDGETS. THEY ALSO REVIEW AND APPROVE SUB-RECIPIENT INVOICES.

DEPENDING ON THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE FUND SOURCES, FINANCIAL AID AND ALL TITLE IV AND STATE REGULATIONS ARE MONITORED, RECONCILED AND FOLLOWED DAILY BY TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED PROFESSIONAL STAFF THAT STAY UP TO DATE ON ANY CHANGES IN REGULATION THOUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TRAINING.

DETAIL OF SUBAWARDS IN FURTHERANCE OF ITS RESEARCH ACTIVITIES, THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER MAKES SUB-AWARDS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS THAT PERFORM RESEARCH IN CONNECTION WITH RESEARCH GRANTS AWARDED TO THE UNIVERSITY. THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT CATEGORIZE THESE SUB-AWARDS AS "GRANTS" FOR FORM 990, SCHEDULE I REPORTING, SINCE THE RECIPIENT ORGANIZATIONS PERFORM RESEARCH SERVICES FOR THE UNIVERSITY AND ARE CONSIDERED INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS WHICH SERVE THE DIRECT NEEDS OF THE UNIVERSITY. --------------------

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 AND PART III
ExplntnTxt: STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS THE DISBURSEMENT OF GRANTS AND FEDERAL LOANS TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS, FELLOWSHIPS AND STUDENT LOANS FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF ROCHESTER ARE SELECTED AND THE AMOUNT OF GRANTS OR LOANS DETERMINED BY OBJECTIVE AND NON-DISCRIMINATORY PROCESSES APPLIED TO ALL SIMILARLY SITUATED INDIVIDUALS. THE DECISIONS ARE MADE ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS THROUGH EVALUATING THE ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AND FINANCIAL NEED OF THE APPLICANT IN LIGHT OF THE FUNDS AVAILABLE FOR THIS PURPOSE. --------------------

THE SEATTLE SCHOOL OF THEOLOGY & PSYCHOLOGY MAINTAINS SCHOLARSHIP RECORDS IN THE FINANCIAL AID MODULE OF CAMPUS VUE, OUR STUDENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. THE AMOUNTS ARE SUBSTANTIATED, RECORDED, AND TRACKED BY USING THE STUDENT'S NAME AND SOCIAL SECURITY NUMBER OR STUDENT ID. AFTER THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE HAS MET AND DETERMINED THE RECIPIENTS, THE NAMES ARE SENT TO THE STUDENT FINANCIAL SERVICES OFFICE; WE THEN AWARD, BATCH AND DISBURSE THE FUNDS TO THE INDIVIDUAL RECIPIENT'S LEDGER CARD. ALL FUNDS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THEIR OUTSTANDING BALANCE DUE ON THEIR LEDGER CARD. NO FUNDS ARE RELEASED TO STUDENTS IN THE FORM OF CASH.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY OF EACH STUDENT WHO APPLIES FOR FINANCIAL AID, USING FORMULAS AND CRITERIA PROMULGATED BY VARIOUS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTAL BODIES, AS WELL AS MARYWOOD'S INTERNALLY ESTABLISHED RULES AND PROCEDURES.

SUB-RECIPIENTS ARE PAID ON A COST-REIMBURSABLE OR FIXED PRICE BASIS. IN BOTH INSTANCES, THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR REVIEWS AND APPROVES INVOICES FOR PAYMENT. THE PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR IS ALSO THE INDIVIDUAL WHO RECEIVES AND REVIEWS TECHNICAL PROGRESS REPORTS FROM SUB-RECIPIENTS. EDUCATIONAL GRANTS TO STUDENTS ARE POSTED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT IS REVIEWED BY WVU STUDENT AFFAIRS TO DETERMINE IF ANY MONEY IS OWED BY THE STUDENT OR OWED TO THE STUDENT AS A REFUND. STUDENTS ALSO REVIEW THEIR OWN ACCOUNTS TO ENSURE THAT THEY AGREE WITH THE ACTIVITY POSTED TO THEIR ACCOUNTS.
THE COLLEGE RECORDS AND TRACKS GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE.

FOR SCHOLARSHIPS, THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT REVIEWS AND MATCHES THE REQUIREMENTS TO THE RECIPIENT. FOR GRANTS, A DIRECTOR FOR THE GRANT AUTHORIZES EXPENDITURES. FOR GOVERNMENT GRANTS, THE UNIVERSITY REVIEWS THE GOVERNMENT'S "DO NOT USE-VENDOR LIST" TO QUALIFY PROSPECTIVE VENDORS.

FOR GRANTS RECEIVED BY THE COLLEGE, GRANTS ARE CONTROLLED BY A DESIGNATED RESPONSIBLE PERSON ON CAMPUS, WHO IS TYPICALLY THE PERSON WHO APPLIES FOR THE GRANT. ALL PROPOSED EXPENDITURES FROM THE GRANT MUST BE APPROVED BY THAT PERSON. THE ACCOUNTING DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE INVOICE FOR APPROPRIATENESS WITH THE NATURE OF THE GRANT, REVIEWS THE ACTUAL TRANSACTION TO MAKE SURE THAT IT IS ADEQUATELY SUPPORTED, AND REVIEWS THE TRANSACTION TO BE SURE THAT IT IS AN ALLOWABLE EXPENSE UNDER FEDERAL LAW. EACH GRANT IS ASSIGNED ITS OWN SET OF GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS TO SEGREGATE THE EXPENSES AND GRANT INCOME FROM OTHER EXPENDITURES AND REVENUES OF THE COLLEGE.
