FRESHMEN ENROLLMENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE OFFERED TO INCOMING FRESHMEN BASED UPON THEIR INDIVIDUAL HIGH SCHOOL PERFORMANCE, SAT SCORES AND FINANCIAL NEEDS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE COLLEGE; THEREFORE, ALL FUNDS GRANTED ARE USED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION AND NO FURTHER MONITORING OF THE GRANTS IS REQUIRED.
FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON NUMEROUS CRITERIA, SUCH AS ATHLETIC ABILITY, MUSICAL TALENT, SAT OR ACT SCORES, AND FINANCIAL NEED.

THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS PACKAGING GUIDELINES IN AWARDING FUNDS. AID IS PAID ACCORDING TO THE STUDENT ACADEMIC LOAD (I.E. 100% FOR FULL-TIME, 75% FOR 3/4 TIME). AID IS ADJUSTED ACCORDING TO POLICY IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS. STUDENT'S ACADEMIC PROGRESS IS ALSO MONITORED TO DETERMINE IF AID SHOULD BE ADJUSTED.

NEED BASED AID IS AWARDED BASED ON FEDERAL AND/OR STATE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS AND INSTITUTIONAL AID IS AWARDED ACCORDING TO INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. AMOUNTS OF AID AWARDED ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH GOVERNING REGULATIONS OR INSTITUTIONAL POLICY. IN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV REGULATIONS, TOTAL AID FROM ALL SOURCES CANNOT EXCEED NEED OR THE ANNUAL COST OF TUITION, REGARDLESS OF THE LEVEL OF NEED. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO A STUDENT ACCOUNT AND FUNDS ARE NOT DISTRIBUTED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS. OVERPAYMENT OR CREDIT BALANCES OF STUDENT ACCOUNT BALANCES ARE ANALYZED PRIOR TO DISTRIBUTING REFUNDS TO STUDENTS TO ENSURE THAT GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE PROPERLY AWARDED AND UTILIZED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.

THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE MAINTAINS ALL DOCUMENTATION TO SUPPORT THAT THE AWARDED STUDENTS HAVE SATISFIED THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE VARIOUS GRANTS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY FOR STUDENTS. CRITERIA FOR AWARDING ANY GRANTS IS ALSO MAINTAINED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID'S OFFICE AND IS APPROVED BY THE VP OF ENROLLMENT.

ALL STUDENTS MUST BE ENROLLED IN COLLEGE COURSES TO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE. STUDENTS MUST ALSO MAINTAIN CERTAIN GRADE POINT AVERAGES AND MAKE SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS TO BE ELIGIBLE FOR SCHOLARSHIPS. OUR COMPUTER SYSTEM IS SET UP TO NOT AWARD ANY SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS TO NON-REGISTERED STUDENTS. A REPORT IS GENERATED AT THE END OF EACH SEMESTER BY THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE SHOWING STUDENTS WHO ARE NOT MAINTAINING THE PROPER GRADE POINT AVERAGE OR WHO ARE NOT MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS. THIS REPORT IS REVIEWED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, ANY STUDENTS WHO DO NOT QUALIFY ACADEMICALLY FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS WILL NOT RECEIVE THE SCHOLARSHIPS.

Scholarships are available to all students meeting the written criteria for the award of the scholarship. All scholarships and discounts are awarded by the financial aid department based on the established policies. Scholarships are directly applied to the student account.
ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING GRANT FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT INTERIM AND GRANT-END NARRATIVE AND FINANCIAL REPORTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN VARIOUS WAYS INCLUDING OBTAINING REPORTS FROM THE ORGANIZATIONS OUTLINING THE ACTIVITIES SUPPORTED BY GRANTS, MEETING REGULARLY WITH THE ORGANIZATIONS, AND VISITING THE ORGANIZATIONS TO OBSERVE ACTIVITIES ON A FIRST HAND BASIS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID MONITORS FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS USING BANNER REPORTING TOOLS TO TRACK THE LEVEL OF AMOUNTS PAID FOR ALL TITLE IV GRANTS AND INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS. AMOUNTS ARE RECONCILED TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT SYSTEM TO ENSURE FUNDS ARE PROPERLY DISBURSED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Most grants are in the form of financial aid awarded to students. Grants are applied internally to the student's account with the University. The funds are used to pay the tuition, fees and room and board that are applied to the students' accounts. A small number of grants are made to faculty for research or curriculum development. Reports are required by the granting committee to ensure progress is made in concert with the grant proposal. All expenses of these grants are made through the University accounting system.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: PIU EVALUATES ELIGIBILITY BY RECEIVING WRITTEN REPRESENTATIONS AND FROM REVIEW OF A STUDENTS FILE. ITEMS TO BE CHECKED INCLUDE PIUS APPLICATION, HIGH SCHOOL DIPLOMA, DROP/ADD FORMS, AND WITHDRAWAL FORMS. ONCE A STUDENT HAS COMPLETED THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) APPLICATION, PIU SUBMITS IT ELECTRONICALLY TO ED. ONCE IT IS PROCESSED THE STUDENT WILL RECEIVE A STUDENT AID REPORT AND THE SCHOOL WILL RECEIVE AN ISIR. THE ISIR IS KEPT IN THE STUDENTS FINANCIAL AID FILE. THE ISIR CONTAINS THE EFC AMOUNT, WHICH IS THE AMOUNT THE STUDENT IS EXPECTED TO PAY, THE COST OF ATTENDANCE IS FOUND ON WORKSHEETS GENERATED BY WEBER. THE EFC AND COA ARE BOTH USED TO CALCULATE FINANCIAL NEED. THE ISIR ALSO PROVIDES FINANCIAL AID HISTORY, MATCHES SOCIAL SECURITY DATA, SELECTIVE SERVICE DATA AND CHECKS CITIZENSHIP. FFEL- CHECKS FROM LOAN INSTITUTIONS ARE REQUESTED FROM STUDENTS THROUGH LOAN APPLICATIONS. LOAN APPLICATIONS ARE CERTIFIED BY PIU AND SENT BY STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. MONEY IS DEPOSITED INTO A SEPARATE BANK ACCOUNT USING ACH/EFT SYSTEM. ONCE PIU RECEIVES THE DISBURSEMENT RECORD FROM THE LENDER, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE BATCHES THE LOANS AND SENDS THEM TO THE BUSINESS OFFICE. THE BUSINESS OFFICE VERIFIES FUNDS AND THEN CREDITS THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT. SOMETIMES CHECKS ARE SENT IN THE STUDENTS AND PIUS NAME. THESE ARE DEPOSITED SEPARATELY INTO THE BANK ACCOUNT BY THE BUSINESS OFFICE. CHECKS ARE SIGNED BY THE STUDENT, AND PIU POSTS CHECKS TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. LOANS COME IN TWO DISBURSEMENTS - GENERALLY ONE FOR FIRST SEMESTER AND ONE FOR SECOND. THE WHOLE DISBURSEMENT IS APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNT. COST OF ATTENDANCE IS ALWAYS GREATER THAN LOAN PROCEEDS AND ALL OTHER FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. ANY EXCESS CAN BE WITHDRAWN BY THE STUDENT FOR LIVING EXPENSES. PELL, SEOG & FWS - PIU IS GIVEN AN INITIAL AUTHORIZATION FOR FUNDS BY THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR WHICH IT CANNOT EXCEED. PIU CALLS DOWN THE FUNDS THROUGH GAPS AND THE MONEY IS ELECTRONICALLY DEPOSITED INTO A SEPARATE FEDERAL FUNDS ACCOUNT AT LEXINGTON STATE BANK, THEN THEY ARE SWEPT INTO AN INVESTMENT ACCOUNT EACH NIGHT BY THE BANK. THE FUNDS ARE ONLY REQUESTED AFTER DISBURSEMENT TO STUDENTS ACCOUNT, PER FWS, FUNDS ARE PAID TO THE STUDENTS THROUGH PIU PAYROLL AS EARNED.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID AND ADMISSION OFFICES. ANNUAL REVIEW OF QUALIFICATIONS FOR EACH LEVEL OF SCHOLARSHIPS IS DONE AFTER THE SPRING TERM. SATISFACTORY PROGRESS GUIDELINES FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION ARE FOLLOWED FOR ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING ANY TYPE OF SCHOLARSHIP AID. OUR ADVANCEMENT OFFICE ASSIGNS ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS. ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIPS (FUNDED INSTITUTIONAL AID) REPRESENTS LESS THAN 20% OF OUR AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: grants or other assistance in the united states
ExplntnTxt: form 990, schedule i, part i, line 2 Elizabethtown College provides scholarships to students matriculating at the College. Students receiving scholarships are not permitted any discretion on how to spend those funds as all amounts are used to satisfy tuition costs. Accordingly, all funds granted are used to defray the cost of tuition and no further monitoring of the grants is required.
Grants are awarded to individuals based on compliance with eligibility requirements. Award grant and assistance amounts are applied by the University to the student tuition billing.

All scholarships are awarded based upon specific criteria maintained by the financial aid office. Requirements for receiving scholarships depends on other factors such as grade point average, family income or economic need. The Colleges financial aid staff monitors guidelines to ensure compliance. The College also undergoes the required Uniform Guidance audit annually.

THE GRANTS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE PRIMARILY FOR STUDENT AID AND SCHOLARSHIPS. A LIST OF RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS IS ON FILE AT THE UNIVERSITY AND IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. ALL STUDENTS RECEIVING SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS ARE JUDGED WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC AND ATHLETIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S.: MARIAN UNIVERSITY IS SUBJECT TO THE COMPLIANCE AND INTERNAL CONTROL REQUIREMENTS OF OMB-A133 AND FOLLOWS ALL APPLICABLE GUIDELINES. INSTITUTIONAL AND PRIVATELY FUNDED FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED ON A CASE-BY-CASE BASIS BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND EXTRACURRICULAR ACTIVITIES.

Students submit an application for financial aid to the financial aid office. Applications are evaluated by the financial aid office and students are notified of awards they are to receive. The financial aid is applied directly against tuition. Scholarships are not refunded should the student fail to complete the required credit hours.
GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE MONITORED ANNUALLY IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC ADVISING FOR STUDENTS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The majority of grants and assistance provided by the university is in the form of scholarships and financial aid to offset the cost of tuition, room and board for its students. These funds are awarded through the university's financial aid office based on a combination of merit and need and are disbursed directly to the student's billing account with the university.

All students seeking need based financial assistance are required to complete the FAFSA. Eligibility, or need, is determined through federal methodology and resulting Expected Family Contribution as set against standard cost of attendance. Need based aid is awarded based on federal and/or state eligibility requirements and institutional aid is awarded according to institutional policy. Amounts of aid awarded are in compliance with governing regulations or institutional policy. In compliance with Title IV regulations, total aid from all sources cannot exceed need or the annual cost of attendance, regardless of the level of need. Aid awards are posted to student accounts as an offset to semester charges. Institutional policy prohibits the release or refund of aid to students unless total charges for the semester have been paid.

THE COLLEGE REVIEWS ALL OF AMERICAN SYMPHONY ORCHESTRA'S EXPENDITURES FOR WHICH ITS GRANTS ARE INTENDED. ASSISTANCE FOR INDIVIDUAL STUDENTS IS PROVIDED THROUGH FEDERAL, STATE AND COLLEGE PROGRAMS AND EXTERNAL AGENCIES. THE COLLEGE ADMINISTERS THESE PROGRAMS. TYPICALLY, FINANCIAL AID FUNDS ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF FINANCIAL NEED (AS DETERMINED BY THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION, STATE AGENCIES, THE COLLEGE SCHOLARSHIP SERVICES, AND BARD COLLEGE), ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, AND PROMISE. THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND MONITORING FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID DISTRIBUTIONS. STUDENTS APPLY FOR FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING A FAFSA FORM WHICH DETERMINES ELGIBILITY. STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS PERIODICALLY MONITORED TO ENSURE THAT GRANT AWARDS ARE USED FOR THEIR INTENDED PURPOSE.

THE UNIVERSITY'S STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS (GRANTS) ARE NON-CASH TUITION DISCOUNTS APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS AND CANNOT BE DIVERTED FROM INTENDED USES. THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED ABOVE WAS COMPILED FROM SCHOLARSHIP DISBURSEMENT RECORDS FOR THE REPORTED FISCAL YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID OFFICE MONITORS ALL RECIPIENTS OF SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS TO DETERMINE BOTH INITIAL AND CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY BASED UPON THE CRITERIA FOR EACH TYPE OF AWARD. VARIOUS CRITERIA MAY INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO, ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE, FINANCIAL NEED, OR OTHER CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY THE FUNDING SOURCE.
MCPHS UNIVERSITY TRANSFERRED AN UNRESTRICTED CAPITAL CONTRIBUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $800,000 TO THE NEW ENGLAND SCHOOL OF ACUPUNCTURE, INC., A CONTROLLED TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATION (SEE SCHEDULE R).

PART II - THE OFFICE OF THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER MONITORS ALL FUNDS ALLOCATED TO EXTERNAL ORGANIZATIONS. PART III- THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS THAT ARE ALL APPLIED TO STUDENTS' ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE BALANCES AT THE BURSAR'S OFFICE.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
ExplntnTxt: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: GRANTS ARE PUT INTO A SEPARATE AND UNIQUE FUND AND THE EXPENDITURES ARE MONITORED AGAINST THE PROPOSAL AND AWARD. WESTERN UNIVERSITY MANAGES AN EXTENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT A HIGHLY QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE POPULATION IS ABLE TO MATRICULATE AND CONTINUE TO GRADUATION. THE ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS TAKE TWO MAJOR FORMS: MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS AND NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. THE STUDENT FIRST APPLIES FOR ASSISTANCE, AND THEN BASED ON THE GRANT CRITERIA (FINANCIAL AND ENROLLMENT), THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS THE AMOUNTS GIVEN BY THE GRANT. GRANT AND SCHOLARSHIP AWARD COMMITTEES AWARD THE RECIPIENTS.
The use of grant funds is monitored through student financial aid and billing process.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE BASED ON VARIOUS CRITERIA. THESE CRITERIA INCLUDE FINANCIAL NEED, GRADE POINT AVERAGE, AND OTHERS AS ESTABLISHED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP DOCUMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED TO THE INDIVIDUAL STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS TO PAY TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD EXPENSES.

SCHEDULE I, PART 1, LINE 2 PACIFIC UNIVERSITY AWARDS FEDERAL AND STATE AID ONLY TO U.S. CITIZENS AND ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS. ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS ARE DEFINED AS THOSE LIVING IN THE U.S. FOR "OTHER THAN A TEMPORARY PURPOSE THEY CAN POSSESS A VARIETY OF DOCUMENTS WHICH DEMONSTRATES THAT STATUS, INCLUDING I-551S AND I-94S WITH CERTAIN STAMPS. APPLICANTS WHO FILE A FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) HAVE THEIR FAFSA DATA MATCHED WITH DATA IN SEVERAL FEDERAL DATABASES, INCLUDING THE SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION AND THE DEPARTMENT OF HOMELAND SECURITY. WHEN THOSE DATABASE MATCHES ARE NOT SUCCESSFUL, WE OBTAIN DOCUMENTATION FROM THE APPLICANTS TO ENSURE THAT WE ARE AWARDING FEDERAL AND STATE AID ONLY TO ELIGIBLE RECIPIENTS. THAT DOCUMENTATION BECOMES PART OF THEIR FINANCIAL AID FILES AND IS RETAINED FOR AT LEAST FIVE YEARS. ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS MUST ALSO BE OREGON RESIDENTS TO RECEIVE STATE AID. INSTITUTIONAL AID ONLY IS AWARDED TO CERTAIN INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS WHO ARE IN THE U.S. SOLELY OR PRIMARILY TO PURSUE POSTSECONDARY EDUCATION. ON AN ON-GOING BASIS, STAFF IN FINANCIAL AID AND BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS THE ACTIVITY OF ALL AWARDING AND DISBURSEMENT ACTIVITY OF AWARDS AND LOANS ON A MONTHLY BASIS AT A MINIMUM. ANY DIFFERENCES OR ANOMALIES ARE INVESTIGATED IMMEDIATELY AND, IF NEEDED, CORRECTED.
INQUIRY BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WHETHER THE GRANTEES CONTINUE TO COMPLY WITH THEIR STATED PURPOSE.
WMED REQUIRES DETAIL LISTINGS OF ALL GRANT EXPENDITURES. ADDITIONALLY WMED MAY REQUEST DETAIL SUPPORT TO SUBSTANTIATE GRANT EXPENDITURES.
CEDARVILLE UNIVERSITY AWARDS FINANCIAL AID GRANTS TO STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID POLICIES.

Funds are credited to the students accounts for tuition and fees, room and board, books and other supplies. The Office of Student Financial Services consists of both Financial Aid and Bursar functions, who work closely together to ensure proper usage of grant funds.

Financial Aid and Satisfactory Academic Progress Standards: To remain at Knox, all degree-seeking students are expected to make satisfactory academic progress. Satisfactory progress is defined both in terms of the accumulation of credits toward the degree, and as the maintenance of a gradepoint average consistent with graduation requirements. The Financial Aid Office follows the decisions of the Academic Standing Committee in determining whether a student is meeting the College's satisfactory academic progress standards.

FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAVEN IS COMMITTED TO ASSISTING STUDENTS IN FINANCING THEIR EDUCATION. THE UNIVERSITY OFFERS A COMPREHENSIVE FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM, WITH THE STUDENTS RECEIVING ASSISTANCE IN THE FORM OF GRANTS, SCHOLARSHIPS, STUDENT LOANS, AND PART-TIME EMPLOYMENT WHICH ARE AVAILABLE FROM FEDERAL AND STATE FUNDS, PRIVATE SPONSORS, AND FROM UNIVERSITY RESOURCES. MORE THAN 90% OF THE UNIVERSITY'S FULL-TIME UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME FORM OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE. MOST FINANCIAL AID AWARDS ARE BASED ON AN INDIVIDUAL'S DEMONSTRATION OF NEED AFTER CAREFUL CONSIDERATION OF THE APPLICATION FOR ASSISTANCE. IN CALCULATING NEED, THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE ATTEMPTS TO CONSIDER ALL ASPECTS OF A STUDENT'S FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. NEED-BASED AWARDS ARE ONLY AVAILABLE TO U.S. CITIZENS OR ELIGIBLE NON-CITIZENS. SOME FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE ON A MERIT BASIS FOR STUDENTS WHO HAVE EXCEPTIONAL ACADEMIC RECORDS OR ATHLETIC ABILITY. STUDENTS MUST BE MAKING SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND BE IN GOOD ACADEMIC STANDING IN ORDER TO BE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID. GRADUATE STUDENTS MUST SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETE ALL CREDITS FOR WHICH FINANCIAL AID HAS BEEN AWARDED, AS INDICATED ON THE STUDENT'S INDIVIDUAL FINANCIAL AID AWARD LETTER. FEDERAL, STATE, PRIVATE GRANT FUNDS AND INSTITUTIONAL AID FUNDS ARE NORMALLY APPLIED AS CREDITS TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

CONCORDIA UNIVERSITY IRVINE OFFERS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO HELP REDUCE THEIR OUT-OF-POCKET TUITION COSTS. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE OF THIS FORM MUST MEET SPECIFIC CRITERIA SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS WHETHER PUT IN PLACE BY THE COLLEGE OR BY DONORS OF RESTRICTED FUNDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID IS ACCOUNTABLE FOR MONITORING AND DISBURSING ALL FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS.

THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AWARDS STUDENTS AID BASED ON ENROLLMENT, NEED BASED ON THE SUBMISSION OF THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA) AND THE ABILITY TO MEET CERTAIN DONOR SPECIFIED CRITERIA.

THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS RECORDS TO ENSURE FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS BASED ON CRITERIA IN INDIVIDUAL SCHOLARSHIPS, AS WELL AS FEDERAL REGULATIONS, OR DONOR RESTRICTIONS. FEDERAL GRANTS ARE AWARDED BASED ON FAFSA INFORMATION.

THE TECHNOLOGY BUSINESS PLAN AND ENTREPRENUERIAL CHALLENGE COMPETITION AWARD CHECKS ARE WRITTEN BY THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW MEXICO (UNM) TO THE COMPETITION WINNERS, USING DONATIONS DEPOSITED IN AN ACCOUNT AT UNM FOR THE ANDERSON FOUNDATION. THE WASHINGTON CAMPUS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS WHO SUBMITTED APPLICATIONS ALONG WITH THEIR TUITION RECEIPT. ALL OTHER AWARDS ARE MADE BY A SELECTION COMMITTEE TO STUDENTS BASED UPON THE APPLICATION PROCESS.
ALL GRANTS ARE INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BY KANSAS CITY ART INSTITUTE.

JOHN F KENNEDY UNIVERSITY IDENTIFIES ELIGIBLE GRANTEES AS PER REGULATIONS FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. GRANT FUNDS AND GRANTEES ARE MONITORED AS APPROPRIATE PER REGULATIONS THROUGH PERIODIC AND ANNUAL REPORTS.
- The Institutions scholarship committee awards scholarships on a non-discriminatory basis, considering academic qualifications or distinctive scholarship criteria.

ALL GRANTS PROVIDED BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE FOR FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS. GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE ARE RELATED TO INSTITUTIONAL FINANCIAL AID FOR WHICH STUDENTS APPLY THROUGH THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. ALL AID IS AWARDED BASED ON CERTAIN GUIDELINES AND IS CREDITED DIRECTLY TO STUDENTS' TUITION ACCOUNTS. ALL AWARDS ARE DIRECTLY RELATED TO THE STUDENTS' EDUCATION AT THE INSTITUTION'S PHYSICAL LOCATION AND ONLINE COURSES IN THE UNITED STATES. STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS IN ORDER TO CONTINUE TO RECEIVE FINANCIAL AID.

ALL GRANTS ARE FINANCIAL AID AND APPLIED DIRECTLY TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IT IS A CONTINUAL PROCESS IN WHICH WE AWARD STUDENT AID WITHIN FEDERAL GUIDELINES AT THE INITIAL AWARDING TIME PERIOD. IF ANY CHANGES TO A STUDENT'S STATUS OCCUR, WE REVIEW THE STUDENT'S AID PACKAGE COMPONENTS TO ENSURE THAT ANY/ALL ADJUSTMENTS MADE MAINTAIN COMPLIANCE WITH TITLE IV FUND RULES. OUR ASSISTANT DIRECTOR OF COMPLIANCE RUNS REPORTS, DAILY, WEEKLY, AND MONTHLY TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE.

All expenditures of Scholarship and Financial Aid grant funds are approved and monitored by the Financial Aid department for each student receiving funds.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: All assistance that is provided through the University to students is designated for tuition, fees, books, and other direct educational costs. The financial aid office and finance office of the University monitors and controls disbursement of all assistance.

Scholarships and tuition discounts are awarded to students on an individual basis. Awards are based on demonstrated financial need, academic preparation, and mission compatability of the student. The financial aid department has primary responsibility for evaluating students for awards but collaborates with a wider range of colleagues throughout the institution.

The college's Office of Student Financial Services is responsible for awarding and monitoring all college, federal and state grant assistance. More than 60% of Wheaton students receive some form of financial aid and all students who demonstrate need receive aid. Financial assistance at Wheaton is awarded on the basis of demonstrated need and academic performance. "Need" is determined by the financial information that a student and his/her family provides on the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) and CSS PROFILE forms which capture the data required to determine eligibility based on federal and/or state regulations and institutional fund eligibility guidelines. A need-based package may include a merit scholarship, grants, loans or work award. When funds are awarded, student eligibility is monitored through the college's operational system financial aid module to ensure there are no changes in status that might affect their ongoing eligibility. Total grant funds awarded are tracked to ensure compliance with budgeted amounts.

GRANTS ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN THE UNIVERSITY'S ACCOUNTING RECORDS, INCLUDING SUPPORTING DOCUMENTATION FOR ALL EXPENDITURES. GRANT MANAGERS ARE REQUIRED TO ASSERT THAT FUNDS HAVE BEEN SPENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS.

The University follows guidelines set by the Department of Education, and State Governments, to ensure that grants to students are awarded to eligible recipients. All documentation regarding the awarding of these grants is maintained in the student file.

Scholarships are awarded to students based upon criteria such as need, area of study, grade point average, among others, as established by scholarship documents and donor restrictions. Scholarships are applied to the students' accounts to help cover the costs of tuition, room, and board.

Scholarships are awarded on the basis of academic achievement and donor restrictions, if applicable; while grants are awarded on the basis of financial need, academic achievement, and other similar standards as designated by the U.S. Department of Education.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Procedures for monitoring the use of grant funds in the U.S.

All awards are under the direction of the financial aid office to ensure compliance with donors' directions.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are applied directly to the student's account at the University and used on education.

Grant funds are only awarded to those students who meet the requirements for a particular grant or grants. Also, they must meet our satisfactory progress policy to continue receiving these funds, whether it is Federal Government or Faulkner University Funds.

GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE AWARDED TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED STATES REPRESENT STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE DETERMINED TO BE WORTHY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S ASSESSMENT ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID AND THE FINANCE OFFICE FOR EACH COLLEGE CONTINUOUSLY MONITOR STUDENT ELIGIBILITY FOR THESE AWARDS.
THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR AT EACH CAMPUS IS GIVEN AN AMOUNT THAT MAY BE AWARDED AT THEIR CAMPUS FOR THE FISCAL YEAR, WITH A CHART OF HOW MANY STUDENTS AND THE AMOUNT FOR EACH TERM.

Criteria is established for the awarding of individual scholarships. Students must complete an application and scholarships are awarded after all external scholarships and grants have been applied, not to exceed the cost of attendance.

ALL ORGANIZATIONS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT PROOF OF TAX EXEMPT STATUS THAT'S VERIFIED BY THE IRS DATABASE BEFORE THEY CAN PROCEED WITH THEIR REQUEST. THEY MAY USE OUR ONLINE CHARITABLE REQUEST APPLICATION TO SUBMIT A REQUEST. IF THEY ARE NOT A 501 (C)(3) ORGANIZATION, THEY ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A COPY OF THEIR DETERMINATION LETTER FROM THE IRS VALIDATING THEIR EXEMPT STATUS BEFORE WE CAN PROVIDE ANY IN-KIND GIVEAWAYS OR SERVICES. WE ALSO MONITOR THE FUNDS TO ENSURE THEY ARE USED FOR THE PURPOSE GRANTED. WE MAKE EVERY EFFORT TO DIRECT OUR FUNDING TO A PROGRAM FOR A SPECIFIC PURPOSE. ORGANIZATIONS ARE ASKED TO SHOW RESULTS AND DOCUMENTATION ANNUALLY BEFORE THEIR REQUEST CAN BE CONSIDERED FOR FUTURE FUNDING. THE REQUESTS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY VARIOUS INDIVIDUALS DEPENDING UPON THE TYPE AND AMOUNT OF THE REQUEST. SMALL AMOUNTS MAY BE APPROVED BY THE SYSTEM COORDINATOR, CASH SPONSORSHIPS MAY BE APPROVED BY THE SYSTEM DIRECTOR OF COMMUNICATIONS, ANYTHING OVER $10,000 MAY BE APPROVED BY THE BAPTIST MEMORIAL HEALTH CARE FOUNDATION SENIOR V.P., AND ANYTHING OVER $50,000 NEEDS APPROVAL BY THE CORPORATE PRESIDENT/CEO. FOR MORE INFORMATION ABOUT BAPTIST CHARITABLE GIVING GUIDELINES, PLEASE VISIT https://www.bmhgiving.org/

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part III PRIZES AND AWARDS
ExplntnTxt: PRIZES AND AWARDS REFLECT PRIZES AND AWARDS EXTENDED TO NON-EMPLOYEES IN RECOGNITION OF AN ACCOMPLISHMENT, ACTIVITY, OR EVENT. PRIZES AND AWARDS GIVEN TO EMPLOYEES ARE INCLUDED AS COMPENSATION AND REPORTED ON AN EMPLOYEE'S FORM W-2.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Explanation: Grants given to support of charitable community organizations. Such grants are extended only for charitable purposes to organizations that are exempt under Code Section 501(c)(3). After qualifications for the grant are met and the grant is disbursed to the charitable organization there is no subsequent monitoring by the University. Grants or other assistance are awarded to organizations or entities in the U.S. pursuant to the University policies and procedures for all grant subawards. Such subawards are monitored through the University's office for Sponsored Research (OSR) and the University's Office of Accounting Services for Research and Sponsored Programs (ASRSP). All subaward documentation including purchase orders, related charges and invoices are reviewed and monitored by ASRSP and confirmed with the principal investigator. The principal investigator must certify that the subaward costs are in accordance with the Office of Management and Budget's (OMB) Uniform Guidance (Uniform Administrative Requirements, Cost Principles, and Audit Requirements); also, ASRSP requests and collects audit reports from subaward recipients to monitor compliance, as required by the Uniform Guidance. If the information is not furnished to ASRSP, payment may be withheld. Grants and other assistance are awarded to students on the basis of financial need following University policies developed to meet regulatory requirements (federal methodology) and guided by the College Board (institutional methodology). Merit scholarships are awarded based upon talent (eg, academic, music, and athletic). All of these awarded grants are allowed to be used by the students towards any type of costs; no subsequent monitoring is required.

The School awards scholarships to students which are funded from operations or from donations. The scholarships from operating funds are awarded on the basis of academic performance for continuing students or related parameters such as LSAT scores, GPA and completed application forms for entering students. Donor-funded scholarships are awarded based on criteria set forth by donors. The Associate Dean for Students and Admissions and The Office of Admissions communicate the availability of the scholarships, process the applications and determine which applicants have qualified based on information provided by the Registrar's office for those awarded on the basis of academic performance. Additionally for those that are donor-funded, a Committee established by the School may be called upon to determine which applicants qualify based on donor-requirements. Once awarded, the scholarships are posted to the individual students' accounts. The Financial Aid Office maintains records of scholarship awards and ensures that these are factored into the calculation of how much federally funded financial aid each student is eligible to receive. After the initial award letters are sent out, additional scholarships may be awarded. The posting of additional scholarships triggers a re-evaluation of the student's eligibility for federally funded student loans, which may result in adjustments to the student's loan awarded. A copy of the grant agreement is maintained at the School unit and the Business office. The School unit that applied for the grant is primarily responsible for compliance with the grant agreement. The disbursement of grant funds are periodically reviewed to ensure compliance with grant agreement provisions by the responsible School unit and Business office staff. The Business office is also provided with copies of grant reports submitted to the grantor.
THE COLLEGE MAINTAINS AN OFFICE OF FINANCIAL AID, WHICH IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE MONITORING OF GRANT FUNDS AWARDED TO THE COLLEGE AND STUDENTS.

ALL GRANTS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS DIRECTLY, ACCORDING TO GOVERNMENT REGULATIONS. ALL OUTSIDE GRANTS ARE APPLIED TO THE STUDENTS ACCOUNTS AS PER THE INSTRUCTIONS FROM THE GRANTOR. LAKELAND COLLEGE'S FINANICAL AID DEPARTMENT MONITORS ALL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS USEING POWERFAIDS SOFTWARE WHICH IS VERIFIED WITH COD BEFORE DISBURSEMENTS ARE PROCESSED. FOR OUTSIED AND OTHER INSTIUTIONAL AID, THE FINANICAL AID DEPARTMENT FOLLOWS THE SAME PROCEDURES.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: Form Sch I Part I Line 2 The University offers merit and talent scholarships on a competitive basis to all students. These awards do affect consideration for need based financial aid. If eligible for financial aid, these awards will be counted as resources and will become part of the financial aid package. The University also offers endowed scholarships to all students who meet the criteria of each scholarship. Students who file the financial aid from will automatically be considered when financial need is required. Grants are available annually from current funds to full-time students with documented financial need. Financial aid consists of scholarships, grants, loans, and paid employment. Scholarships and grants do not have to be repaid. Loans are offered at low interest rates on the condition that they be repaid. Paid employment is an earning program. The amount offered is the amount that they may earn. The student is paid an hourly rate for work actually performed.

Grants and scholarships are awarded in accordance with federal, state & private donor requirements. Students eligibility is monitored on a semester to semester basis. All records documenting the awarding, eligibility & monitoring of students' grants and scholarships is maintained within the financial aid office.
THE INSTITUTE MAINTAINS DETAILED RECORDS IN THE STUDENT INFORMATION SYSTEM DATABASE OF ALL SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.
THE GRANTS (SCHOLARSHIPS) MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY ARE A REDUCTION OF THE TUITION AND FEES PAID BY THE STUDENT TO THE SCHOOL. GRANT FUNDS ARE NOT SENT TO OUTSIDE ENTITIES.

AS PART OF OUR MISSION, SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON SELECTION BY A COMMITTEE UPON SUBMISSION OF AN APPLICATION TO BE USED TOWARDS THE COST OF ATTENDANCE. THESE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON A TRIMESTER BASIS. ADDITIONALLY, TUITION LEVERAGE AWARDS ARE OFFERED BASED ON MERIT. THESE AWARDS ARE FOR TUITION ONLY AND FOLLOW THE STUDENT FOR THEIR PERIOD OF ENROLLMENT AS LONG AS THEY MAINTAIN GOOD STANDING.
Scholarships and other types of financial assistance are monitored through internal transfer of funds within the university.

MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN U.S. ALL GRANT FUNDS ARE MONITORED WITH AT LEAST TWO DIFFERENT DEPARTMENTS WHICH CREATES CHECKS AND BALANCES TO ENSURE THAT THE FUNDS ARE TRACKED, REPORTED AND USED AS REQUIRED IN THE GRANT LANGUAGE. TITLE IV GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND APPLIED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT VIA FINANCIAL AID TRANSMITTAL. AS STUDENTS COMPLETE THEIR REQUIREMENTS FOR RECEIVING AID, WEEKLY TRANSMITTALS ARE RUN AND STUDENTS, WITH THE PROPER CODING ARE SELECTED TO RECEIVE AID. THE TRANSMITTAL GENERATES A LISTING OF EACH AWARD, BY TYPE WITH TOTALS, AND IS USED TO RECORD THE GRANT EXPENSE TO THE GENERAL LEDGER. FEDERAL AWARDS AND GRANTS ARE VERIFIED TO A RECEIVABLE IN THE GENERAL LEDGER THAT IS RECORDED FROM AN AUTHORIZATION LETTER AND TO THE AVAILABLE BALANCE IN THE G5 PAYMENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM. IF THE AVAILABLE BALANCE IS SUFFICIENT, THE FUNDS ARE DRAWN DOWN THROUGH THE G5 PAYMENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM INTO THE FEDERAL FUNDS CHECKING ACCOUNT. A BANK ACH REPORT IS GENERATED TO VERIFY THAT THE FUNDS ARE RECEIVED. THE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS ARE VERIFIED TO GRANTS BY TYPE ON THE FINANCIAL AID SYSTEM AND BILLING TRANSACTIONS ON THE BILLING FILE. THESE SYSTEMS ARE RECONCILED TO EACH DRAW DOWN.

THE UNIVERSITY HAS CONTROLS IN PLACE TO MONITOR THE USE OF ALL GRANT FUNDS. THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS MATRICULATING AT THE UNIVERSITY. THE DEVELOPMENT AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENTS REVIEW OVERALL USE OF SCHOLARHSIP AND OTHER GRANT FUNDS TO ENSURE THAT THE RECIPIENTS ARE ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE THE FUNDS. ALL FUNDS ISSUED TO THE STUDENTS ARE REQUIRED TO DEFRAY THE COST OF TUITION, ROOM AND BOARD. SINCE THE STUDENTS HAVE NO DISCRETION IN THE USE OF THE FUNDS, THE UNIVERSITY HAS NO NEED TO MONITOR THE GRANTS ONCE THEY ARE ISSUED.
SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATIONS AND STUDENT TRANSCRIPTS ARE REVIEWED AND KEPT ON FILE TO ENSURE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS ARE MET FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED.

GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED UPON APPLICATIONS FILED WITH THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE (FOR RETURNING STUDENTS), AND WITH THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT FOR FIRST SEMESTER ENTERING STUDENTS. THE DETERMINATION AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS IS ON A MERIT OR NEED BASIS. THE DETERMINATION IS ALSO BASED UPON AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS AND CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY A DONOR OR THE COLLEGE. THE SOURCES OF FUNDS COME FROM TUITION, ENDOWMENTS (EITHER RESTRICTED BY A DONOR OR RESTRICTED INTERNALLY BY THE COLLEGE), PRIVATE NON-ENDOWMENT GRANTS, OR GRANTS FROM THE STATE OF TEXAS. ACTUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE REVIEWED MONTHLY AGAINST THE BUDGET AND DIFFERENCES ARE ANALYZED AND RECONCILED. AT THE END OF EACH FISCAL YEAR, THE COLLEGE'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FEDERAL GRANTS AWARDED ARE AUDITED BY AN EXTERNAL AUDIT FIRM. IN ADDITION, THE STATE GRANTS ARE SUBJECT TO A REVIEW OF PROCEDURES BY THE SAME FIRM.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: STUDENTS MUST MEET THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS SPECIFIED IN THE APPLICABLE SCHOLARSHIP IN ORDER TO BE CONSIDERED FOR AWARD. THESE REQUIREMENTS INCLUDE SUCH THINGS AS GRADE POINT AVERAGES, ECONOMIC NEED, ENROLLMENT IN A PARTICULAR PROGRAM, ETC. AS APPLICABLE, THE COLLEGE FOLLOWS FEDERAL, STATE, AND INSTITUTIONAL GUIDELINES FOR AWARDS.

ALL HOOD COLLEGE GRANTS, COLLEGE WORK-STUDY AWARDS, PERKINS LOANS AND MOST STAFFORD LOANS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED. HOOD SCHOLARSHIPS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT AS EVALUATED THROUGH THE STUDENT'S HIGH SCHOOL RECORD AND SAT SCORES. MANY SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS' TOTAL FINANCIAL AID PACKAGES ALSO INTEGRATE NEED BASED AWARDS. ALL GRANTS AND AWARDS REQUIRE REPORTING OF FUND USAGE.

ExplntnTxt: DEMOGRAPHIC-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS : TOTAL FOR AWARD CATEGORY DIVIDED BY AVERAGE AWARD AMOUNT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: Disbursements in furtherance of the University's exempt programs are made in accordance with procedures or subject to conditions established by the institution's governing board designed to insure that individuals and organizations receiving disbursements from the organization in furtherance of its exempt programs are adequately investigated to insure that they are qualifying recipients. Students receiving scholarships, student loans, etc. are judged worthy by the institution's assessment on the basis of academic achievement, financial needs and other similar standards.

SCHOLARSHIPS AND FINANCIAL AID ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND MERIT. FUNDS ARE APPLIED TO INDIVIDUAL ACCOUNTS, AND RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNIVERSITY'S DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY.

The process of packaging financial aid is the culmination of the complete analysis of student need and the aid administration cycle, the process of preparation for packaging is completed accurately and confidentially to ensure effective use of all aid funds available, as well as fair and equitable treatment to all applicants.

THE ADMISSIONS DEPARTMENT ORIGINATES MERIT AWARDS AND DISCOVERY DAY DISCOUNTS FOR NEW STUDENTS, AND THE OFFICE OF DIVERSITY AWARDS THE DIVERSITY SCHOLARSHIPS. FINANCIAL AID WORKS WITH A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE TO EVALUATE APPLICATIONS AND SELECT RECIPIENTS FOR OTHER INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS. NOTICES OF AVAILABLE INSTITUTIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE POSTED OUTSIDE THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AS WELL AS IN VARIOUS INTERNAL PUBLICATIONS AND ON THE UNIVERSITY WEBSITE. RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE, AND ALL AWARDS AND DISCOUNTS ARE POSTED TO STUDENT ACCOUNTS THROUGH FINANCIAL AID.
FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IS AWARDED TO STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF NEED AND/OR MERIT AS DETERMINED BY SEMINARY ADMISSIONS AND FINANCIAL AID PERSONNEL

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: The University enters into their computer system (POISE), as budgeted amounts, the amounts that the Department of Education has allocated to be awarded to eligible students. The Financial Aid Department prints out a fund report from POISE that shows the budget amount, how much has been awarded, and how much is available to be awarded. Then the Financial Aid Department awards to each student who has applied for financial aid and meets the University's qualifications, State, and federal guidelines for financial aid the amount that the student is eligible to receive. The amounts that the student receives are credited to their account at the University, then the University automatically deducts tuition, books, and University fees. If there is a balance remaining, it is then refunded to the student. The Financial Aid Department is audited each year by independent certified public accountants.
Students receiving scholarships are evaluated by the College's assessment of academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: PART I, LINE 2 GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS IN THE U.S. THE UNIVERSITY MAY MAKE DONATIONS TO SUPPORT ITS TOWN OR NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS. IN THESE INSTANCES, THE UNIVERSITY GENERALLY DOES NOT MONITOR THE ULTIMATE USE OF THE FUNDS AS THESE AMOUNTS ARE RESTRICTED GRANTS TO MUNICIPALITIES OR ORGANIZATIONS THAT ARE RECOGNIZED AS BEING DESCRIBED IN INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C).

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE U.S.
ExplntnTxt: FINANCIAL AID IS DETERMINED BASED ON A NEEDS ANALYSIS AND APPLIED TO STUDENT CHARGES THAT SUPPORT COST OF ATTENDANCE. STUDENT CHARGES ARE USED IN SUPPORT OF THE UNIVERSITY'S MISSION.

GRANT EXPENDITURES ARE AUTHORIZED BY THE PI; ACCOUNTING DEPT VERIFIES EXP BEFORE DRAWING FUNDS. GRANTS APPLICABLE TO EACH PROGRAM WITH STANDARDS SET FORTH IN OMB CIRCULAR A-133. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GRANTS TO STUDENTS AND ARE APPLIED DIRECTLY TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT BY THE COLLEGE.

GRANT FUNDS ARE ADMINISTERED IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL AND STATE APPLICABLE REGULATIONS. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED ACCORDING TO ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA INCLUDING SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, CHRISTIAN INVOLVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR TALENT. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ACCOUNTED FOR IN SEPARATE GENERAL LEDGER ACCOUNTS WHICH ARE RECONCILED INTERNALLY. GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AUDITED ANNUALLY IN COMPLIANCE WITH OMB CIRCULAR A-133.

procedure for monitoring use of grants to organizations The university actively monitors all federally sponsored research grants through both its Office of Sponsored Programs (OSP) and its research accounting office. OSP is responsible for monitoring pre-award activities and certain post-award activities, such as human subject participation guidelines, animal research guidelines and export restrictions, among others. The research accounting office monitors all post-award financial activity, including allowability of costs and preparation and submission of federal agency reports on grants. procedure for monitoring use of grants to individuals The university requires all students seeking need-based financial aid and scholarships to complete a financial aid application and the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) form. The university's financial aid staff are trained in the requirements of awarding Title IV funds to students and are required to adhere to these requirements. The university also undergoes an independent A-133 audit to ensure compliance with these requirements.
FINANCIAL AID IS AWARDED TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS IN ACCORDANCE WITH DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION REGULATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS, AND MOUNT CARMEL HEALTH SYSTEM FOUNDATION REQUIREMENTS.

The King's College continuously monitors the academic progress of students receiving scholarship and financial aid funds. All scholarships and financial aid and housing grants are applied directly to the student accounts and therefore, no cash changes hands.
Tuition reductions were given quarterly to all students who enrolled in the License Vocational program at Annenberg School of Nursing and had an acceptable grade in the immediate prior quarter.

OUR HONORS SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO CURRENT STUDENTS ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT. YELLOW RIBBON IS A PARTIAL MATCH OF FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AS PART OF A FEDERAL PROGRAM FOR QUALIFIED STUDENTS. THE OTHER SCHOLARSHIPS ARE GIVEN TO CURRENT STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND/OR ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Scholarships are provided to students based on specific criteria established by student financial services in regards to eligibility, student selection and requirements of the scholarship. Each scholarship recipient will be monitored by the University to confirm that they have satisfied all scholarship requirements. The actual scholarships are credited to the students tuition bills. No scholarships are awarded directly to the student.

DISBURSEMENTS TO STUDENTS RECEIVING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH INSTITUTIONAL PROCEDURES TO ENSURE THAT THOSE RECEIVING AID ARE QUALIFYING RECIPIENTS. FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID OR ASSISTANCE FROM A GOVERNMENTAL AGENCY IS DISTRIBUTED TO STUDENTS USING FEDERALLY APPROVED FINANCIAL NEED ANALYSIS CRITERIA.

The financial aid office at Charleston Southern University requires students to complete the Free Application for Federal Student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for Federal, State and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based upon certain academic credentials or performance in a University sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the University catalog and the University website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitored by the University.

The students complete applications for receipt of scholarship funds to be used for their education. These funds are then applied to their tuition balances. Awards are determined by a scholarship committee. Tuition discounts are also extended to qualified individuals.

TABOR COLLEGE EVALUATES EACH STUDENT FOR FEDERAL AND STATE FINANCIAL AID USING THE INFORMATION ON THE FAFSA FORM AS WELL AS OTHER APPLICATION MATERIALS COMPLETED FOR THEIR INSTITUTIONAL AID OFFERINGS. STUDENTS MUST MEET ALL DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION GUIDELINES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL FINANCIAL AID, INCLUDING LOANS. SUCH GUIDELINES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO, SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS, ATTENDANCE, NUMBER OF HOURS, AND A CLEAN FINANCIAL AID HISTORY. STUDENTS MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR MERIT-BASED AID AND SOME MAY BE ELIGIBLE FOR NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID. IN ADDITION TO BOTH NEED- AND MERIT-BASED QUALIFICATIONS, STUDENTS MUST MEET ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS FOR CERTAIN AID ELEMENTS. ALL DETERMINATIONS ARE MADE BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN CONJUNCTION WITH ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS, ATHLETIC DEPARTMENTS, ADMISSIONS STAFF, AND DEVELOPMENT/ADVANCEMENT STAFF.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: Student aid is based on academic achievement, financial need and other similar standards. The College evaluates student eligibility at the end of each semester for the following term and also before disbursement of financial aid.
TheFilmSchool receives notification from the organization on the films that are produced using the grant funds. TheFilmSchool also receives invitations to the screenings of those films.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WHO ARE ACTIVE IN THE SCHOOL FUNCTIONS AND THE SOCIAL BETTERMENT OF HEALTH PROFESSIONS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS REFLECT AN APPRECIATION OF THE SERVICE COMMITMENT AS WELL AS ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE. GRANTS, LOANS AND SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED, ACADEMIC STATUS, ABILITY TO BENEFIT AND OTHER CRITERIA. DOCUMENTATION OF STUDENT ELIGIBILITY IS MAINTAINED ON FILE IN THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND IS SUBJECT TO ANNUAL INDEPENDENT AUDIT.

GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS. THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS THAT ATTEND ONE OF THE COMPANY'S COLLEGES. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT REVIEWS THE APPLICATIONS FOR THE SCHOLARSHIPS SUBMITTED BY STUDENTS OR PROSPECTIVE STUDENTS, COMPARES THE APPLICATIONS WITH THE WRITTEN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA AND DETERMINES IF THE APPLICANT IS ELIGIBLE AND THEN APPROVES OR REJECTS AN APPLICATION. A WRITTEN RECORD OF THE APPROVALS AND THE AMOUNTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS IS MAINTAINED. THE ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENTS ARE THEN NOTIFIED OF THE AMOUNT OF ANY SCHOLARSHIP AWARDED AND A PRO RATA PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CREDITED TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT ON A MONTHLY BASIS. IF A STUDENT WITHDRAWS FROM THE COLLEGE, THE UNUSED PORTION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP IS CANCELLED.
PERIODIC GRANT REPORTS ARE REQUIRED FROM GRANTEES AND GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS ARE SUBJECT TO INDEPENDENT AUDIT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: MONITORING THE USE OF GRANTS Y Emory University's student aid awards consist of need-based and merit-Based awards. Merit-based funding is awarded based upon donor preferences and restrictions or institutional academic criteria. Need-based aid is awarded based upon institutional methodology, a standard need analysis formula generally practiced by other private, non-profit peer institutions. Student financial aid is awarded to students for educational purposes. Award amounts are controlled by educational costs established by the institution and student progress is evaluated at key points in the student lifecycle if the award has contingencies that require such. Disbursement controls are in place that require direct costs be paid prior to providing refunds for non-direct educational expenses. Emory University is responsible for ensuring that it communicates the relevant and necessary information contained in subcontracted award documents to the subrecipients. The Office of Finance, Grants and Contracts maintains a copy of the Subcontract Agreement, which stipulates the terms of the award and is signed by representatives of both Emory University and the subrecipient organization. This agreement indicates that the subrecipient understands and is aware of the award requirements. In addition, if there are any further changes to the Agreement, an amendment to the agreement is generated and signed by the representative of Emory University and the subrecipient.

DECISIONS REGARDING FINANCIAL AID ARE MADE BY THE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL AID TO APPLICANTS WHO, WITHOUT SUCH AID, WOULD BE UNABLE TO ATTEND THE UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS
ExplntnTxt: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 IN THE UNITED STATES SOKA UNIVERSITY OF AMERICA SERVES AS A CONDUIT TO RECEIVE AND DISBURSE STUDENT AID FUNDS FROM GOVERNMENTAL AGENCIES SUCH AS THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION UNDER THE FOLLOWING PROGRAMS: - FEDERAL SUPPLEMENTAL EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY GRANT - FEDERAL PELL AWARD GRANT PROGRAM - FEDERAL WORK STUDY - GI BILL INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS ARE AWARDED BY SOKA UNIVERSITY OF AMERICA TO ELIGIBLE STUDENTS WHO MEET SPECIFIC ACADEMIC AND ACHIEVEMENT CRITERIA. THE PURPOSES OF THESE GRANTS ARE CLEARLY COMMUNICATED TO THE RECIPIENTS AND ARE INTERNALLY USED FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES.
FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN (B) THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS REPORTED IN COLUMN (B) IS DETERMINED BY REVIEWING THE EXACT NUMBER OF STUDENTS WHO RECEIVED THE TYPE OF AID INDICATED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
ExplntnTxt: TO RECEIVE A STIPEND, THE INDIVIDUAL MUST BE A STUDENT AND MEET THE REQUIRED GUIDELINE FROM THE AWARDING AGENCY. EACH DEPARTMENT CHAIR VERIFIES THAT THE STUDENT MEETS THE AWARDING AGENCY'S GUIDELINES. THE BUSINESS OFFICE MONITORS THE PAYMENTS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED ON SPECIFIC GUIDELINES CREATED BY THE SOURCE OF FUNDING. THE FINANCIAL AID DEPARTMENT DETERMINES ELIGIBILITY AND MONITORS USE OF FUNDS.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: MERCY COLLEGE OF OHIO FOLLOWS THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION FOR TITLE IV GRANTS AND THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE OHIO BOARD OF REGENTS FOR ALL STATE GRANTS.

Procedures for monitoring the use of the grants funds:The Financial Aid office determines if a student is eligible to receive a scholarship from the University and if eligible, will apply the approved scholarship payment to the respective students tuition account. No checks are issued to the students directly. Funds are monitored to ensure they are used for their intended purpose.
The Business Office receives a copy of all grant contacts and reconciles project expenses monthly.

Schedule I, Part I, Line 1 The grants department and the financial aid office oversee all grants, government loans and scholarship expenditures. All grant expenses are approved and reimbursed in accordance with University policy. An annual audit is conducted in accordance with governmental regulations. To the extent the Institute offers scholarships to its students, those funds may only be used to defray the cost of matriculation and may not be spent at the student's discretion.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The financial aid office notifies students when our comprehensive endowment scholarship application goes live (first week of february). Once notified, students fill out an application to apply for the respective scholarship. If the scholarship is for a specific program, the dean or other faculty member for that program will review the applications and make recommendations to the financial aid office and who should receive the award. Financial aid verifies again if the student is still eligible for the award and issues the funds to the recommended students. The financial aid office monitors the use of the funds to ensure that they are used for their intended purpose.

ICAHN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT MOUNT SINAI AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AS EITHER NEED-BASED OR MERIT-BASED AWARDS. TO AWARD OR ADMINISTER NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS, THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID FOLLOWS FEDERAL GUIDELINES STARTING WITH THE EVALUATION OF EACH STUDENT FOR "NEED" BASED ON FAFSA & NEED-ACCESS REPORTS. MERIT-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BY COMMITTEES ESTABLISHED BY THE DEAN OF THE SCHOOL. ONCE AWARDEES ARE CHOSEN, THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED THROUGH THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID. ELIGIBILITY FOR EACH ACADEMIC YEAR (SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS AND CURRENT ENROLLMENT) IS VERIFIED BY THE DIRECTOR PRIOR TO INITIAL DISBURSEMENT OF ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND ELIGIBILITY IS VERIFIED AGAIN FOR THE JANUARY TERM BEFORE SECOND TERM DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE.

FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE FUNDED THROUGH A VARIETY OF SOURCES. IT IS INTENDED THAT THE VARIOUS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS BE USED TO RECOGNIZE ACADEMIC, ATHLETIC, SERVANT LEADERSHIP, AND SPECIAL ACHIEVEMENT AND TO MEET FINANCIAL NEEDS OR PROVIDE SELF-HELP OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH STUDENT WORK-STUDY PROGRAMS AND PARENT/STUDENT LOANS. WHILE IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO GUARANTEE THAT FUNDING WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR EVERY NEEDY APPLICANT, THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS AT THE UNIVERSITY ARE DESIGNED TO HELP COVER THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE DIRECT COST OF ATTENDING THE UNIVERSITY AND THE STUDENTS OWN RESOURCES. EACH APPLICATION IS REVIEWED BASED UPON AN INDIVIDUAL ASSESSMENT IN ORDER TO DETERMINE THE TYPE OF RESOURCES THAT WILL BEST SERVE THE STUDENT.

PART I, LINE 2 ONE OF THE UNIVERSITYS HIGHEST PRIORITIES IS TO REMAIN AFFORDABLE AND ACCESSIBLE TO THE MOST TALENTED STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF THEIR FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. THE UNIVERSITYS ADMISSION PROCESS FOR UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS FROM THE UNITED STATES IS NEED-BLIND, WHICH MEANS THAT STUDENTS ARE ADMITTED IRRESPECTIVE OF THEIR ABILITY TO PAY; THE UNIVERSITY PROVIDES THE FINANCIAL AID NECESSARY TO MAKE STANFORD AFFORDABLE TO EVERY ADMITTED STUDENT. FOR INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS, THE UNIVERSITY IS NEED-AWARE: STANFORD ANALYZES THE NEED FOR AID AND AIMS TO MEET THE DETERMINED NEED. SINCE 2000, THE UNIVERSITY HAS CONTINUED TO ENHANCE ITS FINANCIAL AID PROGRAMS FOR BOTH ITS UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS. CURRENTLY, FAMILIES WITH TYPICAL ASSETS FROM THE U.S. WITH INCOMES BELOW $125,000 PAY NO TUITION, AND THOSE WITH INCOMES BELOW $65,000 PAY NO TUITION, ROOM OR BOARD. IN FY16, APPROXIMATELY HALF OF UNDERGRADUATES WERE AWARDED NEED-BASED FINANCIAL AID FROM STANFORD. GRADUATE STUDENT FINANCIAL AID AND OTHER SUPPORT IS AWARDED BASED ON ACADEMIC MERIT AND THE AVAILABILITY OF AID. IN THE FACE OF DIMINISHING FEDERAL SUPPORT, STANFORD HAS ASSUMED MORE OF THE FINANCIAL WEIGHT OF SUPPORTING ITS GRADUATE STUDENTS. IN FY16, APPROXIMATELY 82% OF GRADUATE STUDENTS RECEIVED FINANCIAL SUPPORT. THE KNIGHT-HENNESSY SCHOLARS PROGRAM WILL BE AN ADDITIONAL SOURCE OF GRADUATE STUDENT SUPPORT WHEN ITS FIRST COHORT BEGINS THEIR STUDIES IN FALL 2018. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES FULL FUNDING FOR THREE YEARS TO ENABLE GRADUATE STUDENTS TO PURSUE ADVANCED DEGREES AND DEVELOP THE CAPACITY TO LEAD AND BRING ABOUT POSITIVE CHANGES IN THE WORLD. THE UNIVERSITY IS ALSO MINDFUL OF STUDENT DEBT, AND IT DOES NOT EXPECT STUDENTS TO BORROW TO MEET THEIR NEED. OVER 75 PERCENT OF STANFORD UNDERGRADUATES GRADUATE WITH NO DEBT. FOR THOSE WHO BORROW, MEDIAN DEBT IN 2015 WAS $16,417. THE TOTAL FINANCIAL AID INCLUDES $269,613,294 IN MERIT AND NEED-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS. AN ADDITIONAL $144,127,248 REFLECTS AMOUNTS PAID FOR ADDITIONAL FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO STUDENTS, INCLUDING PAYMENTS FOR HEALTH INSURANCE, LIVING EXPENSES, AND SUPPORT OF POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWS. THESE AMOUNTS INCLUDE $233,001 IN GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS OUTSIDE THE UNITED STATES. GRANTS LISTED IN PART II ARE PRIMARILY GRANTS MADE FROM DONOR ADVISED FUNDS MANAGED BY STANFORD AND ARE BASED ON RECOMMENDATIONS BY DONORS OF THOSE FUNDS AND REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY SENIOR OFFICIALS IN THE OFFICE OF DEVELOPMENT. SUB-GRANTS STANFORD OCCASIONALLY RECEIVES GRANT SUPPORT THAT IS DISBURSED TO OTHER INDIVIDUALS OR ENTITIES PER THE TERMS OF THE AWARD. IN MOST CASES, PRIOR TO THE GRANT TO STANFORD, THE UNIVERSITY WILL PROVIDE THE GRANTING ENTITY WITH A LIST OF SUCH CONTEMPLATED RECIPIENTS. GENERALLY, AS WORK ON THE GRANT PROGRESSES, CHANGES TO THESE RECIPIENTS MUST BE APPROVED BY THE GRANTING AGENCY. DUE TO THESE REVIEW REQUIREMENTS OF THE GRANTING AGENCY, STANFORD DOES NOT REPORT SUCH PAYMENTS ON FORM 990, SCHEDULE I.
THE COLLEGE HAS A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTTEE THAT SELECTS ALL SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS. THE COLLEGE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS BASED ON NEED.
The funds are used as scholarships at Gratz College and are directly credited to the recipient's tuition.
The university has a specific department related to student financial aid that tracks all scholarships and grant funds disbursed to students.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: form 990, schedule i, part i, line 2
ExplntnTxt: THE INSTITUTE'S GRANTS AND ASSISTANCE WITHIN THE UNITED STATES CONSISTS PRIMARILY OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS AWARDED TO STUDENTS. STUDENTS ARE SELECTED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND FELLOWSHIPS BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND SIMILAR STANDARDS. VARIOUS INSTITUTE OFFICES MONITOR ELIGIBILITY AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS BY GRANTEES. THE INSTITUTE MAKES AN ANNUAL $75,000 GRANT TO THE CALTECH Y. IN ADDITION, THE INSTITUTE ALLOWS THE CALTECH Y THE USE OF FACILITIES ON CAMPUS FREE OF CHARGE. THE CALTECH Y IS A RELATED ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS TO SUPPORT THE STUDENTS OF CALTECH THROUGH VARIOUS ACTIVITIES. THE INSTITUTE MAKES AN ANNUAL DONATION (DESIGNATED ASSISTANCE) TO THE UNITED WAY OF GREATER LOS ANGELES. INSTITUTE OFFICES MONITOR THE GRANTEE'S PERFORMANCE ACCORDING TO THEIR RESPECTIVE PROGRAM SERVICES GOALS AND/OR PURSUANT TO OTHER AGREEMENTS. FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART III, COLUMN (C) CASH GRANTS REPRESENT CREDIT ON ACCOUNTS.
SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED BASED CRITERIA ESTABLISHED BY EACH SCHOLARSHIP AND DETERMINED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE.
STUDENT FINANCIAL AID APPLICATIONS ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY IN ORDER TO ENSURE GRANT FUNDS ARE AWARDED APPROPRIATELY BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL AWARD CRITERIA.

Monitoring the Use of Grants On rare occasion, the University will match funds raised by students for worthy charitable projects. All such funds are reviewed carefully by the VP for Student Life and approved by the President upon the recommendation of the Student Government Association. Other grants may be permitted in furtherance of the University's mission and are approved by the President.

Grants and Other Assistance to Individuals The University has financial aid available in many forms, including scholarships and grants. The eligibility for financial aid is based upon student's achievement and promise, academic credentials and financial need.
HALLMARK MAKES GRANTS TO WORTHY ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE THE SAME BELIEFS AS THE UNIVERSITY.

THE UNIVERSITY ATTEMPTS TO MAKE ADEQUATE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS WITHIN THE LIMITS OF EACH STUDENT BUDGET AND THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS. AWARDS ARE BASED ON ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, PROFESSIONAL PROMISE, LEADERSHIP POTENTIAL, FINANCIAL NEED AND/OR SPECIFIC GUIDELINES ESTABLISHED BY DONORS. FINANCIAL NEED IS DETERMINED ON THE BASIS OF INFORMATION PROVIDED BY THE FREE APPLICATION FOR FEDERAL STUDENT AID (FAFSA). ADDITIONALLY, THE UNIVERSITY MAKES AVAILABLE FEDERAL WORK STUDY FUNDS TO STUDENTS IN WHICH ELIGIBLE AWARD AMOUNTS ARE ALSO BASED ON FINANCIAL NEED INFORMATION PROVIDED WITHIN THE FAFSA. WORK STUDY EXPENDED AND AVAILABLE FUNDS ARE TRACKED AND REVIEWED THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THE UNIVERSITY ALSO ASSISTED BY PROVIDING FUNDS FOR GENERAL OPERATIONAL SUPPORT TO THE HEALTH EDUCATION AND RESIDENCY TRAINING NETWORK, A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED TO PROMOTE AND SUPPORT COLLABORATION OF MEMBER MEDICAL AND EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS IN EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR MEDICAL STUDENTS,INTERNS AND RESIDENTS.

GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY VARIOUS AREAS. FINANCIAL AID GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID DIRECTOR TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE WITH ELIGIBILITY, SELECTION, AND DISTRIBUTION. DOCUMENTATION IS MAINTAINED AND AUDITED ANNUALLY. OTHER DEPARTMENT GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE RESPONSIBLE PARTY TO ENSURE THAT EXPENDITURES COMPLY WITH GRANT REQUIREMENTS AND ARE NOT DIVERTED FOR OTHER USES. THE NC BUDGET OFFICE REQUIRES PERIODIC REPORTING FOR ALL GRANTS. THE REPORTING IS COMPLETED BY THE RESPONSIBLE DEPARTMENT AND THEN ENTERED INTO THE STATE WEBSITE BY THE CONTROLLER ANNUALLY.

PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS: USE OF GRANT FUNDING MUST COMPLY WITH THE INSTITUTION'S PURCHASING POLICY AND FEDERAL GUIDELINES. PRIMARY INVESTIGATORS ARE ULTIMATELY RESPONSIBLE FOR THE USE OF THOSE FUNDS UNDER THE REVIEW OF THE CONTRACT AND GRANTS ACCOUNTING MANAGER THAT MONITORS THEIR COMPLIANCE. IN ADDITION, THE COLLEGE IS SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT (UNIFORM GUIDANCE) ENSURING AN OUTSIDE OPINION ON THE INSTITUTION'S POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.

Gardner-Webb University practices a yearly review (at the end of the Spring Semester) to monitor all students awarded an Institutional Scholarship based on the following criteria: 1) enrollment status 2) housing status 3) GPA 4) maintaining Satisfactory Academic Progress in accordance with the University's policy.

DOANE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO QUALIFIED STUDENTS ACCORDING TO POLICY CRITERIA WHICH RECOGNIZE FACTORS SUCH AS ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, SPECIAL ABILITIES, AND FINANCIAL NEED AS DETERMINED BY A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE. RESTRICTED GRANT FUNDS WITH SPECIFIC AWARD CRITERIA ARE ADMINISTERED BY FINANCIAL AID TO SELECT STUDENTS WHO MEET THE CRITERIA OF THE GRANT.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 - Org.'s Proc. for Mon. the Use of Grant Funds
ExplntnTxt: Although IU Health Arnett does not monitor the use of grant funds once distributed, through due diligence the organization has reasonably confirmed that the entities to which the contributions are made are highly reputable in the community and use the funds for the purposes intended.

ALL STUDENT AWARDS ARE MAINTAINED IN THE UNIVERSITY'S FINANCIAL AID SOFTWARE SYSTEM. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE BASED ON FINANCIAL AND OTHER DATA PROVIDED BY THE STUDENT AND VERIFIED, AS APPROPRIATE, BY THE UNIVERSITY. FEDERAL AWARDS ARE SUBJECT TO AN ANNUAL AUDIT BASED ON STANDARDS FOUND IN THE UNIFORM GUIDANCE AND PERFORMED BY AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR DONOR-FUNDED SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MOSTLY DETERMINED BY THE DONOR AND IS AVAILABLE IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. SELECTION CRITERIA FOR FEDERAL AND STATE AID IS ALSO FOUND IN THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AND AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ON THE INTERNET.

The Academy provides scholarships to individuals to attend the Academy. Scholarship receipients are selected based on a written application which is reviewed by the Academy's faculty and staff. Scholarships are awarded based on a combination of student financial need, academic merit, and other factors and are applied directly to the student's account as a reduction in tuition and fees. The Academy monitors each recipient student to ensure that he/she remains an active, enrolled student and satisfies the academic and other criteria for maintaining the scholarship.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2:
ExplntnTxt: CAMPBELL UNIVERSITY PARTICIPATES IN BOTH FEDERAL AND STATE GRANT PROGRAMS. ALL GRANT PROGRAMS INCLUDE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS, REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AND FUND MANAGEMENT REGULATIONS AND GUIDELINES. STUDENTS ARE AWARDED ACCORDING TO EACH PROGRAM'S GUIDELINES ONCE ELIGIBILITY HAS BEEN DETERMINED FOR THAT FUND. ELIGIBILITY IS REVIEWED BEFORE TRANSMITTAL/DISBURSEMENT TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT. EACH FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAM HAS PREDETERMINED REPORTING GUIDELINES AND STANDARDS. THE FUNDS ARE RECONCILED AND FUND BUDGETS ARE REVIEWED MONTHLY.
THE COLLEGE OF FELLOWS REQUIRES TWO REPORTS EACH YEAR FROM THE RECIPIENTS. THOSE REPORTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.
Policy guides, accounting software, and annual audit.
GRANTS ARE ISSUED TO COVER THE EDUCATION COST OF THE WCMS PROGRAMS.

THE UNIVERSITY AWARDS BOTH INSTITUTIONALLY-FUNDED FINANCIAL AID TO STUDENTS AS WELL AS FINANCIAL AID FUNDED FROM PRIVATE GIFTS AND VARIOUS FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON AN EQUAL, OBJECTIVE AND NONDISCRIMINATORY BASIS USING ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, FINANCIAL NEED, AND OTHER SIMILAR STANDARDS. THE UNIVERSITY MAINTAINS SEPARATE ACCOUNTING FOR ALL GRANTS AND STRICTLY MONITORS THAT ANY DISBURSEMENTS ARE MADE ONLY FOR THE INTENDED PURPOSE OF THE GRANT AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE GRANT REQUIREMENTS. AN AUDIT OF THE UNIVERSITY'S FEDERALLY FUNDED PROGRAMS IS CONDUCTED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S EXTERNAL AUDITORS, AS REQUIRED BY TITLE 2 U.S. CODE OF FEDERAL REGULATIONS PART 200, UNIFORM ADMINISTRATIVE REQUIREMENTS, COST PRINCIPLES, AND AUDIT REQUIREMENTS FOR FEDERAL AWARDS AND GOVERNMENT AUDITING STANDARDS AND RELATED INFORMATION.

THE COLLEGE MONITORS THE SCHOLARSHIP ASSISTANCE PROGRAM BY REVIEWING EACH GRANTOR'S REQUIRED SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA AND THEN HAVING THE STUDENT FILL OUT A SCHOLARSHIP APPLICATION IN ORDER TO SEE IF THE STUDENT MEETS THE CRITERIA. THE COLLEGE HAS A SCHOLARSHIP COMMITTEE WHO REVIEWS THE APPLICATIONS AND CRITERIA AND APPROVES SCHOLARSHIPS FOR EACH STUDENT.

FORM 990, SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2 LONG ISLAND UNIVERSITY OFFERS A NUMBER OF INSTITUTIONAL GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO QUALIFYING STUDENTS ENROLLED IN BOTH DEGREE AND NON-DEGREE PROGRAMS. EACH GRANT OR OTHER FORM OF ASSISTANCE HAS SPECIFIC AWARDING CRITERIA AND INDIVIDUAL RULES FOR SELECTION BASED ON MERIT, NEED, AND/OR PERFORMANCE. THESE REQUIREMENTS ARE PUBLISHED EACH YEAR AND ARE ADMINISTERED BY THE CAMPUS FINANCIAL AID OFFICES WHICH ARE ALSO RESPONSIBLE FOR AWARDING AND POSTING TRANSACTIONS TO INDIVIDUAL STUDENT ACCOUNTS. THE DISBURSAL OF FUNDS IS SEGREGATED AND PERFORMED BY THE CENTRAL FINANCIAL AID OFFICE OF THE UNIVERSITY. IN ADDITION, INTERNAL CONTROLS ARE IN PLACE TO ENSURE AMOUNTS ARE AWARDED ACCURATELY TO STUDENTS WHO PROPERLY MEET AND MAINTAIN ELIGIBILITY CRITERIA. ACCOUNTING TRANSACTIONS ARE ROUTINELY RECONCILED THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY'S ERP SYSTEM AND STUDENT ACCOUNTS ARE CONSISTENTLY MONITORED BY ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF.

SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED ON THE BASIS OF SCHOLASTIC ABILITY, PERSONAL PRESENTATION SKILLS AND FINANCIAL NEED. STUDENTS MUST MAINTAIN A MINIMUM GPA OF 2.5 TO QUALIFY FOR CONSIDERATION FOR ANY ADDITIONAL SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING.

ANY SCHOLARSHIPS/GRANTS TO STUDENTS ARE DETERMINED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE IN WHICH EACH STUDENT FILE IS REVIEWED IN ACCORDANCE WITH DESIGNATED ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIPS OR GRANTS. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS ARE THEN MONITORED BY DISBURSING FUNDS FROM THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO THE STUDENT ACCOUNT OFFICE.

All funds are awarded through the college's financial aid office and posted directly to the students' accounts by the student accounts office. Students may be awarded grant funds on the basis of academic achievement and/or financial need. In each case the student can retain eligibility for funding for as many as eight semesters as a full-time student, provided the student meets the renewal criteria such as grade point average and grade procession as outlined in the student handbook. An individual student may not receive more than the cost of tuition from the institutional grant funds. A reconciliation is done regularly between the two departments/systems to ensure accuracy and proper use of the funds. In addition, an annual audit is performed by an outside accounting firm to review compliance with all federal, state and institutional policies and procedures.

GRANTS CONSIST OF STUDENT FINANCIAL AID. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE REVIEWS SCHOLARSHIP CRITERIA AND ELIGIBILITY EACH SEMESTER FOR EVERY STUDENT. WITHDRAWALS FROM CLASSES REQUIRE THE STUDENT TO HAVE A FORM SIGNED BY THE ACADEMIC OFFICE, THE BUSINESS OFFICE, AND THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE. THE AMOUNT OF SCHOLARSHIPS GRANTED IS PRO-RATED BASED ON FEDERAL REGULATIONS.

THE UNIVERSITY DOES NOT GIVE ANY NON-CASH SCHOLARSHIPS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISBURSED TO STUDENTS THROUGH CREDITING THEIR STUDENT ACCOUNTS. IF THE STUDENT HAS EXCESS SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS AS THE RESULT OF TITLE IV AID, THEN THESE FUNDS ARE AUTOMATICALLY DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK WITHIN FOURTEEN DAYS. IF THE EXCESS FUNDS ARE THE RESULT OF SOMETHING OTHER THAN TITLE IV AID, THE STUDENT MUST REQUEST A REFUND AND THESE FUNDS ARE DISBURSED TO THE STUDENT BY CHECK. THE UNIVERSITY'S PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING GRANT FUNDS IN THE U.S. ARE AS FOLLOWS: THE UNIVERSITY HAS APPOINTED DIRECTORS, WHO REPORT TO THE APPROPRIATE VICE PRESIDENTS OVER ALL FEDERAL GRANT PROGRAMS. THESE DIRECTORS ARE CHARGED WITH PERFORMING ALL GRANT-RELATED ACTIVITIES INCLUDING APPLICATION, MONITORING OF EXPENDITURES AND REPORTING, WITH THE EXCEPTION OF DRAW-DOWNS OF FEDERAL FUNDS. DRAW-DOWNS ARE PERFORMED BY THE UNIVERSITY'S CONTROLLER AFTER REQUESTS ARE MADE BY THE DIRECTOR TO THE CONTROLLER. THE CONTROLLER REVIEWS THE REQUESTS FOR DRAW-DOWNS, WHICH INCLUDE DOCUMENTATION OF ALL DIRECT AND INDIRECT PROGRAM EXPENSES, BEFORE MAKING THE DRAW-DOWNS. A SINGLE AUDIT IS PERFORMED ANNUALLY BY THE UNIVERSITY'S INDEPENDENT AUDITORS.

EARTH University Foundation was formed to support the educational mission of the Escuela de Agricultura de La Region Tropical Humeda through generous gifts from the global community and other programs and initiatives. The Foundation is a registered 501(c)(3) public charity headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. EARTH University is an international institution created out of a deep conviction that the environmental and social challenges confronting the planet can be resolved through education that promotes science, technology and entrepreneurship while focusing on essential human values, leadership and a commitment to social and environmental service. The University provides support to the Earth University Foundation to cover administrative expenses. The Foundation intends that most of the money it raises be directed to the University to support its educational mission. The University requires periodic reports from the Foundation on the expenses it incurs and the manner in which it is using monies provided by the University. Since the Foundation's primary exempt purpose is to support the University's mission, there is no concern that monies sent to the Foundation will be used other than for a purpose that furthers the University's mission.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2 Procedures for monitoring use of grant funds.
ExplntnTxt: The College awards institutional grants and scholarships to enrolled students. Students file a FAFSA form to be considered for a grant award. The majority of the grant awards are need-based as defined by Federal Formula. Scholarships are awarded according to donor specifications.

WAGNER COLLEGE MONITORS THE USE OF SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES BY ENSURING THAT ALL STUDENTS WHO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIP MONIES ARE ALWAYS REGISTERED AS STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE. MANY DEPARTMENTS WITHIN THE COLLEGE WORK IN CONJUNCTION TO ENSURE THAT SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS ARE MONITORED EFFICIENTLY AND EFFECTIVELY. THE ADMISSIONS OFFICE REVIEWS ALL STUDENT APPLICATIONS, AND DETERMINES WHO IS ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS. THE FINANCE AND BUSINESS OFFICE DRAWS DOWN FUNDS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS TO STUDENTS, AND THE REGISTRAR'S OFFICE MONITORS AND MAINTAINS ALL RECORDS REGARDING THE REGISTERED STATUS OF STUDENTS. PART III, LINE 1, COLUMN B WAGNER COLLEGE ESTIMATES THAT APPROXIMATELY 90% OF ALL FULL-TIME STUDENTS RECEIVE SOME SORT OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE from THE COLLEGE. THEREFORE, THE NUMBER OF RECIPIENTS OF GRANTS AND OTHER ASSISTANCE BY WAGNER COLLEGE IS ESTIMATED BY TAKING 90% OF THE TOTAL FTE ENROLLMENT FOR THE FALL 2015 SEMESTER (2,081 FTES), RESULTING IN APPROXIMATELY 1,900 RECIPIENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY'S USE OF GRANT FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL AID TO OUR STUDENTS. WE MONITOR THE USE OF THESE UNIVERSITY FUNDS IN ACCORDANCE WITH ESTABLISHED LEVELS OF AWARDS BASED ON A STUDENT'S MERIT CLASSIFICATION AND ON AN ANNUAL BUDGET. THE UNIVERSITY FOLLOWS ALL REGULATIONS RELATIVE TO THE AWARDING OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WHICH IS MONITORED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE.
The College provides scholarships under an application process.
Stetson University ensures each scholarship is used for its intended purpose by applying the award amount directly to the recipient's student ledger.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
ExplntnTxt: PART III GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS - REGARDING THE MONITORING OF GRANTS\SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS, ALL SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED TO STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED AND ELIGIBLE FOR THE AWARDED AMOUNTS. THE AWARDS ARE APPLIED BY THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICE TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT.THE SCHOLARSHIPS ARE APPLIED AND USED TO PAY FOR THE EDUCATIONAL COSTS AS DESCRIBED BY THE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP FUNDS.

Most grants and scholarships administered by Bellin College follow a scoring grid based on a variety of factors. Some are automatic based on the incoming students academic record and other require the student to apply for the scholarship. The bursar and director of financial aid reconcile awards/payments on a regular basis to ensure accuracy on students' accounts.

FINANCIAL AID AWARDS TO STUDENTS AT POINT PARK UNIVERSITY ARE DETERMINED ON THE BASIS OF ACADEMIC ACHIEVEMENT, COMMUNITY SERVICE, ARTISTIC OR ATHLETIC TALENT AND FINANCIAL NEED ELIGIBILITY. GRANTS AND LOANS ARE DISTRIBUTED USING POWERFAIDS APPLICATION AND POSTED TO STUDENT'S ACCOUNTS IN JENZABAR (HIGHER EDUCATION INFORMATION SYSTEM). ANNUALLY THE FINANCIAL AID AREA IS AUDITED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM.

THE RESEARCH AWARDS ARE SELECTED BY THE KANSAS STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION IN SUPPORT OF PATENTED TECHNOLOGIES REQUIRING ADDITIONAL TESTING OR EXPERIMENTATION. THE FUNDS ARE DEPOSITED INTO A RESTRICTED FEES ACCOUNT. THE FUNDS ARE TRACKED IN A SEPARATE GL ACCOUNT FOR THE RESERVE AND THIS IS WEHRE THE DETAIL OF USE OF THE FUNDS IS TRACKED.
Grants are awarded to individuals based on compliance with eligibility requirements. Award grant and assistance amounts are applied by the University to the student tuition billing.
ALL GRANTS ARE USED TO PAY TUITION AT THE COLLEGE.
